jobs.title: Founding full stack developer. Paid role with options

jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer


TransferWise is an international money transfer startup with over 1 million customers worldwide. Co-founded by Skype’s first employee, the innovative platform is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Sir Richard Branson, and PayPal founder Max Levchin, and led by an experienced team, including Paypal’s former Director of Product and Google Europe’s former Head of Finance. We're disrupting the world of international money transfers with transparency and low fees.


Product engineers only


Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production without considering value and impact.


We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results.  We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world.  They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.


What you’ll be working on:



  • TransferWise is complex under the hood, but we’re just getting started. With our own payment rails, there are lots of opportunities to build new products and services on them.

  • At its core, our stack is Java microservices, using Netflix OSS offerings, and SPAs written in Angular 1/React, with a legacy Grails monolith. We are moving quickly to proven distributed technologies that can be scaled (Kafka, Zookeeper, Eureka, Bouncer +  much more)
    More details: http://tech.transferwise.com/the-transferwise-stack-heartbeat-of-our-little-revolution/

  • Integrating with a variety of partners and providers across the world, so our customers can send money across borders with minimal fuss and maximum confidence

  • Getting to the core of the customer’s problems by conducting interviews, answering support and figure out what TransferWise is to the customer and how it can be improved

  • What do you want to be working on? Autonomous teams come up with their own plans, there is no hierarchy telling you what to do.


Benefits:


Apart from the all-expenses-paid company trips, stock options in one of Europe’s most hotly tipped startups, a laptop and team lunches every other Thursday, you won’t get much in the way of extras. However, we will give you 28 days holiday a year (plus public holidays), a fun, friendly atmosphere, plenty of opportunities to grow and the chance to be part of our little revolution. Oh, and coffee, there’s plenty of coffee.


Not from Estonia? - No stress, we will help you (and your family) to relocate from any part of the world!
jobs.title: Transferwise is looking for Full Stack Devs with an awesome product mindset!

jobs.content: We are looking for an experienced full-stack engineer who wants to make an impact. We’re a fashion company but you won’t have to wear the latest Karl Lagerfeld. A hoodie or your favorite Docker shirt will do just fine. You don’t even need to like fashion at all, but a certain admiration for Ken Thompson, Rob Pike or Martin Fowler is always appreciated. You don’t speak German? No big deal, we use English as our main language.
jobs.title: Really,Really Good Software Engineer

jobs.content:
Our Operations Team is responsible for both the external, customer-oriented systems as well as for the internal IT infrastructure. As the Team Lead for Operations at InterNations your role will encompass leading the Operations Team and organizing its workflows and processes.


As the Team Lead of Operations at InterNations, you will:



  • play a large role in shaping the system architecture and ensure the high stability and scalability of our internal and customer-oriented systems

  • be responsible for the monitoring and operation of our infrastructure, systems, and services (incl. Nginx, MySQL, PHP, RabbitMQ, Solr)

  • guarantee the smooth operation of our internal IT together with your Help Desk Team

  • gladly pass along your know-how and experience to your team and act as a liaison between your team and other departments


You meet the following requirements:



  • a degree in IT or other relevant technical training with at least 5 years of work experience

  • experience with Linux (Debian) and MySQL administration

  • knowledge of the automation of deployments (CI/CD) and configuration management (e.g. Ansible/Puppet/Chef)

  • experience with networks, firewalls, web server administration, virtualization, load balancing, monitoring, high availability solutions and scripting (e.g. bash, PHP, Ruby)

  • ability to work under pressure, pragmatic, communicative, and have experience leading a team

  • very good German and English skills


We offer:



  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings


Are you the right one for the job?


Then send us your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:


jobs@internations.org
jobs.title: Team Lead Operations

jobs.content:
Our engineering teams architect, develop and test our social network. As a Senior Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for building awesome frontends, assuring their quality and running them in a production environment in an interdisciplinary team of different specialists.


As a Senior Frontend Developer at InterNations, you will:



  • implement and architect web applications in HTML, CSS and JavaScript in a Scrum team

  • identify and communicate front-end best practices

  • build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions

  • test your code with automated tests

  • take part in expanding, documenting and implementing our UX pattern library

  • work with Product Management on the feasibility of upcoming changes


You meet the following requirements:



  • expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypal inheritance, scoping, and closures

  • familiarity beyond ES5 (e.g. ES6, TypeScript, CoffeeScript) 

  • you care about consistency of design and dislike having ten different buttons on a single page

  • you like fast web applications and know how to optimize them

  • experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially React and Backbone is a plus but deep JavaScript knowledge is way more important

  • you want to learn new things: technology, practices, user interactions

  • you have an interest in coordinating cross-team efforts and initiatives

  • a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience as a frontend developer

  • familiarity with automated testing, be it unit-, functional- and/or acceptance testing


We offer:



  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit and regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings

  • support with visa and work permit application

  • we only need to support IE 10+


Sound interesting?


Then start the conversation by sending in your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:jobs@internations.org

Please include in your cover letter a list of projects you contributed to and are proud of. We also like to hear about what kind of work environment you aspire for and what technologies you find interesting right now.

jobs.content:
Are you an Android engineer who would love to work with a highly-skilled, fast-paced team? Yearn for the excitement of being part of one of Australia's hottest and well-funded technology startups?

At Canva, we’re transforming the way the world designs. Our mission is to make beautiful design possible for everyone. But making design simple is not easy and we need to continue to build a world-class team to pursue the many huge opportunities in front of us. So if you want to play a key role in one of the world’s fastest growing startups, this job could be for you.

Due to incredible growth throughout the past three years, we are now seeking to build one of Sydney’s best Android software development teams to bring the Canva platform to Android users. This is an opportunity to make waves in the mobile world by delivering a world class product to millions and be one of the first Android Engineers at Canva.

Beautiful engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture across the entire organization. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. The engineering team takes pride in its focus on engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcomes self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure. Frequently, engineers host sessions where a new idea or software engineering practice is discussed – this ensures that everyone in the team is constantly learning.

Our front end servers and back end servers are all written in Java, using a mix of SQL and NoSQL stores.

Role:

  • Work closely with designers and product managers to deliver Canva's Android offering
  • Create and ship high quality code that gets used by millions of people all over the world
  • Participate in design and code reviews; contribute to the look and feel of the Android application
  • Engage in in-depth technically and product design discussions with the team
  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks - with passion for performance debugging and benchmarking
  • Collaborate with other team members to determine the best solutions to difficult engineering and user experience problems.

Requirement:

  • Demonstrated Android application development experience.
  • Deep knowledge of native Android architecture, frameworks, and the SDK / Android Studio
  • Strong Java Development Skills
  • Strong knowledge of web stacks, networking, and Linux / Unix systems administration
  • Be comfortable working with a wide range of development tools in an Agile Environment
  • Strong Computer Science / Software Engineering fundamentals
  • Excellent problem solving skills, with a creative and analytic mind

Benefits:

  • Knowledge of UI frameworks (either Android, iOS, XML), MVP application design and complex, reactive touch based UI.
  • Exposure to large, complex, highly-scalable environments hosted on AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
  • Currently have or have previously worked on applications available on the Google Play Store
  • Experience building for other mobile platforms such as Apple iOS
  • A passion for beautiful design and engaging user experience

This is an opportunity to progress your career (and hold equity/stock options) in one of the fastest growing startups in the world. It is an opportunity to share in our highly collaborative work environment, in-house chefs, company trips / events, and engineering-first culture. We are seeking the best in the world and will provide a relocation allowance for overseas and interstate candidates as well as visa sponsorship for Australia.

Side note: Do you know we have a chef, Song, that makes fantastic lunches for the team? You can actually see what he's whipping up on Instagram: https://instagram.com/canvavibe/

Oh, and check out Engineering Blog: https://engineering.canva.com/ and our Medium Blog: https://medium.com/@Canva
jobs.title: Andriod Engineer

jobs.content:
At Canva, we work everyday to make a significant positive impact on society. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform!

Since launch in April 2013 we have grown exponentially, amassing over 10 million users in 11 languages (20 by end of 2016). We are one of the world’s fastest growing technology companies. At Canva, you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love -- just check out Twitter!

Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. The engineering team takes pride in its focus on engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcomes self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure. Frequently engineers host sessions where a new idea or software engineering practice is discussed - this ensures that everyone in the team is constantly learning.

The Canva code base was setup to scale; from day one. This has allowed for a unique environment where engineers spend most of their time optimising performance and releasing new features rather than fixing legacy code. This also ensures that it’s just more fun working on the code base. We also have a flat structure where engineers are invited to comment on the direction their peers are taking and are paired for pair-reviewing to occur. This ensures that knowledge around the code base is shared and speed of release occurs. This ensures that knowledge around the code base is shared and speed of release occurs. You can find more about our engineering practices in this blog article "How we get things done" (https://medium.com/canva/how-canva-engineering-gets-things-done-9a8078facb8c).

Our frontend servers and backend servers are all written in Java, using a mix of SQL and NoSQL stores.

Role:

  • Work closely with designers and product managers to deliver great products that delight our customers and that you can be proud of
  • Bring new ideas to the table
  • Engage in technical discussions and designing new features
  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Communicate with other team members to determine the best solutions to difficult problems
  • Passion for performance debugging and benchmarking

Requirement:

  • Comfortable working with a wide range of tools
  • Strong Computer Science/Software Engineering background
  • A generalist, with Java experience
  • Excellent problem solving skills, with a creative and analytic mind
  • Deep knowledge of the web stack, networks, and Unix administration

Bonus Experience:

  • AWS infrastructure
  • Search infrastructure (Lucene/Solr, ElasticSearch)
  • Python and/or Scala
  • Image analysis and computer vision
  • Horizontal scaling, Heroku, MapReduceBoth SQL and NoSQL stores

Benefits:

  • Equity in one of the fastest growing startups in the world
  • Fitness membership
  • Inhouse chef
  • Company trips
  • Relocation allowance for overseas and interstate candidates
  • All visa application processes covered

We ensure that the Canva workspace is setup for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so, with breakout areas, little nooks, quiet places to retreat and do your best work! We have three in-house chefs that whip up amazing breakfasts and lunches for the whole team, check out what's cooking at: https://instagram.com/canvavibe/

For more insight into how we work, check out this article by our Head of Engineering and the rest of our engineering blog.

If you're a passionate technologist a truly challenging opportunity, with one of the worlds premier technology companies, all while living in beautiful Sydney, Australia - then apply now to start the discussion with us!
jobs.title: Java Software Engineer

jobs.content:
At Canva we work to make a significant positive impact on society. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creation.

Since launching in April 2013 we have grown exponentially, and the journey has only just begun. Join Canva, and be part of this adventure. We are one of the world’s fastest growing startups.

Your colleagues, like you, will be the top of the industry. We mean it when we say it is important to us that we create a workplace that you love coming to.

Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed and constantly improved to let you do your best work. At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love. Just check out our Twitter stream.

Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. The team takes pride in its focus on engineering fundamentals. We strive to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcomes self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure. Engineers frequently host sessions where a new idea or software engineering practice is discussed — this ensures that everyone in the team is constantly learning.

We work hard to get our fundamentals right across the business. Consequently, the frontend code base is constantly being improved and optimised so new features can be implemented easily. We also have a flat structure where engineers are invited to comment on the direction their peers are taking on features. When a new feature is being built, engineers review each other’s code; this ensures that knowledge is shared and it doesn’t need to be reworked. You can find more about our engineering practices in this blog article. This ensures that knowledge around the code base is shared and speed of release occurs. You can find more about our engineering practices in this blog article "How we get things done" (https://medium.com/canva/how-canva-engineering-gets-things-done-9a8078facb8c).

Role:

  • Work with product designers and founders to build a next-generation web application with a focus on an exceptional client-side experience
  • Build efficient and reusable front end abstractions and systems
  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Communicate with other team members to determine the best solutions to difficult problems
  • Identify and communicate best practices for front end engineering
  • Interact with our back end systems
  • Use a spacer.gif in our email templates every now and then :)

Requirement:

  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript
  • Expert knowledge of web technologies (HTML/CSS)
  • Experience developing rich applications with HTML/CSS/JS
  • Intimate knowledge of cross-browser and cross-device development
  • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for UI components, including appropriate testing
  • Passion for performance debugging and benchmarking
  • Minimum 2+ years of experience building web applications
  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering or a related field

Bonus Experience:

  • Experience with SVGs
  • Experience with graphics programming
  • Experience with GLSL / WebGL
  • Experience with Java
  • An interest in interaction design

Benefits:

  • Equity in one of the fastest growing startups in the world
  • Fitness membership
  • Inhouse chef
  • Company trips
  • Relocation allowance for overseas candidates
  • All visa application processes covered

We are looking for people who love technology and can bring creativity when solving challenging problems. We ensure that the Canva workspace is setup for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so. Do you know we have a chef, Song, that makes fantastic lunches for the team? Follow Song on Instagram here to see what he has whipped up today: https://instagram.com/canvavibe/.
jobs.title: Frontend Engineer

jobs.content:
We're an application led business that's sitting on 4 years of some of the most comprehensive data in our field and we want to use it. We're starting to build analysis of where risk is for our customers and how they can use that to improve their safety practices and ultimately save lives. We want you to help us build our data platform and maintain/improve it as a product.


Our team at SafetyCulture is unlocking the power of data science to better serve our customers. We are looking for experienced, passionate, and talented data ops engineers to innovate and automate in the rapidly growing area of big data. You will work closely with our data scientists to create data infrastructure based on your extensive knowledge of the data and engineering best practices.


Why?



We make a difference, our mission is to save lives and allow employees to come home safely everyday. 


Your work reduces time spent by our clients on safety audits, whether it's making sure Gold Miners in the US work in a safe culture, a research team in Antarctica have all of their equipment working, a team of world class performers have their environment set up just right or an office has it's electrical equipment regularly inspected. It allows a central head office to know when a critical issue needs to be fixed, before an incident happens, not after. This matters.
jobs.title: Data Platform Engineer

jobs.content:
Are you excited about technology and love building cool stuff? Are you at the top of your game and can beat Mark Zuckerberg in a coding challenge? Do you want to work with a brilliant team on an award winning product and learn new skills? Are a master of pure low level Ruby, Network, protocols and sockets?
If so - this could be the job for you!


Job Description:


You will be responsible for building Ruby applications in pure low-level Ruby logic code (without the rails framework) including anything from complex groups of back-end to command line utilities, TCP/IP based libraries and data processing scripts.

This job in nature is not the common RoR web development position, but more of a Network infrastructure engineer in its nature, building a network app.

Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop these applications, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.

Thus, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and building quality products is essential.

This is an excellent opportunity to be part of an exciting company, in a dynamic and fast growing environment.


Company Description:


Qualicode is a software development firm that helps some of the most technologically advanced startup companies in the world with all their development needs. Working with us means youll be a part of a brilliant team with globally recognized award winning products. It also means youll be working with the most advanced technologies/challenges, and learn new skills that will serve you well in the future. Youll have real pride and satisfaction with your work.

Some of our clients you might work with got 30+ Million users, or got enterprise level products that serves the biggest companies in the world, including governments.




Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable pure Ruby logic low-level code (without the rails framework).

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications.

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions for these problems.

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

40 hrs/week

Compensation: $25/hour

Location: Global (remote)


Were one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.


Are you up for the challenge?
jobs.title: Network/Security Engineer with Ruby - $50K

jobs.content:
Docker Chief Architect - $100K


Are you one of the top Software Architects in the world? Were you an early adopter of virtualization, containers and cloud infrastructure? Do you love to automate everything that needs to be done more than once? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while being able to work from any location that is comfortable to you? Eager to join a development network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Through Crossover, youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for elite companies around the world.


The Company:


Aurea is partnering with Crossover to hire the best and brightest Docker Chief Architects. Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:

The Docker CA will be in charge of migrating products to Cloud using AWS, Docker and Aurora by taking any of our products from a legacy state, manual build/deploy processes, ancient dependencies, fragile architecture, weak security, lack of scalability or performance). Reverse engineer its legacy architecture and key flows (white box vs black box approach), understand its key weaknesses on the following pillars of cloud-readiness such as security, reliability, simplicity, performance, operational agility and automation. Design out the weaknesses, work hands-on and/or partner with and providing leadership to Product Development team. The final goal is to transform the product into a full dockerized CD pipeline with fully automated build/deploy/monitoring/resiliency processes in a fully consolidated Docker and Aurora environment with no unknown remaining legacy issues in terms of security, reliability, performance and operational agility.
jobs.title: Docker Chief Architect - $100K

jobs.content:
SaaSOps Software Engineering Manager - $100k


If you are an elite manager of a devops engineering team or a SaaS operations team and you are eager to gain unprecedented visibility to top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee super high impact devops migrations, and earn $100,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


The Company:


Crossover is a well-funded startup that has developed a unique way to find, curate and manage the top 1% of global talent and connect them to medium and large businesses. We are experiencing rapid growth within the companies we currently serve and are increasing our staff to expand our business.


Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will consist of teams collaborating from every corner of the world. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical contracting. But we dont just find the best; we also provide the software tools, training, and expert management to ensure success for long-term growth.

Job Description:

Crossover is looking for SaaS Software Engineering Managers who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills and also possess the technical background to be a SaaS Operations leader through example. You will be expected to understand the architecture for each of a variety of new SaaS products, design high quality plans for migrating to our simple consolidated architecture, and then coaching a devops team to a successful on time execution. In addition, SaaS Software engineering managers will be responsible for improving individual productivity quarter over quarter through staffing, coaching, process standardization, process improvement, and automation.


A successful Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualities:

  • Ruthless commitment to scientific debugging, and the unrelenting pursuit of the final "Root Cause"

  • The ability to quickly appropriate architectural decisions favoring simplicity

  • Commitment to hands-on engagement as an individual within the team, despite managerial status

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until its done correctly

  • Exceptional ability to effectively motivate and manage teams of individuals

  • Commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously automating manual processes

  • Excellent remote management skills (you will be using Skype, GoToMeeting, Google Docs, etc.)
jobs.title: SaaSOps Software Engineering Manager - $100k

jobs.content:
Cloud Chief Architect - $100K


Are you one of the top Cloud Architects in the world? Were you an early adopter of cloud infrastructure and AWS and passionate about the cutting edge Cloud technologies and trends? Do you love to automate everything that needs to be done more than once?


Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while being able to work from any location that is comfortable to you? Eager to join a development network of the most talented remote workers in the world?


If so, this role is for you. Through Crossover, youll earn the most competitive wage on the market, work with the best engineers in the field for a highly successful company looking to exponentially grow its adoption of Cloud services.


The Company:


Aurea is partnering with Crossover to hire the best and brightest Cloud Chief Architects. Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touchpoints to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:

You will play a critical role in designing and executing cloud-based architectures. This can range from orchestrating the deployment of centralised environments on AWS infrastructure, fresh design/build work in cloud-based environments like AWS and GCE, or adapting large existing infrastructures to an AWS deployment model. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software products, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Just as an example, one project includes migrating a large infrastructure consuming over 1,500 machines globally and storing over 5 petabytes of information into AWS. This role will include implementing profound architecture changes to get ready for the cloud, phased adoption of cloud-specific services, progressive removal of legacy technologies, with the ultimate goal of full migration into the AWS cloud.


Key responsibilities:

  • Developing product expertise in a short time frame.

  • Architecting new solutions or adapting existing ones to optimally run in a cloud-based environment (proper use of VMs and containers, queue-based architectures, services-oriented architectures, etc)

  • Owning the execution and implementation of migration strategies (this will include deployment/provisioning using DevOps tools, data migration, testing, cutover/failover of systems, configuration of monitoring and other production management systems)

  • Overseeing technical quality for the output of small teams of Software Engineers (requirements reviews, architectural reviews, and code reviews)

  • While showing technical leadership you will still be in charge of personally addressing the most technically challenging issues in the project. We count on you as the key technical person, not a people manager!
jobs.title: Cloud Chief Architect - $100K

Crossover is inventing the future of work. A future where high-skill jobs are available to anyone around the world - as long as they are the best-of-the-best in that skill. jobs.content:
Do you get excited when you read Ben Horowitzs definition of a good product owner? Do you love setting the vision of software products and bringing them to market? Do you analyze every product you interact with and internalize good and bad ideas? Do you consider yourself the CEO of your current successful software product? If so, this role is for you.

We are looking for a world-class Technical Product Owner to help us define and build the software products that underpin our continued success. You are going to be the CEO of your product and be fully hands on with everything from setting the vision to the execution to continual refinement as you receive feedback from customers. You work closely with company executives and with our customers to understand their needs, interpret them into requirements, work with the design team to build mockups then get them built by your dedicated engineering team.

You will be working directly with our engineering teams to make your roadmap reality. As a result, we are looking for a person that has a technical software background. We will be measuring your performance based on the volume of quality features being released to production - which emphasizes how tightly you will be working with the various execution teams.

This is a completely remote position. You can work from anywhere in the world but also with people from all over the world. Therefore strong communication and presentation skills will be crucial for your success.


Company Description:

Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Create innovative user interactions and work with our visual designers to create great visual comps

  • Create detailed specifications from high level ideas

  • Work with our engineering teams daily in one scrum team to go from comps to working software

  • Create and prioritize the product backlog

  • Manage a development process with an expected weekly (or faster) production release within a fast changing and highly agile framework

  • Experience working mostly with tech-heavy projects

  • Continuously collect customer feedback and build suggested improvements into the product


Total compensation: $100,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

jobs.content:
Hello! I'm Mike Knoop with the Product Team at Zapier. We're looking for someone to join our Data Team who can help us maintain, design and launch new data pipelines for our product that helps 1.5 million users (and growing) automate their tedious, everyday tasks so they spend less time working extra hours and more time enjoying what matters to them.  You’ll design and improve our data operations and you’ll get to work in the main Zapier code base as well as the Data Team’s R code base. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and work with Airflow, Kafka, Spark, Secor, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Redshift, MySQL, AWS and more.  If that sounds exciting to you, keep reading!


We're a widespread remote team of 62 people, located in eleven countries, that think computers should do more work. The Data Team currently has team members in Texas and Alabama. You don't have to be located in the USA, you just have to be talented!


We get together 2-3 per year for a company retreat (next one in is January), and benefits include great healthcare, dental and vision coverage, 401k retirement plan with company match, profit sharing and 14 weeks paid leave for new parents.


If you're interested in learning more about our Senior Data Engineer Role, visit the Jobs @ Zapier site.


We're not accepting applications from agencies.
jobs.title: Senior Data Science Engineer

jobs.content:
Hi, my name is Brad Touesnard. Iâm the founder of Delicious Brains Inc. We make high quality products for WordPress.

The âweâ is currently 8 full-time developers and myself. They take care of the code, write articles for our blog, support our customers and I handle pretty much everything else. Iâm currently looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead all marketing and communication efforts.

I personally review all applications myself.

Responsibilities

You will work directly with me to run a big part of the business. At first you will run all of your proposals by me, but once we establish trust you will operate with complete autonomy and make high level decisions on your own, reporting to me only periodically. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Experimentation - Work with me to come up with creative new ideas to bring in new customers and keep existing ones. Take an idea from planning through execution and measuring results. A failed experiment isnât a loss if we learn something significant.
  • Blog Editor - Lead our team of developers in writing engaging content for our 10,000 email subscribers. You will have a keen eye for grammar, spelling, and clear, concise writing.
  • Chief Copywriter - You will hold a veto card on all public facing copy and you will absolutely love using it. You will scrutinize every bit of copy from our landing pages to changelog entries to ensure they are clear and concise.
  • Manage Our Ads - Analyze the performance of our ads, suggest changes, and execute those changes. You will also learn new ad platforms and experiment with them.
  • Site Improvements - Suggest changes to our sites to improve conversion rates and work with developers to execute on these suggestions.
  • Sponsorships - Suggest events, podcasts, etc to sponsor and manage those sponsorships.
  • Screencasts - Produce screencasts for our marketing site, blog, and documentation. You could do screencasts yourself, have another member of the team do it, or hire some help.
  • Promote Product Releases - Produce a blog post selling the new features and benefits in the latest version of our product and promote it via email, social media, and other channels.
  • Communicate with Customers - Follow up with customers who choose not to renew their subscription and compile statistics on reasons for not renewing. Survey customers for things that they need badly and that weâre in a good position to provide.
  • New Products - Propose new products that you would like to see us build and promote to our audience.
  • Communicate with Affiliates - Engage with affiliates offering them what they need to be more successful in promoting our products and earning commissions.
  • Build a Marketing Team - Make a case for hiring a freelance designer, developer, or another role to help you achieve your objectives. Or maybe itâs even a part-time developer you need on the team. I can be convinced.
  • Drip Campaigns and Marketing Automation - Use our marketing automation software (Drip) to drive engagement, decrease our bounce rates, etc.
  • Automated Webinars - Collaborate with developers from each of our product teams to plan, schedule, and execute a webinar. Setup automated webinar software to run it on a weekly basis.
  • T-Shirts - Have t-shirts designed with our branding, have a printing company do a run, and have them sent to our customers.

Requirements

  • Outstanding English communication skills (spoken and written) - You need to be in the 99th percentile in spoken and written English. I canât emphasize this enough. Anything less will not do. If English is not your first language, this is going to be a tough requirement to satisfy. Applications that do not exhibit clear, concise writing will be discarded without reply.
  • Work hours - I usually work 8am â 4pm AST (7am â 3pm EST) from my home in Nova Scotia. Because weâll be working together a lot in the beginning, our work hours must overlap by at least 6 hours. For example, if youâre in British Columbia or Oregon you would need to start by 6am at the latest. If youâre in the UK, you would only be able to knock off at 6pm at the earliest. Once weâve been working together for a while we should be able to relax this down to as few as 2 hours of overlap.
  • Experience working in a marketing team - Not only have you worked in a marketing team for at least a year, but you have a solid list of achievements that demonstrate your ability to successfully lead projects. You also have a list of failures and lessons learned.
  • Superb organizational skills - Structure breeds creativity. You put processes in place for everything so that you have a structure to support you doing your best work.
  • Cares about the details - You realize that even a small tweak to copy can have a big impact. You take pride in reading through copy and making sure it meets your standards.
  • Owns both successes and failures - You practice Extreme Ownership. When a project youâre leading turns into a disaster, you own it. You never point the finger at others.
  • Self-motivated and works well independently - Meaning you donât need to be nudged every step of the way and are proactive in tackling things that need to be done without direction. You should embrace the opportunity to level up, learn something new and really dig into it.
  • Comfortable working remotely - Weâre a fully remote company. We work from home, coffee shops, and co-working spaces. You must be confident that remote work is going to suit you. Ideally you have some experience working remotely.
  • Comfortable hanging out with a bunch of code monkeys - When we meet up in person, thereâs quite a lot of geek speak. Weâre currently 9 software developers after all. You need to be comfortable with that.
  • Welcomes criticism and genuinely wants to grow as a professional - Weâre big on pushing each other to be better. Thatâs how we grow as individuals and a team. Itâs one thing to accept criticism and another to ask for it and use it to level up.
  • Attend business and marketing conferences - As a tiny team, itâs important to learn from others outside the company.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working remotely
  • Experience marketing software products
  • Experience with Drip marketing automation software
  • UX and design skills
  • Bachelorâs degree or equivalent

Location Independent

Although six of your work hours need to overlap with mine in the beginning (as mentioned above), we can do with less overlap once weâve worked together for a while. Youâll be free to work from nearly anywhere in the world, wherever youâre happiest. Our team is currently distributed across the globe, working from our homes in Nova Scotia, Ontario, California, Pennsylvania, Scotland, and England.

You Choose Your Schedule

Whatâs your ideal schedule? Maybe you like the regular 9am-5pm schedule. Or maybe a 4-day work week is your thing. Or maybe you prefer to work 6-days per week, but less each day. Or maybe it changes week-to-week.

It really doesnât matter as long as we overlap by six hours most days in the beginning and after a while it will be completely up to you.

You Choose Your Benefits

Whatâs an attractive benefits package? Well, it really depends on the person. What do you value?

Maybe a competitive salary is what youâre after. Or maybe you really value vacation time and would rather less pay and more vacation days. Maybe health coverage is important to you, or maybe youâre already covered.

Because everyone values things differently, Iâm leaving this wide open. Carte blanche. Iâm certain we can work out an arrangement youâll be happy with.

Company Retreats

The entire team was flown into Vienna for a company retreat in June 2016. Food/drink, travel, and accommodation were covered. Check out the blog post for the details. The previous year we went to Miami. Where will we go in 2017!?

To apply: https://deliciousbrains.com/careers/product-marketing-manager/#apply

jobs.content:
OUR TEAMS
Join an Agile team of professionals dedicated to building the next generation of travel applications. Priceline.com provides a unique opportunity for Developers to solve for every requirement that makes for a great trip. From booking a flight anywhere in the world to renting that convertible for a cross country road trip, our teams thrive on providing the best life experiences for millions of customers – and at a great price.

OUR TECHNOLOGY
Javascript has dominated the language sphere and with the continued strength of Node.js Priceline.com has placed Node.js at the forefront of what we use to build our customer-facing applications. Our Developer culture dictates what we use and when. Our teams build products that we expect to stick around for a long period of time. We celebrate codebases that employ patterns as traditional as MVVM and as modern as Redux. You will work on systems that serve hundreds of millions of searches a day, generate billions of events, and are monitored 24x7 using the best of the big data technologies. Code is our product, and at Priceline.com we will look to you to help us maintain, evolve, extend and modernize the products we build that help people experience the world.

OUR CULTURE
The Priceline.com culture is one of collaboration and leadership. Self-starters are encouraged to explore, fail fast and build new things. Set goals and achieve them through collaboration with your team. Join in various Developer forums lead by Developers of all levels. Build or attend a program and explore the benefits of modern technology. Find places that lack ownership and own them.
Collaboration, ownership and innovation are our primary tenets.

SO WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?
Apply for a position on one of our lean, agile and innovative teams. Build the next exciting new product or feature that will ultimately help millions of people experience the world.

What you will do
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to developers to build high quality software.
  • Work with your colleagues to strategize on ways to implement automation or software to help improve and maintain code quality.
  • Work with developers to set achievable goals to help them grow their career.
  • Apply your knowledge of business and techno strategy to help solve platform level challenges that will help teams build with efficiency.
  • Aid in the planning and development of small to large complex techno projects that require full stack support.
  • Effectively communicate project details to stakeholders.
  • Stay connected with the software and the products your teams are building. Contribute to strategic discussions around improvements and contributing to problem solving discussions.
  • Find areas where communication gaps can be closed across departments.
  • Participate in the design of agile teams that are dedicated to achieving a common goal.
  • Exercise the technology and best practices at priceline by building effective MVP's and presenting concepts to our Technical Steering Committee.
  • Aid in the general education and development of our staff.
  • Be a problem solver, think creatively and be the leader you are.


Skills we look for in a Developer Manager
  • A bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
  • Three or more years leading technology teams.
  • Five or more years in the software development business, in particular front end software development.
  • Working knowledge of modern front end development technology as it applies to the web.
  • Great communication skills.
  • Able to speak technically in conversations around software development on multiple levels.


Technical Specs of our Full Stack Developers
Common Skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science.
  • Experience with Javascript, Java, Golang and/or Python.
  • Software development patterns like OOP, Flux/Redux, Modular, MVVM, MVC and Observer.
  • ES2015 and functional JavaScript is a plus. Using methods like map, reduce and filter.
  • Webservices and API development is a plus using solutions such as Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Elastic Search and Solr.
  • A healthy discipline of test driven development (TDD).


Front End Chops
  • Front end at Priceline.com means building applications that millions of customers will use and interact with. Some things we look for in front end skills include:
  • Proficiency with JavaScript core language features and functionality. String manipulation, working on collections, build and destroying DOM elements, event-based development, AJAX etc...
  • Experience building and maintaining front end applications with modern frameworks and tools like Angular.js, React.js, Ember.js or Vue.js.
  • Being familiar with terms like "partials" and "components".
  • Ability to author and maintain semantic and accessible markup.
  • At Priceline.com we are all about style, so CSS is a must for front end development. Understanding of practical uses of responsive design, the use of tools like SASS, and the authoring modular CSS.

The Server Side and the Services Layer
Full stack development of course requires that we know something about the server, databases and how they work. At Priceline.com we employ a number of technologies on our servers so having expertise in these topics is something we look for.
  • Understanding of Node.js and how it works. Experience with common libraries like Express.js and routing. The prevention and detection of memory leaks, security, logging, middleware and the use of templates.
  • You will need to have strong object-oriented design and development skills and working knowledge of core Java or similar programming languages. Knowledge and experience with third party libraries, frameworks, and technologies is a plus.
  • Development and maintenance of micro-services as it applies to API development and orchestration. An example would be GraphQL, or content services.
  • You will need to have strong SQL composition skills. Knowledge of big data and NoSQL databases is a plus. We not only write software that collects and queries data, but we also compose queries for investigation and analysis. We collect a lot of data in real time from our applications and being able to compose ad hoc queries is necessary to develop and support our products.
  • Got Golang? Help us with our POC's and bringing technology to life here at Priceline.com.
jobs.title: Web Development Manager

jobs.content:
Job Description

15+ years ago, priceline.com transformed the travel space.  Now, we are building a new team to transform how we work and how we develop products. We are looking for a Scrum Master to implement our Agile & Scrum practices and help teams evolve their development processes. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience and a collaborative attitude. She/He will utilize the Agile/Scrum process to enable us to increase velocity, increase visibility, and improve quality throughout our organization.  This position will lead teams at varied levels of maturity.  Our group is poised to drive dramatic change within the organization so a successful candidate must be hungry to learn and hungry to teach.

Job Requires two days per week in our Norwalk, Connecticut headquarters.

Responsibilities

  • Act as a mentor to ensure development teams work toward core the Scrum principles of collaboration, prioritization, team accountability, and visibility
  • Coordinate scrum rituals: stand-ups, backlog grooming, estimation, sprint and release planning, demos, and scrum-of-scrums, and retrospectives
  • Monitor and communicate key Agile performance metrics: burn-down, burn-up, cumulative flow, velocity
  • Train development teams in all aspects of the standard Agile/Scrum process
  • Engage stakeholders to ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency
  • Foster a collaborative, cross-functional environment in which to build great products, solve customer needs, and continuously improve
  • Manage projects in JIRA and Confluence and drive the development and maintenance of tools, measurement, and best practices within the company.

Detailed Qualifications

  • Proficiency with Lean Agile methodology and the Scrum software development methodology, values, and procedures
  • 3+ years of experience as a Scrum Master or Agile Project Manager for multiple software development teams, supporting Lean methodologies and practices like iteration planning, release planning, prototyping, retrospectives, continuous delivery, and behavior-driven development
  • Deep with JIRA, Confluence, and the rest of the Atlassian suite and using JIRA's Agile performance metrics to drive accountability and continuous improvement
  • Have used Atlassian's toolset to foster fostering organizational changes and implement agile processes throughout multiple disciplines (software development, QA, marketing, networking, devops, customer service, help-desk) and industries. 
  • A belief that Agile fosters open team communication, transparency, and the ability to make honest project decisions
  • A belief that Agile enables individuals to more fully understand, participate, and engage in business objectives
  • A deep understanding of MVP and the ability to guide priceline.com through the pitfalls of process versus flexibility
  • Experience managing software development efforts for large scale web applications using Agile and Lean methodologies with in-house and outsourced teams.
  • Ability to understand technical issues at a intermediate to high level.
  • Comfortable working with geographically distributed teams (off-site team members and local team members).
  • One or more Agile certifications (e.g., CSM, CSPO, CSP, PSM, PSPO). SAFe certifications (SA, SP, SPC) is a plus

General Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline
  • Masters degree in computer science or related discipline is a plus

What does success look like?

  • The cycle time of your teams will decrease (and quality will increase).
  • Product deliveries and performance will be predictable and thoroughly understood by stakeholders.
  • Your internal customers will consider you a strategic partner.
  • Your stakeholders and team will see you as an invaluable resource in their day-to-day work.
  • Your peers will view you as a teacher and someone who emotionally evangelizes Agile methodologies.

Specialties: Agile, Scrum, Lean/Agile, Team Building, Agile Coaching and Scaled Agile Framework, Minimum Viable Product, Atlassian JIRA / Confluence / Agile / Service Desk

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Front End

jobs.content:
Priceline.com's team was awarded a Top Developer badge on Google Play! Come join us and be a part of our high-performing engineering team! 

Priceline is looking for optimistic and collaborative, developers to roll up their sleeves and join our mobile team. We believe in hiring people who love what they do. Are you passionate about Android, mobile technology, and building great products? If so, we want to hear from you!

As a member of our Android Development Team, you'll be building priceline.com's world-class Android app for booking hotels, rental cars, and air travel. You will work closely with Product Managers and UI/UX specialists to create fast, efficient, stable code, with core Android technologies such as: Content Providers, Sync Adapters, View Animations, Property Animations, JSON, and more. Additionally, you'll be implementing A/B tests and real-time analytics, as a member of a tight-knit, fast-moving team that includes server-side developers.

Required Skills:
Demonstrated experience creating one or more production-quality Android apps using Android Studio: Send us your Google Play links if you have em! 

Strong fluency of the Java programming language, the Android SDK (versions 4.1 and up), Dalvik VM, RenderScript, memory management, strong command of object oriented principles, data structure optimizations, security, IPC, third party service integration (e.g. Google Play Services) and the Android development environment. 

Experience as a member of a development team that uses Agile development techniques.

Thorough understanding of REST-ful API design: You can design and document a client-server protocol, and you can implement the client side of a documented protocol.

Required Experience:

  • Bachelor's Degree in related field
  • 2 years related experience in Android development
  • Strong coding abilities and experience with Java and Android SDK (version 4.1 and up)
  • Strong experience with Object Oriented (OO) software design
  • Experience understanding large and complex code bases
  • Memory Management (as it relates to Android devices)
  • Multi-Threading
  • Caching Mechanisms
  • Integration with Google Play Services
  • Implementing REST APIs
jobs.title: Android Developer

jobs.content:
AgilityFeat is seeking a Senior or a Lead Front end Engineer with expert Javascript knowledge who has experience developing rich, high­-performance, browser-­based Javascript applications. You'll design and implement a rich React JS, enterprise-­class messaging application, including client­-based end to end encryption and related security in the browser. We use backbone.js extensively and chrome wrapper / webkit for native integration. The ideal candidate has Team Lead or even Engineering management experience.

A sophisticated and modern javascript UI is our #1 need for a few reasons:



  • We have a huge customer and test base response for more features and the implementation of clean modern designs

  • Each one of these features needs to integrate to be maintainable and secure

  • We have a great server side team, but our frontend developers are shaping the look and feel of our core product and we need more help now.


RESPONSIBILITIES
You'll focus on cutting edge features (search, notifications, resilience connections). The UI is a first class citizen in our model, and our business is built on providing features and security consideration never before combined.



  • Work with Product Designers to design and implement the next generation of products

  • Build efficient and reusable front­end abstractions and systems

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Interact with other team members to incorporate their innovations and vice versa

  • Identify and communicate best practices for front­end engineering

jobs.title: Web Developer

jobs.content:
As a Senior Data Engineer you will collaborate with other engineers and data scientists to develop and maintain the machine learning (ML) data pipeline powering Restless Bandit's talent-rediscovery products. Your days will involve architecting, improving, and customizing Restless Bandit's ML infrastructure based on well-established data-processing systems like Hadoop or  while also staying on top of the latest developments in big-data computation platforms.


Culture:


We work hard, but at the same time we have a laid-back, fun work environment. Some of the values that are important to us are:


 - Helpfulness: we appreciate receiving help as well as giving it, and learning from each other as well as sharing knowledge and opinions.


- Professionalism: we trust each other and assume independence and autonomy along with responsibility.


- Curiosity: we’re interested in new ideas and alternative viewpoints; we prefer having our minds’ changed by a discussion to ‘winning’ a debate.


- Relaxedness: we believe that consistent unhurried problem-solving produces better solutions than frantic ‘fire drills.’


- Fun: we're thick as thieves. We have lunch together every day, host regular (and spontaneous)  happy hours, and participate in professional meet-ups.
jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer

jobs.content:
The Validation Team! Masabi are looking for an Embedded Engineer to join our JustRide Validation team and help support the rollout of hardware-based validation solutions to our customers around the world. Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry, allowing customers to buy and display tickets on their smartphone. Our JustRide mTicket applications mean that waiting in line for tickets is a thing of the past for customers whilst agencies are able to drastically reduce the cost of their operations. Our first major client was Boston in 2012. In 2014 we rolled out mobile ticketing to and Athens and this year we’re doing the same in New York as well as other major global cities. As a member of our Validation team, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of products, all of which are highly visible to our customers. This spans from handheld mobile applications used by bus drivers and train conductors, to embedded hardware that is seen daily by end-users of our retail applications. You will play a big part in defining and shaping the solutions that we implement to ensure not only that our customers get a great experience, but also that we receive enough feedback about our implementation to iterate and improve upon it.  The Role We are looking for an embedded engineer to work within our validation team to help build hardware solutions that are changing the way that people travel. The role will require working closely and effectively with product management, development teams, in-field technical consultants and software testers.  You will: 



  • Help the software team understand the intricacies and limitations of the underlying hardware.

  • Work closely with our hardware engineers, software engineers, and contractors to establish the best approach for exposing hardware functionality to our software team.

  • Use your best-practice experience of embedded hardware to complement the software team and help diagnose issues that arise during integration.

  • Own the embedded Linux platform and associated build processes.

  • Work closely with in-field delivery teams and technical consultants to troubleshoot integration approaches.
jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer - An opportunity to work on a variety of products

jobs.content: The Validation Team! Masabi are looking for a QA / Automation Engineer to join our JustRide Validation team and help improve our test capabilities across a growing number of platforms.  Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry, allowing customers to buy and display tickets on their smartphone. Our JustRide mTicket applications mean that waiting in line for tickets is a thing of the past for customers whilst agencies are able to drastically reduce the cost of their operations. Our first major client was Boston in 2012. In 2014 we rolled out mobile ticketing to and Athens and this year we’re doing the same in New York as well as other major global cities. As a member of our Validation team, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of products, all of which are highly visible to our customers. This spans from handheld mobile applications used by bus drivers and train conductors, to embedded hardware that is seen daily by end-users of our retail applications. You will play a big part in defining and shaping the solutions that we implement to ensure not only that our customers get a great experience, but also that we receive enough feedback about our implementation to iterate and improve upon it.  The Role As our QA Automation Engineer you will be the key component of ensuring that the quality of our products is the responsibility of the team. You will have the opportunity to work across a variety of applications and services including mobile apps, back office services, APIs, databases, and even embedded software running on validators that we fit to buses or station gates. We follow agile principles, which means we regularly ship updates to our customers for user acceptance testing and production.  You will therefore be responsible for feature and regression testing these updates. DevOps is something which we think is wonderful, and we do not forget about QA in this. As a QA you will have valuable input into how we can improve our products and environment configuration. Dev, QA and Ops work together when it comes to deploying to customer-facing and internal environments. Our ops team have worked very hard to ensure that you have the ability to play with environment config in your very own test environment, to ensure that we find and squash as many of those bugs as we can. Our test coverage consists of manual and automated testing but our aim is to fully automate the testing. Some tools we use: Appium/ Bamboo / MySQL / Charles Proxy / Tgestrail / HockeyApp / Postman / Puppet / Linux / Git
jobs.title: Test Automation Engineer - An opportunity to work on a variety of products

jobs.content:
We need a Senior Front-end Developer to help us build the fastest growing luxury fashion eCommerce platform in the World.


The World of luxury fashion is fast evolving and with over 70 million visitors a year, delivering to over 190 countries, our technology needs to be robust and reliable to keep up. Our teams are cross-functional and work on a multitude of projects that cover eCommerce, mobile, in-store tech, line of business and ERP.


Our Front-end team have to find inventive ways to solve intricate problems, and present them in a simple way. We recently developed an editorial Content Management System (100% in-house - we are currently working on version 3) which enables our Global Content team to create and publish beautiful, rich pages themselves, that seamlessly integrate products from our eCommerce site.


We also just completed a gigantic project; gift cards. The whole technology department was involved in one way or another. Specifically, the front end team had to find solutions for our PDP (product details page) which had a full redesign, the team worked closely with the mobile team to ensure it was all responsive but also mobile app friendly.


We are always looking to offer new experiences to the customer, and in 2017 we are looking to release a number of language specific websites to enable our customers to shop online in their native language. This will be a monumental project for ALL of the tech department.


More generally, the Front-end Team are responsible for developing SEO friendly and scalable front-end web solutions for user journeys and online customer interactions across: editorial content, eCommerce functionality, social media applications and mobile-optimised sites. We also implement website updates based on Creative and eCommerce briefs including homepage weekly updates, weekly editorial pages, change requests, new features and bug fixes at eCommerce areas such as Product detail and listing pages, checkout etc.
jobs.title: Help build the fastest growing luxury fashion eCommerce platform in the world!

jobs.content:
DIRECT APPLICANTS ONLY

NO RECRUITERS OR FIRMS



We are looking for Javascript/Node.js engineers who love challenges and solving big problems across many areas - finance, logistics, data mining, native processing and more. Want to be 100% remote, work on the most cutting edge technologies and get paid well? 



Requirements:




  • You have 4+ years production experience with JavaScript and Node.

  • You understand microservice architecture best practices.

  • You have worked with process managers and/or container orchestrators.

  • You're fluent in multiple SQL and NoSQL databases.

  • You know how to write thorough, articulate documentation.

  • You practice testing in all areas: unit, e2e, load, regression, etc.

  • You evaluate new technologies/patterns/frameworks on the regular.

  • You have intimate knowledge of the event loop



Added bonus if:




  • You've used Koa

  • You're familiar with Bluemix & CloudFoundry

  • You have recent experience working in a completely remote situation that we can reference if needed. We offer you complete 'physical' flexibility but your communication and ability to be completely engaged in daily standups and online presence in Slack is critical.

  • You've contributed to some great open source projects that we can see.



About Us:

Dealer Market Exchange (http://dmx.io) is releasing a virtual market for pre-owned vehicles. We are a global team with engineers, product owners and designers in 10 different timezones around the globe.

jobs.content:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified senior software engineers for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic developers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video:


https://e.video-cdn.net/video?video-id=A5ZJB3cguCu-duGx3Hy3Q4&player-id=EKGFrtKUDHbdBELNij71Hk&width=800


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


Senior PHP Developer (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • be an important part of our multinational agile software development team?

  • implement high-quality and scalable video asset management and video streaming solutions for enterprise customers?

  • write well-structured and documented “clean” code?

  • continuously update and expand the existing product?

  • use PHP 7 and learn everything about the further enhancement and the new features of the next generation?

  • experience how the principles of the Agile Methodology are implemented and lived within the whole organization?


Are you able to…



  • present at least a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences (or some other significant degree) and relevant work experience in a position as PHP Developer of at least three years?

  • show you strong knowledge and understanding of PHP 5.6?

  • demonstrate your knowledge and programming skills in Symfony (Symfony 2.8 LTS)?

  • write and implement reliable PHP-unit tests?

  • show strong knowledge of NoSQL databases (especially MongoDB 3.x)?

  • demonstrate us knowledge in MySQL databases?

  • explain why REST is more than just a buzzword for you?

  • communicate in German and English in all relevant courses of business?

  • ideally also show relevant knowledge of JavaScript and AngularJS?

  • be open and a team player who is able to carry out goal-oriented analysis and solve problems?


Do you feel addressed? We should get to know each other!


We offer…



  • an exciting perspective, a wide range of tasks, constantly new challenges and a desire for thinking out-of-the-box as part of our corporal culture

  • an open working environment that is characterised by teamwork and cross-functional cooperation and in which heart and humour are key figures

  • freedom to introduce your own ideas and to take responsibility


Even more interested?


Apply now!


Submit your meaningful application documents noting your earliest available starting date through our online portal at the following link: https://movingimage24gmbh.softgarden.io/apply-choice?jobDbId=484297

Christoph Hauser | HR Manager

jobs.content:
Life.io is looking for a passionate and articulate QA Analyst to join our team. We're looking for someone with attention to detail, a dedication to patterns and style, and an ability to move quickly through a changing landscape. You'll be working with our product and technology teams to understand new features, gather acceptance criteria, and manage the QA and UAT processes in our development workflow. You'll work with our team, our clients and our users to diagnose, document and manage open issues or requirements to their completion.

Things About You
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team
  • Enjoy helping people: curious, empathetic and solving problems for others
  • Able to manage users or clients through a testing process
  • Ability to switch gears while keeping in mind the bigger vision
  • Able to manage multiple active projects

Required Skills/Qualifications
  • Knowledge and experience working with JIRA and Github
  • Experience conducting UAT with client stakeholders and end users
  • Experience in writing requirements, acceptance criteria and tickets
  • Strong writing and communications skills â able to explain an idea to the team, or tease out an answer from a user
  • Technical knowledge of web and mobile applications, terminology and functionality

Nice to Haves
  • Interest and/or background in health, healthcare, and wellness
  • 1 year+ experience in a relevant position
  • Bachelors Degree in a related field (Computer Science, Communications, English, etc).

Perks
  • Full time remote work
  • Generous company rewards and incentives
  • Possible stock options
  • Excellent work/life balance

About Life.io
Life.io is a venture-backed and healthy startup that's changing lives. Our platform, which is offered through insurers and employers, provides motivation and rewards people for making meaningful improvements in their lives.

âItâs more than a health and wellness platform,â says Jon Cooper, Founder and CEO, Life.io. âItâs exactly as its name suggests, a platform for Life, designed to encourage people to make daily decisions and form habits that help them live happily in the moment and healthier in the future.â

With expertise in epidemiology and behavioral sciences and an Advisory Board that includes leading faculty in the area of diagnostics and behavioral economics, our team utilizes an evidence-based approach that is flexible, accessible, rewarding and entirely HIPAA compliant.


To apply: Send us an email to jobs+qa@life.io with your resume and a bit about yourself.
jobs.title: QA Analyst

jobs.content:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: http://life.io

Life.io is looking for a passionate and curious user researcher to join our team. We're looking for someone with attention to detail, a dedication to patterns and style, and an ability to move quickly through a changing landscape. You'll be working with our Product Designer, SVP of Product and Lead Front End Developer to understand new features, gather assumptions to test, and plan for feature research in our development process. You'll have access to analytics, data and engagement platforms, so you'll be able to blend quantitative and qualitative insights to help determine the direction our team should take.

We're looking for someone with a little experience, but open to growing and developing someone into the role. If you have a curiosity to learn, help and grow, this is a great role for you.

Things About You
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team
  • Enjoy helping people: curious, empathetic and solving problems for others
  • Enjoy learning about people and finding ways to help them
  • Interest and/or background in health, healthcare, and wellness
  • Ability to switch gears while keeping in mind the bigger vision
  • Ability to manage multiple projects
  • 1 – 3 years experience in a related field

Required Skills/Qualifications
  • Background in developing usability research plans and reporting.
  • Expert knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
  • Strong understanding of the different research methods and when to use them during each product development phase.
  • Knowledge and experience working with analytics tools.
  • Strong writing and communications skills – able to explain an idea to the team, or tease out an answer from a user.
  • Experience conducting user interviews, studies and workshops.
  • Bachelors degree in a relevant field (HCI, IT management, Computer Science, Design, etc)

Perks
  • Generous company rewards and incentives.
  • Excellent work/life balance.
  • Fun and exciting team.
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance policies.
  • Possible stock options.
  • Time off when you need it and a flexible vacation policy.

About Life.io
Life.io is a venture-backed and healthy startup that's changing lives. Our platform, which is offered through insurers and employers, provides motivation and rewards people for making meaningful improvements in their lives.

“It’s more than a health and wellness platform,” says Jon Cooper, Founder and CEO, Life.io. “It’s exactly as its name suggests, a platform for Life, designed to encourage people to make daily decisions and form habits that help them live happily in the moment and healthier in the future.”

With expertise in epidemiology and behavioral sciences and an Advisory Board that includes leading faculty in the area of diagnostics and behavioral economics, our team utilizes an evidence-based approach that is flexible, accessible, rewarding and entirely HIPAA compliant.

To apply: Send us an email to jobs+user@life.io with your resume, a bit about yourself, and an interesting topic or challenge you think we should know about.
