jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Developer (Java/ Backend) you will be part of our agile, cross-functional and international development team. You will drive the development of new features on backend side as well as maintain and improve the current code of our new mobile Games. You will be responsible for creating a game that will be played by millions of players. Your technical and architectural expertise will be crucial to our game’s success.

Your mission:

  • Responsibility for the realization of the backend architecture for one of our new games in Java 8 and latest frameworks like spring 4.x
  • Designing and implementing high availability systems and service-oriented architectures and game features
  • Developing, realizing and optimizing database designs
  • Education and technical guidance for other developers on Java specific topics
  • Working in close collaboration with Client Developers, Game Design, QA and System Administration
  • Maintaining and extending our development tools and environment

Your Profile:

  • A university degree in computer science or an equivalent training and experience as IT specialist
  • Several years of experience in object-oriented programming in Java
  • Experience with C# is a plus
  • Successful realization of online game projects, ideally in an agile environment
  • Experience with building services for mobile (e.g. REST) and proficiency in either IntelliJ, Eclipse IDE or Netbeans
  • Solid experience in Unit Testing, Design Patterns, Domain-driven Design, Code Reviews
  • Proactive and motivated to learn and work well within team
  • Good English language and overall communication skills

Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Senior Software Developer (Java/ Backend) with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Cagla Lacinoglu.

InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 150 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 400 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.

jobs.content:
Working under minimal supervision, the Enterprise DBA 6 is responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. Primary responsibilities of this role would include owning, tracking and resolving database-related incidents and service requests, fulfilling Service Level Agreements(SLAs), reviewing service related reports (e.g: database backups, maintenance, monitoring) on a daily basis to ensure service-related issues are identified and resolved within established SLAs, responding to database-related alerts and escalations and working with application development to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems.



This position requires a service-oriented mentality, a high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, a focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with the SLAs, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated with status of their requests, initiating and performing changes on production systems and proactively escalating any issues that cannot be resolved within the established timeframes.



Major Responsibilities/Essential Functions:



  • Install and configure multiple RDBMS’s and components

  • Install and deploy databases

  • Create backup and disaster recover plans

  • Test disaster recovery scenarios

  • Manage security

  • Predictive Analytics for resource management 

  • Works on projects with developmentand engineering teams

  • Performance tuning

  • Provide on-call support

  • Perform patching and upgrades to all database platforms

jobs.content:
ABOUT YOU


You’ve built sophisticated SPAs using one or more mainstream frameworks like Angular, Knockout, Backbone, Meteor, React, etc.; and you’re chomping at the bit to try another. You’ve built backends in one or more mainstream frameworks using Java, .NET, nodejs, etc. You think in REST and always notice when your CSS is off by a pixel. Modeling the databases and building the engines behind UIs gets your gears turning just as much as animating a button. You know the difference between call() and apply(), but you also know it usually doesn’t matter. Apps that react as fast as you can click have you opening up the source code. Working with more junior developers gets you excited for the coaching opportunities, and more senior developers for the learning. Groking the business requirements is second-nature. You own what you wrote and jump in to help your team support the product when there’s a fire, and when the smoke clears you’re one of the first to say “ok, how can we make sure that doesn’t happen again?”. You’re passionate and opinionated about great user experience; and most importantly, you love building real, working apps that surprise and delight your customers. 



WHAT YOU’D BE DOING


Under general supervision of the Engineering Manager, the Promotions B2B Engineer is a full-stack engineer with a bent for hard front-end problems, performing assignments in one or more of the following areas: providing technical guidance and direction to other staff members; participating in project planning and requirements definition; system/application design, system/application development, unit testing, support during QA and User Acceptance Testing, implementation and integration; customer support for and technical expertise in end-user decision support software tools and end-user computing technology; conducting all activities in accordance with standards and procedures. 




MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, develop, test, deploy, and support new software solutions and changes to existing software solutions

  • Troubleshoot technical issues in a variety of application environments

  • Mentor team members and provide thoughtful discussion on tactics and strategies as they are selected

  • Translate business requirements and product specifications into components of complex, loosely-coupled, distributed systems

  • Maintain a focus on rapid delivery of new features to market while maintaining stability and uptime

  • Maintain familiarity with the evolving trends in software development
jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer

jobs.content:
We are looking for a highly proficient, independent, reliable and motivated Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to lead the IT infrastructure development and administrative processes at Tabletennis11.com.

Our headquarters and warehouse are located in Estonia - one of the most advanced digital societies in the world. Management and Marketing teams are working remotely from different locations in Europe. We also have a brick-and-mortar store in Paris downtown. You can work remotely anywhere in Europe or in our office in Narva, Estonia.

This is a leadership role and you will work closely with the Board members, CEO and CMO. As such, this is a huge opportunity to make your mark.

**Responsibilities**

* Help the company on the technical front. Be a strong leader of our IT processes.
* Continuously evolve the companyâs strategic technical direction.
* See the big picture of our IT infrastructure. Identify opportunities and risks for the business.
* Take over technical responsibility for code quality, system security and the entire development / technical administration being done on Tabletennis11âs IT infrastructure. Ensure its stability, speed and scalability.
* Manage external IT service providers or build up and lead internal IT team.

**Main Tasks**

* Make sure that all important technical things function smoothly.
* Suggest new technical improvements.
* Advise and inform the rest of the team about tech-related decisions and strategies.
* Set tasks for developers and control their progress.
* Hire new developers or development firms if needed.
* Maintain documentation of all key functions and modules with the developers.
* Provide trainings / presentations of new features to our team.
* Prepare the annual IT budget, control it and provide monthly reports.

We are a small team with a big business! Our customers come first, and our Customer Support team is at the forefront.

Are you passionate about people? Do you want to join a fast-growing business? 
Then we are looking for you!

Our Customer Support Specialists are spread across Finland, USA, Canada, UK, Spain and Thailand to provide exceptional service to our amazing customers!

Our highly-skilled team have the freedom to serve our customers the best way they know how (who wants to read from a script?). As a member of this team, you would be responsible for answering customer inquiries through email, chat and phone.

Successful applicants will begin with a two-week training period, following which the opportunity to work remotely is available. This is a 5 day per week position with shifts that may be from Mon-Sun and may include evening work.

We are looking for highly motivated people, who are capable of independent work and can meet set expectations within deadlines.

Your responsibilities include:
  • Answering customer inquiries via email, phone & chat
  • Optimizing the team's tools and work procedures

We're looking to fill this role immediately, so please apply ASAP!

  • Canada

Our highly-skilled team have the freedom toserve our customers the best way they know how (who wants to read from ascript?). As a member of this team, you would be responsible for answeringcustomer inquiries through email, chat and phone.

Successfulapplicants will begin with a two-week training period, following which theopportunity to work remotely is available. This is a 5 day per week positionwith shifts that may be from Mon-Sun and may include evening work.

We are looking for highly motivated people,who are capable of independent work and can meet set expectations withindeadlines.

Your responsibilities include:
  • Answering customer inquiries via email,phone & chat
  • Optimizing the team's tools and workprocedures

We're looking to fill this roleimmediately, so please apply ASAP!

 Weencourage applicants from the following locations:

  • Canada
  • Minnesota(USA)
  • Finland
  • UK
  • Spain
  • Germany
  • Estonia
  • Hungary

Senior Software Architect (m/f)
Job reference: 105399


We are offering an exciting opportunity as a Senior Software Architect (m/f) in the field of autonomous driving. You will be responsible for the software architecture of the highly interconnected and innovative functions of autonomous driving. You will work closely with functions specialist and on-board electrical system architects to incorporate individual functions into the overall functional network.  Furthermore you will analyse the structure of the software component architectures within the overall software architecture, using it to design a reference architecture for specialist departments. You will also create prerequisites for reusable software components and interfaces based on unified modelling language (UML) and AUTOSAR. You will fulfil cost-optimal functional and on functional requirements in the exciting field of reusability and resource optimisation. Your results will form the prerequisite for software development and software testing and thus significantly determine the quality of the series software. In your daily work, you will take future challenges, such as shortened product creation processes, new software standards, or new electrical/electron.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

In close cooperation with the specialist departments, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software. jobs.title: Software Engineer

jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will be building the technologies that are utilized as a base for further products and aim to connect all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility - a software development methodology that allows engineers to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.


Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement, it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue.Along with you, we strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. As part of your onboarding, you will get to know some and join one of our teams that matches your interests and skills. As a team, you will build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that redefine the user experience of our customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code. You will decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive the whole development cycle according to its purpose - from implementation to testing and maintenance.


Mastery. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user-centricity of our software. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.
jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer - Berlin & Helsinki

jobs.content:
YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDS


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.
jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend - Berlin

jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY

Zalando Technology is one of the most collaborative places you can imagine. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, the Zalando Research unit, and with the international tech community outside of Zalando. We are looking for research engineers to work on a broad set of real-world practical problems of massive scale that will have a direct and significant business impact.

As a Research Engineer, you will conduct algorithmic research, plus design and build the optimization engines for all logistics operations for Zalando. Your solutions will save millions of Euros and improve customer experience with faster package deliveries. You will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  • A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or other similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.)
  • At least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object oriented language or Scala
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to algorithmic problems
  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods
  • Experience in mathematical or algorithmic research
  • Willingness to work with microservice architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs
  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services
  • Effective communication skills and ability to understand business requirements
  • Deep skepticism of, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzword mumbo jumbo, false assumptions and analysis
  • English language fluency


Additional Preferred Skills
  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications
  • Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large data sets


YOUR ROLE
  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our optimization engines
  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability
  • Communicate effectively with our engineering and data science teams and use agile processes
  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment
  • Play a critical role in the team as a creative research engineer working on key results
  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders
  • Think abstractly and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.
  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints
  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.



Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha.
jobs.title: Senior Research Engineer - Algorithms

jobs.content:
The Opportunity


Zalando’s mission is to become the world’s leading platform for connecting fashion with people. This goal requires a massive expansion of our business functions. We will serve a wider range of customers in different ways, build new technologies to support our platform architecture and continue to innovate as we expand.


Zalando’s Innovation R&D Team focuses on strategic technical research supporting Zalando’s product vision. Research areas include 3D scanning, soft body physics simulation, and computer graphics (AR and VR). The small team consists of multi-focused computer scientists and researchers. 

What We're Looking For



  • Ph.D./M.S. in Computer Science, Mathematics or related engineering field

  • 4+ years of relevant industry or academic experience

  • Mastery of C++ and one garbage collected language

  • Familiarity with 3D vector math (matrix and quaternion algebra, calculating intersections of geometric primitives, etc.)

  • You can quickly prototype an application and have sufficient knowledge about front-end frameworks, databases, and mobile platforms

  • Strong Research & Development experience

  • Team player with the ability to work in a collaborative environment

  • Creative, resourceful, and innovative problem solver

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

  • Experience with Linux and Amazon Web Services (desired)


Your Responsibilities



  • Driving and contributing to projects around various technological challenges (e.g. 3D scanning, soft body physics simulation, and computer graphics (AR, and VR))

  • Give vital impulses to the R&D team’s decision making process

  • Solve some of the most challenging technological challenges of our time while working in a team towards achieving a common goal as efficiently as possible

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies, related scientific research, as well as related developments in the startup and open source scene

  • Contribute to  the architecture and coding best practices for the R&D team’s systems

  • Represent Zalando at conferences and meetups, give technical talks and help to recruit great technical talent



What You Can Expect From Us

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.

You'll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. jobs.title: Data Warehouse Engineer

jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Recommendation & Personalization" you are working on Zalando state-of-the-art recommendation systems serving millions of customers with highly relevant and personalized content. You will be working with the newest technologies to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.



Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality recommendation results and at the same time provide a low-latency, rock solid and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of an autonomous and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced software engineers and expert data scientists working on the cutting-edge every day.


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 4+ years of experience, working as a (Java or Scala) developer. A technical degree is a plus

  • You have in-depth experience of working with data-driven recommendation solutions, including creating, implementing, and tuning recommendation engines

  • You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce)

  • You are experienced in building and deploying large-scale, distributed data-driven systems in a cloud environment

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts and have passion to solve algorithmic problems

  • You have a keen interest in Data Mining & Processing as well as applied Machine Learning

  • You’ve worked with NoSQL databases before (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB) and ideally also have experience in search engines (Solr, Elasticsearch)

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to enterprise level

  • You love to improve & optimize software and to use new technologies

  • Knowledge of near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommender systems in short release cycles

  • You will build and operate all services and stream-processed data infrastructure for low-latency personalized recommendations

  • You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our recommendations for various markets all across Europe for millions of customers

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.




WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Search & Browse

jobs.content:
Backend Engineering Practice Lead @ Zalando

Zalando Technology introduced a new shared leadership model within its organizational approach "Radical Agility". As a Backend Engineering Practice Lead you will partner with Delivery Leads to coach and empower individuals working in autonomous teams along the path of innovation and delivery of high quality, state of the art software.

Working one on one with backend engineers, you develop relationships built on trust and act as a coach for each of your directs; aligning their individual motivation, growth and goals with those of Zalando Tech. Your mission is to set the bar for engineers at Zalando and work directly with them on their journey to Mastery.

Your Challenges

  • In collaboration with Delivery Leads and Software Architects ensure that Zalando's backend engineering standards and performance expectations are met by your directs.
  • Coach and mentor individuals, to raise the performance bar for backend engineers working in autonomous delivery teams.
  • Inspire and encourage individuals to grow their skills and capabilities through discovering and following their passion and purpose.
  • Act as a key contributor in developing Zalando Tech's overall technical capabilities by aligning individual purpose with company and team purpose
  • Conduct regular performance assessments
  • Develop and evangelize great engineering practices and a strong feedback culture across all of Zalando Tech.
  • Work with recruiting team to attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent.
  • Cultivate a culture of ownership, autonomy, mastery, innovation, and purpose




Your Profile

  • You hold a degree in Computer Science or have equivalent experience as a software engineer.
  • You have 5-10 years of direct experience and a ton of passion for back-end technologies.
  • You can lead, coach and mentor software engineers, team and collaborate with other leaders.
  • Preferably, you have solid experience from working in an agile development environment.
  • You are passionate about developing and growing people.
  • You communicate with empathy, influence and inspiration.
  • You deal with and resolve conflicts in a graceful manner.


What You Can Expect:



Our recipe for success: think big and act fast. Your work today will affect millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando, you'll have the chance to help develop the world's best online fashion experience in a rapidly growing, international company!
  • Zalando offers you a fast moving and agile working environment where you will be continuously challenged with new opportunities.
  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues that inspires and supports you.
  • Training and further development opportunities to expand your skills and help you achieve your aspirations.
  • A corporate culture where your skills are assessed by your contributions - our motto: wear sneakers, not ties!
  • Attractive employee discounts for our online shop.


About Us



Thanks to our eCommerce expertise and can-do spirit we've become one of Europe's most favorable online shopping destinations in only a few short years. Today, Zalando operates in 15 countries. The core of our business is to be cutting edge in each and every of our fundamental pillars: fashion, information technology and logistics. Zalando SE, which is based in Berlin, operates the international business and takes care of our business development, comprising of management, marketing, IT and administration.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, SAP

jobs.content:
The Opportunity


As a producer you will be instrumental in supporting the development team in achieving excellence in terms of delivering software. You will help facilitate the lean development process, track progress against Key Performance Indicators and will help organize and support planning and other daily activities as the team requires. You will be expected to showcase your excellent organisational, problem solving and analytic skills.


What we are looking for



  • You have 4-5 years of Software Project Management or Software Product Management experience, ideally in an e-commerce company

  • You have sound knowledge and experience of managing and supporting software development using industry standard agile project management methodologies

  • You have effectively managed features and requirements documents, project management documents and team roadmaps.  You are able to bring a team together to craft a joined up plan, you understand risk mitigation and dependency management.

  • Activities such as Backlog grooming, Task Prioritization, Roadmap Management, Daily Standups, User stories, Jira, Product/Feature Mockups and Processes diagrams are in your DNA

  • You have strong communication skills and actively drive projects, breaking down complex problems into manageable, structured work packages. You effectively manage stakeholders and third party expectations and undertake periodic, appropriate reporting

  • You have drive and are you motivativated to get things done.  You lead by example, you talk data, you facilitate, you resolve, you negotiate and get things done

  • You thrive in an international environment and are fluent in verbal and written English 


Your Responsibilities



  • You will be the organizational engine of your team, responsible for managing product releases and executing the end-to-end integration plan

  • Your main focus will be on non-core-engineering tasks to enable successful end-to-end delivery and operation.  You will be expected to manage your team’s external project dependencies, external deliverables and roadmaps

  • You will refine requirements from Business KPIs, features and user stories

  • Your special focus will be on ensuring all end-to-end delivery tasks are completed for a successful product release

  • You will be part of an engineering team and you will play  key role in facilitating the team to take them forward. On a day-to-day basis, you will work very closely with the team and will facilitate taking decisions as a unit


What you can expect from us



  • Autonomy and trust to deliver using agile techniques in an entrepreneurial environment

  • A career development path developed jointly with you with potential for developing breadth and depth in skill set

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matters, all within a relaxed office environment

  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha at manjuri.sinha@zalando.de

jobs.content:

As a Windows Phone software engineer at Zalando, you will design, build and implement award-winning apps used and enjoyed by millions of people. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we evolve into a "mobile first" company. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand--while receiving meaningful support at every step.

jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.


You Benefit From


Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer Backend

jobs.content:
Die censhare Digital Experience Platform vereint alle Marketing- und Kommunikations-Inhalte in einem System mit einheitlicher Oberfläche. Die nahtlos integrierten Best-of-Breed-Anwendungen für Kollaboration, DAM, PIM, Omnichannel CMS und MRM ermöglichen erstmals, aus Informationen in Echtzeit relevante digitale Erlebnisse zu gestalten. Weltweit setzen über 150 Unternehmen wie Dyson, GoPro, Hearst, Kohl's, Serviceplan, Migros, Rewe, Swiss Re und Vitra censhare täglich ein. Unser Kunden- und Projektportfolio umfasst nahezu alle Branchen und Unternehmensgrößen. Das alles tun wir mit 170 Mitarbeitern weltweit mit Niederlassungen in Deutschland, Schweiz, UK, Frankreich, USA und Indien.

Wenn Sie Spaß daran haben, den Wachstumskurs in einem dynamischen, international agierenden Unternehmen mit zu gestalten, wartet eine spannende Herausforderung auf Sie!

Für unser Headquarter in München suchen wir Sie, zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, in der Funktion als:

Software Solution Developer (m/w)

Was erwartet Sie bei censhare?
Als Software Solution Developer sind Sie im Team Professional Services der zentrale Ansprechpartner für technisch komplexe Lösungen bei der Integration unserer Software. Sie sind Schnittstelle für Projektmanager, Partner und Kunden, die Sie durch Ihre Expertise unterstützen

Ihre Aufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten

  • Technische Konzeption und Umsetzung projektspezifischer Customizings unseres Produktes censhare
  • Insbesondere Konzeption, Implementierung und Dokumentation von Interfaces und Datenmigrationen
  • Aufbau von komplexen Datenmodellen und deren Realisierung
  • Technischer Ansprechpartner für Projektleiter, Partner und Kunden sowie für unsere Support- und Dokumentationsabteilungen
  • Durchführung von Workshops und Trainings für unterschiedliche Zielgruppen
  • Präsentieren komplexer und technisch anspruchsvoller Konzepte und Lösungen vor unterschiedlichsten Zielgruppen

Ihr Profil

  • eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker/In, ein Studium der Medieninformatik/OnlineMedien oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen oder als Quereinsteiger „on the job“ angeeignet – idealerweise in der Publishing-Branche
  • gute Kenntnisse in JAVA
  • sehr gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit XML, XSLT, XPath, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, UNIX-Systemen und haben keine Scheu vor der Kommandozeile
  • idealerweise Kenntnisse in DTP und Druckvorstufe
  • gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit in Deutsch und Englisch
  • Begeisterungsfähigkeit, Belastbarkeit, schnelle Auffassungsgabe für komplexe Aufgabenstellungen sowie eine analytische und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise

Unser Input

  • Sie finden bei uns ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld mit Freiraum für Individualität, flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege.
  • Bei uns können Sie schnell Verantwortung übernehmen und sich schnell entwickeln.
  • Sie arbeiten mit hochmotivierten und kompetenten Kollegen unter Einsatz neuester Technologien interkulturell zusammen.
  • Unsere Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt von kollegialem und wertschätzendem Umgang - wir sind ein tolles Team, das Erfolge gerne zusammen feiert.
  • Kaffee und Wasser sowie Obst stehen kostenlos zur Verfügung.
  • Eine eigene Köchin verwöhnt unsere Mitarbeiter mit Mittagessen in Bio-Qualität.

Über uns
Weltweit vertrauen führende Unternehmen und Marken auf censhare, um ihre Kommunikation zu integrieren und automatisieren und so begeisternde Kundenerlebnisse zu schaffen. Unser Kunden- und Projektportfolio umfasst nahezu alle Branchen und Unternehmensgrößen. Das alles tun wir mit 170 Mitarbeitern weltweit, mit Niederlassungen in Deutschland, Schweiz, UK, Frankreich, USA und Indien.

Interessiert?
Haben wir Ihr Interesse an dieser spannenden Herausforderung geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen in Deutsch oder Englisch und Angaben zu Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und dem frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin über den „Jetzt-Bewerben“ Button oder der Link. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Klicken Sie hier!

Fragen zur Position beantwortet Ihnen Frau Tatjana v. Hollen per E-Mail an recruiting@censhare.com.

jobs.title: Software Solution Developer (m/w)

jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer (.net)

The Job
Are you an experienced Senior Software Engineer (.NET) who wants to help an international company develop its business software solutions?

The Exact Asia Development Center (Exact ADC) is the international development center of Exact, one of Europe’s largest suppliers of business software applications. With our software development approach we have become a market leader with a strong international presence and users in over 125 countries. Our software is developed using ASP, VB6, VB.NET, C#, C++, JavaScript on the .NET/COM platform and we've adopted an Agile software development methodology (SCRUM).

Responsibilities:

  • In Exact, empowering our employees with the right skills and knowledge is our goal. If you are ready to move ahead and contribute towards a better understanding of functionalities and business practices, technical guidelines and best practice solutions, we want you.
  • We are looking for .NET engineers with proven web development / technology skills (HTML5/CSS/JS/JQUERY)
  • Design, code and test business software applications independently
  • Program both new solutions and new functionality in existing solutions, based on business needs, and using detailed functional designs
  • Maintain and troubleshoot applications by monitoring, identifying and correcting software defects
  • Investigate and solve software bugs in medium to complex business software applications and reports
  • Take ownership for the quality of all software targets and codes assigned
  • Be part of a multidisciplinary international teams, that collaborates closely with the technical and functional designers
  • Sharing software engineering expertise in your team

You Offer

  • Bachelor's degree or professional degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent
  • You must be experienced with JQuery and must have worked with and/or developed plugins.
  • Experience with incorporating client-side scripting into .Net server controls is a plus.
  • You should be familiar with integrating a front-end web application to back-end services via AJAX/JSON/REST.
  • You must have a good understanding of user-experience design and principles.
  • Coding is one of your passions in life
  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a role as software engineer/web developer
  • You must be experienced in web application development using ASP.NET
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Malaysian citizenship or relevant residence status
  • You will be asked to put your skills to work to help enhance a unique SaaS platform business solution.

We Offer @ Kuala Lumpur

  • We would like to provide you on the job training. Besides that we will train you to be an expert on domain knowledge.
  • You will receive a competitive salary, dependent on your level of education and work experience.
  • We offer you flexible working hours.
  • You will be exposed to cultural, social and professional experiences in an international environment.
  • You will be exposed to AGILE Software Development methodology (Scrum)
  • In addition we offer several extra benefits, such as an enhanced employee provident fund, group hospitalization and surgical coverage, term life insurance, vacation incentive after three years of employment, and a daily allowance.
  • Last but not least, you'll be working in office located in the GTower opposite to LRT Station Ampang Park, where, in addition to the fun you have at work, you can play in the games room or participate in activities like badminton, foosball and many more.

Our Culture
Exact combines the energy of a startup with the benefits of a multinational. We think actions speak louder than words and continuously strive for innovation; technical as well as personal. Each day again, we challenge ourselves and each other to be better than the day before. There’s never a dull moment at Exact. Exact has an open and welcoming culture in which anybody can have impact. We value ideas by their merit, not by their source. New opinions, people and principles keep our minds flexible, while we stay committed to our mission of empowering SME’s to be the driving force of the global economy.

Are you the ‘you’ in our story?
Please apply using this link.

You will be hearing from us soon.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

jobs.content:
Java developer BRUG F280-PDC-4110-044

Het Team Softwareontwikkeling vertaalt gewenste functionaliteiten in robuuste en gecertificeerde ICT-oplossingen. Multidisciplinaire teams van developers, analisten en testers werken continu en projectmatig aan de bouw en het onderhoud van informatiesystemen en politieapplicaties. Cruciale producten voor het politiewerk op straat en in de opsporing. Zo werk je als gedreven IT-er aan een veiliger Nederland.

Binnen de overheid worden verschillende registratiesystemen gebruikt voor de uitwisseling van gegevens. Voor de basisregistratie uitwisseling generiek (BRUG) zoeken wij een Java developer.

Functie
Als Java developer werk je in het scrumteam BRUG. In dit team vallen onder andere de producten personenserver en Externe Politie Broker (EPB).

De personenserver is de centrale component van de politie waarin persoonsgegevens worden vastgelegd. De personenserver zorgt er voor dat deze gegevens actueel gehouden worden door middel van communicatie met de gemeentelijke basisadministratie (GBA). Tevens biedt de personenserver de mogelijkheid te zoeken binnen GBA, zowel met een userinterface als door middel van een service ten behoeve van andere politie-informatiesystemen.

Als Java developer werk je intensief samen met je collega's in het scrumteam. Je realiseert nieuwe functionaliteiten die door middel van maandelijkse releases naar productie worden gebracht. Je bouwt en onderhoudt complexe (deel-)applicaties, voert unit- en systeemtests uit en schrijft handleidingen en scripts voor installatie en gebruik. Voor de EPB gaat het om kleinschalige wijzigingen op bestaande Java-programmatuur. Zo ontwikkel je als gedreven IT-er met het team door aan producten die cruciaal zijn voor het politiewerk op straat en in de opsporing. Je adviseert (applicatie-)management over toe te passen methoden en technieken en borgt de vastlegging daarvan. Vanuit je senioriteit heb je een coachende rol richting collega's.

Profiel
Wij zoeken een analytische collega met overtuigingskracht. Je bent klantgericht en leergierig. Je werkt actief mee aan kennisontwikkeling, zoekt de samenwerking en toont initiatief. Je hebt een multidisciplinaire instelling en bent bereid teamleden uit andere disciplines tijdens de sprint te ondersteunen om zo als team gezamenlijk het sprintdoel te bereiken. Je hebt:

  • een hbo-diploma informatica of vergelijkbaar;
  • aantoonbare ervaring met het werken in een scrumteam;
  • actuele kennis van softwareontwikkeling (waaronder architectuur) van JAVA/JEE platform;
  • bij voorkeur kennis van ontwikkeltools zoals ontwikkelstraattooling confluence, bitbucket, Eclipse, Maven, JIRA en Jenkins en de frameworks.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Deze functie is voor 36 uur per week. De politie biedt een tijdelijke aanstelling voor de duur van de werkzaamheden voor maximaal twee jaar. Het bruto maandsalaris bedraagt maximaal € 4286,- (schaal 10 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek. Daarnaast biedt de politie uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een 8% eindejaarsuitkering. De standplaats is Odijk

Binnen het interne functiegebouw van de politie (Landelijk Functiegebouw Nederlandse Politie, LFNP) betreft het de functie bedrijfsvoeringspecialist B, werkterrein informatie- en communicatietechnologie. Klik hier voor de volledige LFNP-functiebeschrijving.

Informatie en sollicitatie
Voor meer informatie over deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Ostar Roozenbeek, senior recruiter ICT, via tel. 06 - 47 65 91 71. Neem voor vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure contact op met het Frontoffice Recruitment & Selectie, tel. 088 - 6622300.

Interesse?
Reageer dan uiterlijk 30 januari 2017 via deze link

Bijzonderheden

  • Een betrouwbaarheids- en geschiktheidsonderzoek (lang) en eventueel een assessment maken deel uit van de selectieprocedure.
  • De politie maakt werk van diversiteit. Meer hierover lees je op politie.nl.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
jobs.title: Java developer BRUG

jobs.content:
GitLab Inc. is a company based on the GitLab open-source project. GitLab is a community project to which over 1,000 people worldwide have contributed. We are an active participant in this community, trying to serve its needs and lead by example. We have one [vision](https://about.gitlab.com/strategy): everyone can contribute to all digital content, and our mission is to change all creative work from read-only to read-write so that everyone can contribute.

We [value](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/#values) results, transparency, sharing, freedom, efficiency, frugality, collaboration, directness, kindness, diversity, boring solutions, and quirkiness. If these values match your personality, work ethic, and personal goals, we encourage you to visit our [primer](https://about.gitlab.com/primer) to learn more. Open source is our culture, our way of life, our story, and what makes us truly unique.

Top 10 reasons to work for GitLab:

1. Work with helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people.
1. Work remote so you have no commute and are free to travel and move.
1. Have flexible work hours so you are there for other people and free to plan the day how you like.
1. Everyone works remote, but you don't feel remote. We don't have a head office, so you're not in a satellite office.
1. Work on open source software so you can interact with a large community and can show your work.
1. Work on a product you use every day: we drink our own wine.
1. Work on a product used by lots of people that care about what you do.
1. As a company we contribute more than we take, most of our work is released as the open source GitLab CE.
1. Focussed on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life and don't burn out.
1. Open internal processes: know what you're getting in to and be assured we're thoughtful and effective.

See [our culture page](https://about.gitlab.com/culture) for more!

__Responsibilities__

* Manage day-to-day maintenance and evolution of GitLab's Prometheus monitoring and alerting infrastructure
* Bundle Prometheus as an out-of-the-box monitoring solution for GitLab CE/EE packages
* Contribute to the [Prometheus open source project(https://github.com/prometheus)
* Build and maintain a GitLab.com public monitoring gateway
* Help migrate our current performance monitoring solution to Prometheus
* Improve coverage of GitLab performance monitoring
* Measure applications deployed with GitLab (e.g. Mattermost)
* Create automated alerts to notify team members of regressions
* Document answers and improve existing documentation
* Write blog posts relevant to the community

__Requirements__

* Experience writing production-level applications in Go
* Experience with managing large amounts of telemetry
* Experience developing time-series databases
* You have contributions in the [Prometheus open source project](https://github.com/prometheus)

__Hiring Process__

Applicants for this position can expect the hiring process to follow the order below. Please keep in mind that applicants can be declined from the position at any stage of the process. To learn more about someone who may be conducting the interview, find her/his job title on our [team page](https://about.gitlab.com/team).

* Qualified applicants receive a short questionnaire from our Global Recruiters
* Selected candidates will be invited to schedule a [screening call](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/hiring/#screening-call) with our Global Recruiters
* Next, candidates will be invited to schedule a first interview with the Prometheus Lead
* Candidates will then be invited to schedule an interview with the Director of Strategic Partnerships
* Candidates will be invited to schedule a third interview with our VP of Engineering
* Finally, candidates will interview with our CEO
* Successful candidates will subsequently be made an offer via email

Additional details about our process can be found on our [hiring page](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/hiring).

__Apply__

Avoid the [confidence gap](http://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2014/05/the-confidence-gap/359815/); you do not have to match all the listed requirements exactly to apply. Our hiring process is described in more detail in our [hiring handbook](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/hiring/).

Work remotely from anywhere in the world. Curious to see what that looks like? Check out our [remote manifesto](https://about.gitlab.com/2015/04/08/the-remote-manifesto/).
jobs.title: Prometheus Engineer

jobs.content:
The Linux Foundation Overview

The Linux Foundation is creating the greatest shared technology investment in history by enabling open source collaboration across companies, developers, and users. We are the organization of choice to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption.

The Role

The Linux Foundation is seeking a web application developer to assist in developing and maintaining web properties that are part of the Linux Foundation's network of sites and web applications. We are looking for a developer who is dedicated, driven, and, passionate about their work. If you dream of contributing to a better future through the promotion of open source then the Linux Foundation is ideal for you.

We are looking for an experienced full-stack Node.js developer. The developer should be able to work with the full stack and learn quickly. While the position is primarily back end, you will also be expected to be comfortable in the front end. At the Linux Foundation, we prize technologists who have an excitement for our mission and are dedicated to growing their skills.

We are a fast moving team with a high tempo, we support a wide range of web properties and you need to be okay with expanding your skillset and range. Our team is from all over North America (US and Canada) and you must be comfortable working remotely in a team. This is a non-contract full time position. While the position is posted for Portland, since we are a fully remote team the role can be performed anywhere in the US, Canada or UK

At the Linux Foundation we want to make sure our developers are the best in the industry and thus invest in their own personal growth. You should have this same goal in mind when applying.

Requirements

  • At least 2 years of experience working with Node.js
  • Skilled in modern source control management with Git
  • Understands web application vulnerabilities and is able to write secure code
  • Proficiency with HTML5 & CSS Front-End libraries such as BootstrapProficiency with JavaScript / jQuery and Frameworks such as Angular, React, Express, or Ember
  • Experience with tools such as Grunt, Gulp or Webpack
  • Knowledge of SASS / LESS and how to compile and manage frameworks based upon them
  • Javascript / NodeJS / ECMAScript best practices and standards
  • Responsive design and cross browser compatibility/testing
  • Experience using Node.js test frameworks and automated user testing frameworks
  • Good communication and analytical skills
  • Excellent time management skills and able to work remotely
  • Experience with Continuous Integration practices
  • Able to work individually or as part of a larger team
  • Must be legally allowed to work in in their country of residence

Nice To Have

  • Experience with AWS products and cloud based application architecture
  • Familiarity with Gerrit
  • Python development skills
  • PHP development skills
  • You consider yourself a polyglot when it comes to learning new programming languages
  • Familiarity with Docker
  • Creating multilingual websites

The Linux Foundation is a largely virtual workforce. We are as passionate of providing a flexible and supportive work culture as we are in Open Source Software. Collaboration is in our DNA, and we pride ourselves on being able to work closely together while not being tied to an office. We offer exceptional benefits - e.g., Fantastic health care, Unlimited PTO, 100% 401k match up to $18k, profit-sharing and exceptional healthcare plans.

The Linux Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.content:
__Linux Foundation Overview__

The Linux Foundation is creating the greatest shared technology investment in history by enabling open source collaboration across companies, developers, and users. We are the organization of choice to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption.

We are looking for an experienced Linux Systems Engineer to join the Certification IT team. The Certification IT team is responsible for the development and support of the Certification Platform which hosts various skills based technical exams.

For more information about our service, visit https://training.linuxfoundation.org/certification.

__Job Responsibilities__

* Assist in design, development, testing, implementation, deployment and maintenance of distributed systems across multiple regions within different Cloud providers.
* Provide level 3 technical support to Linux Foundation support staff on platform operational related issues.
* Document technical design and processes for Linux Foundation team members.

__Skills and Technical Experience__

* Advanced Linux system programming in bash and python.
* Linux systems management using SaltStack and the SaltStack API.
* Low level Linux system administration experience with CentOS, Ubuntu and openSUSE with excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
* Experience using git for version control.
* Experience with AWS services EC2, CloudFormation, SQS, S3, VPC, IAM and Route53 in a production environment.
* OpenStack experience running in a production environment.
* Experience with building and deploying Docker containers within production environments.
* Python experience in building HTTP API clients and servers.
* A demonstrated ability in writing technical documentation for team members to communicate complex design, concepts and workflows.
* Ability to work autonomously from a remote location with team members being located in the United States, Canada and Australia.

__Software Experience__

* boto and boto3
* Flask and Flask-RESTful
* SQLAlchemy and Alembic
* RQ (Redis Queue)
* Requests
* marshmallow
* swagger
* unittest.mock
* moto
* Jinja2

__Systems Administration, Orchestration and Cloud Experience__

* SaltStack
* AWS services (CloudFormation, S3, SQS, EC2, VPC, IAM, Route 53)
* Terraform
* Docker
* Nagios
* Packer
* Openstack-Ansible

The Linux Foundation is a largely all-remote workforce that hires top-notch talent.  We are as passionate of providing a flexible and supportive work culture as we are in Open Source Software.  Collaboration is in our DNA, and we pride ourselves on being able to work closely together while not being tied to an office.

_The Linux Foundation is an equal opportunity employer._

jobs.content:

The Linux Foundation is creating the greatest shared technology investment in history by enabling open source collaboration across companies, developers, and users. We are the organization of choice to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption.

__The Position__

The Linux Foundation is seeking to hire a full-time, junior-level systems administrator to work on our common IT services platforms. While the position is posted for Portland, OR, the Linux Foundation is a virtual organization so the position could be based anywhere in the United States or Canada.

__Tasks Include:__

* Second tier for troubleshooting and resolution of technical issues reported by staff and external service users, and identifying problem for resolution or escalation to development or senior systems adminstratiors.

jobs.title: Junior Systems Administrator

jobs.content:
Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 50,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release, Elastic's products have achieved more than 50 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations like Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, NY Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam and Mountain View, California; and has over 350 employees in over 30 countries around the world.

As product adoption has soared within organizations ranging from the worldâs largest financial institutions like Goldman Sachs, government organizations like NASA, large technology firms like Adobe, Cisco, HP, IBM, Microsoft, and Salesforce, and innovative companies like BlaBlaCar, Facebook, Github, Netflix, Uber, Yelp and Wikipedia, demand for hosted and managed Elasticsearch solutions have increasingly been on the rise for developers and companies who want a cloud option.

In March 2015, Elastic launched Elasticsearch as a Service. Today, the Elastic Cloud (hosted on AWS) is the only hosted Elasticsearch product on the market supported by the creators and engineers of the Elastic Stack. In addition, the Elastic Cloud is the only solution fully integrated with Elasticâs X-Pack plugins (security, alerting, monitoring, graph, and reporting) and continuously aligned to the latest version of the Elastic Stack. 

Just like the success of our open source products, we are experiencing the same with the Elastic Cloud. Thus, we are seeking an exceptional finance professional to drive all financial planning, reporting, and analysis efforts to help grow and scale our cloud business. This role will provide the analysis needed to evolve our understanding of our cloud business, provide recommendations to maximize the opportunity ahead while balancing risk, and help facilitate executive decision making. This person should bring a passion to evolve our financial analysis while working seamlessly across Field Operations, Product Management, and Finance to grow and scale the Elastic Cloud.

__Responsibilities__

* Own all monthly Cloud related KPIs (e.g., net expansion)
* Own the end-to-end Cloud budget and forecast process working closely with sales ops for bookings input, along with monthly actual to plan variance analysis of the financial elements to provide an understanding of the deltas and drivers.
* Build out and maintain a comprehensive model to measure the dynamics across the Cloud business end-to-end from website visitors to customer acquisition, bookings, revenue, expense and cash flow, working with the sales operations team for input to point of bookings. 
* Support territory carving and GTM resource planning to optimize our coverage model across top markets and our incentive comp strategy across all GTM roles.
* Gather market intelligence to benchmark growth, renewal, expansion, and margins / profitability against other cloud businesses. 
* Provide insight and data points to assist with pricing strategy decisions and sensitivity analysis in respect to margin implications.
* Develop a model for AWS usage to optimize cost considering commitment vs datacenter utilization, analyzing cost components and drivers. Review all AWS bills to ensure accuracy.
* Identify and recommend actions to improve margins. 

__Desired Background__

* BS/BA required, MBA a strong plus but not required.
* 5+ years work experience in FP&A, Management Consulting, or similar field in SaaS organizations.
* Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft recommendations and results into easily digestible messages, communications, and executive presentations.
* Very strong executive presence and engagement skills.
* Highly collaborative style with strong influence skills and the ability to adjust on the fly to new demands with a sense of urgency.
* Ability to thrive in a fast paced start-up environment.
* Power user proficiency with the MS Office suite (especially MS Excel and MS Powerpoint). VBA and Macros a plus but not required.

_Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law._
jobs.title: Financial Analyst Cloud

jobs.content:
Thanks to our ongoing expansion we have the opportunity to grow our Cloud Site Reliability team. We're a part of the Elastic Cloud team with an operations background who aren’t afraid to get our hands dirty.  We are the first line of consumers for Elastic's products and our experience helps influence the direction of the product.   While most organizations may have a single or a handful of Elastic Stack deployments, here, you’ll be responsible for identifying, troubleshooting and reporting platform problems to developers in order to ensure that the thousands of Elasticsearch clusters that we manage are providing a stable and reliable service.  We’re looking for people who are just as excited about troubleshooting issues with distributed systems as they are to automate, code and collaborate to solve problems.


Responsibilities



  • Report and troubleshoot problems within the Elastic Cloud infrastructure services and collaborate on issues with developers

  • Handle day to day operations around the Elastic Cloud such as customer trouble tickets managing cloud provider infrastructure (maintenance/expansion), and software deployments

  • Develop and enhance tooling to deploy and manage the Elastic Cloud product and infrastructure

  • Demonstrate and promote best practices for teams using cloud platforms
jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer for Elastic

jobs.content:
Machine Learning at Elastic


With the recent addition of Prelert to Elastic, we now have a fully dedicated Machine Learning team in house. Our goal is to further expand our capabilities in developing technologies that allow users to better understand the behavior of their data. Our team has developed an unsupervised machine learning engine that can plow through large amounts of data and automatically find those insights our users today have been proactively finding using search. Current use cases include finding anomalies within transactions / operational metrics, detecting uncharacteristic user behavior, finding a population of attacking IP addresses but we are looking forward to expanding our capabilities to many more in the future.  And in order to get there, our team is looking to hire an exceptional Research Engineer to join them. This is an amazing opportunity to join a small, highly experienced team where you can make an immediate impact and contribution to the core of our new machine learning offering. 


Your role:


As a Research Engineer - Machine Learning you will be a pivotal part of our Prelert team and will contribute to the further development of our Machine Learning focussed projects by being a subject matter expert and resource to the software design and development process.  


Our Research team at Elastic focuses on developing and applying techniques from Machine Learning, statistics and data mining, including but not limited to Bayesian modelling, counterfactual reasoning, feature learning and data stream processing. Our goal is to build powerful and robust solutions such as anomaly detection, categorisation and recommendation, enabling customers to gain insight from their data.
jobs.title: Research Engineer Machine Learning For Elastic

jobs.content:
Thanks to our ongoing expansion we have the opportunity to grow our Infrastructure team, this time with a focus in services that support all things geo.


The Infrastructure Team


We're software developers that love deployment. We are the first users of Elastic's products. We contribute all over engineering, touching many different projects, to build infrastructure with minimal red tape. We continuously integrate.  We build large clusters of Elasticsearch. We build dashboards and monitoring. We build distributed system tests. Not only do we use our products, we deploy them multiple ways with different versions running side-by-side. We try out new technology to use what we like and better our own products. We push configuration management to its limits. We mimic what users do, hoping to hit problems before they do.


We also support systems that our community, internal and external, relies on, like our Download Service, Benchmark Service, and our extensive distributed build farm.  Most recently we've deployed our Elastic Tile Service.  This position would have the opportunity to improve and expand on that service.


What would I do?



  • Design and develop infrastructure supporting the Elastic Tile Service and other geo-focused business goals, tying together requirements from our various product teams, and training fellow team members to help support.

  • Join in the normal operation of the Infra team's daily tasks: supporting users and building tools
jobs.title: Infrastructure/Geo Engineer- Leading Open Source Company

jobs.content:
Logstash is a popular, open source data processing platform and an important component of the Elastic Stack. Users have downloaded Logstash millions of times for its simplicity and extensibility. Over the last few years, Logstash has evolved to become a powerful server-side data processing platform responsible for ingesting terabytes of data into Elasticsearch and other systems.


The Logstash team is responsible for developing the core infrastructure and its thriving plugin ecosystem. Most parts of Logstash is written in JRuby, but recently core components have been implemented in Java. As Logstash matures into being a ubiquitous data pipeline, our team is building new features to make it resilient, faster, and easier, to drive our next wave of adoption. You'll work with a diverse, distributed and fun loving team based in North America and Europe. The Engineering organization at Elastic is different — we are spread across 30+ countries, have a flexible, family-friendly work schedule, make great software, love autonomy and most importantly, love our users.
jobs.title: Software Engineer- JRuby- Leading Open Source Company

jobs.content:
Elastic is building out our Elastic Cloud Team focusing on Elastic as a Service. This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation.


Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This product would be built on technologies such as OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elastic Clusters.


Job Duties and Requirements



  • Develop software for our distributed systems and ES as a Service offerings.

  • Have familiarity with failures and complications related to a cloud offering

  • Help build the Found offering and work closely with the Elastic Cloud Product and Engineering Team

  • Assist in designing a scalable cloud offering working across multiple clusters
jobs.title: Sr Cloud Engineer- Scala- For Elastic

jobs.content:
Automattic builds related content, recommendations, and search for websites, e-commerce sites, blogs, and the WordPress.com Reader. We connect millions of publishers with billions of readers every month and look for ways to help new publishers build an audience. We have only just started to scratch the surface of providing engaging, relevant search results for the Open Web.

[Our system](https://data.blog/2016/05/03/state-of-wordpress-com-elasticsearch-systems-2016/) runs on open source: Elasticsearch, MySQL, Spark, Kafka, HDFS (and WordPress of course).

Sound fun? It is.

__Here are some skills that will come in handy:__

* Experience with Open Source search systems: Elasticsearch, Solr, Lucene.
* Great programming skills in both dynamic and compiled languages (especially PHP and Java/Scala).
* Knowledge of scaling search systems: high volume indexing and querying.
* Understanding how to combine and build signals from many sources to create and evaluate novel search algorithms.
* A strong understanding of distributed computing and system performance.
* Ability to take a project from idea to implementation, putting the minimal system needed into production, but with an eye on where we need to be in 5 years.
* Great troubleshooting skills.
jobs.title: Search Wrangler
