jobs.content:
IF YOU’RE A TASK-KILLING,


RIGOROUS THINKING,


ONLY-NEED-TO-BE-TOLD ONCE WARRIOR,


WHO FINDS SATISFACTION IN ORGANIZING CHAOS


WITH A RIDICULOUS SENSE OF OWNERSHIP,


AND YOU LOVE ENGINEERING...


THIS JOB MIGHT BE FOR YOU.


Title: Senior Quality Engineer


Department: Engineering


Reports To: CTO


At AutoLotto we’re assembling a world-class team of brilliant minds, resourceful doers and creative problem-solvers with a ‘find a way or make a way’ attitude. Founded in 2015 and based in San Francisco, California, AutoLotto is creating the next generation of lottery ticket sales & ticket management systems. We make buying and redeeming lottery tickets more convenient, secure and intelligent through our mobile application and online platform and we’re looking to grow our team of ‘BAMFs’ across key regions in the United States.


In the engineering team, we test our agility everyday, knocking out features and deploying high quality, maintainable and functional software. On any given day we knock out hundreds of scrum points and work to improve the quality and functionality of a rapidly growing product and infrastructure.  We’re data driven and growth-focused.  Our work directly impacts the success of the company and will be critical to our rapid growth and scale.


To achieve our mission, we look for high caliber people who share the following core characteristics:


Grit: Resilient marathoners who finish what they start and love tackling problems of all sizes. We take critical feedback and push through to get the job done.


Rigor: Data driven, analytical and exhaustive in decision making. We take in the evidence, integrate information from multiple sources quickly, draw conclusions and take actions - quickly.


Collaboration: We leave our egos at home, we challenge each other and we work together to find the best solutions, every day, day in and day out.


Ownership: We sign up for the hard stuff and take extreme ownership to see it through. We make lemonade out of lemons when we have to and don’t let attitude get in the way of getting it done.


Curiosity:  Most of us dork out over non-work related topics at a ridiculous level of detail, because that’s how we’re wired. We’re naturally inquisitive, ask tough questions and aren’t afraid to ruffle feathers to find better answers.


Honesty: We’re transparent and honest because that’s the right way to treat other people. Integrity is the basis of trust, and trust is everything when you’re creating the future together.


Responsibilities



  • Take ownership over testing and assuring quality of mission critical applications

  • Produce maintainable, functional, high reliability code, procedures and tests which ensure compliance of key product functionality

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of system architecture and design

  • Work with the engineering team and participate in our SCRUM process



Skills & Requirements



Requirements



  • 3-5 year experience working in testing web/mobile applications

  • An ability to always focus on the company objectives and the mission at hand.

  • Track record of dedication to creating maintainable, functional and reliable systems, consistent demonstration of grit, rigor, curiosity, teamwork, ownership and integrity

  • Ability to pass background check, has appropriate work authorization

  • Honorable discharge (military only)
jobs.title: Senior Quality Test Engineer

jobs.content:
About Us

At Localvore Today, weâre building a marketing and ecommerce platform to support local merchants.

For consumers, our products will provide the place to find locally sourced, owned, and loved restaurants. Travelling? Taking your relatives or a date out for dinner? Localvore Today can tell you which restaurants and businesses support the local economy youâre in. Weâll even tell you which farms your food comes from and which other merchants provide their products.

Our merchants will have access to customers who want their products and a suite of tools which make it simple and affordable to market directly to those customers. Once a customer is engaged, weâll provide the ability to engage with them directly, receive their praise and address any concerns they may have. Weâll also simplify merchantsâ lives by propagating their hours, menu, and location changes to the entire internet. Our long term vision includes facilitating complete local economies with features such as supply-chain management.

We are currently a B-certified corp and are moving toward becoming a certified B-corp. It is in our mission to benefit the public at large and socially conscious businesses that are mindful of their impact on the environment, economy, and local community.

The Job

Our frontend applications are built using React, Redux, Bootstrap 4 and SCSS. You should be able to work with these technologies on day one, but also be on the lookout for how to do things better. As our first senior engineer focused on the frontend, your opinions will help define our stack going forward.

Among other things, youâll be responsible for:

  • Turning provided SCSS/HTML into fully functional applications with data provided by our JSON:API endpoints and Algolia powered search indices
  • Providing occasional front-end support for JavaScript issues
  • Interviewing, mentoring and leading junior team members
  • Reviewing pull requests to ensure adherence to quality and design standards
  • Collaborating in the creation of clean, straight-forward, innovative user interfaces
  • Being the user-advocate by subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centered perspective

You can work remotely or out of our HQ in Burlington, VT where we have Kombucha and Beer on tap. Regardless of where you work, we have generous benefits and perks available.

About You

You are a Localvore who loves amazing local food and is a US resident or citizen. You want to empower small businesses to compete with national and global chains. Youâre passionate about frontend tech, play well with others, can lead and be led and can help define and complete detail oriented work. You have big ideas, know youâre amazing and operate with a tiny ego. From time to time your passion extends to side / pet projects that further enhance your skills.

  • 5+ years of professional software development experience
  • Experience with modern frameworks like React and Redux
  • A proven track record of delivering products inside of a remote team (if remote)
  • Tolerance for others and any viewpoints they have that may run counter to your own
  • Experience working on an Agile team
  • Mastery of ES5, ES6, HTML5 & CSS
  • Experience implementing real-time technologies
  • Significant knowledge of and experience with RESTful APIs

Bonus points if you:

  • have implemented on top of JSON:API
  • have open source contributions that show off what you can do
  • know Elixir, Erlang, Ruby or PHP

To apply: If youâre an awesome person with amazing skills and want a place where you can excel, impact national (and eventually international) commerce, work when and where you want, and have an ownership stake in the farm to table, local economy, contact Dan at danm@localvoretoday.com. US residents only at this time.

jobs.content:
The Company
Recruiterbox allows companies to centralize their hiring process in one convenient software. We are rapidly growing and are already used by 2000+ companies across the globe including LonelyPlanet, BookMyShow, and the US Government.

The Role
Here at Recruiterbox we are in love with listening to our customers. Almost every change we make in our system is a direct result of a suggestion by one of our customers.  
As a Customer Happiness Representative you are at the crux of this communication. In this role you will be licensed, equipped and expected to WOW our customers daily.  The honest truth - our customers really love Recruiterbox and our support team, and we take our role very seriously.

This means:
  • You are our customerâs voice to the product team
  • You are the liaison between what our customers think, and our entire company
  • You are the face of Recruiterbox

On a typical day you will:
  • Talk to prospects and customers over email and chat, to resolve their product questions
  • Respond caringly, accurately, and quickly to every single customer request
  • Create WOW moments for our customers
  • Pair with our technical and product teams to resolve issues and give customer feedback
  • Ensure all pending queries and issues are resolved in a timely manner
  • Take ownership.  Oversight isnât our thing.  Weâll give you the base and youâre expected to excel from there

Youâre best for this role if:
  • Talking to people and helping them solve their problems makes you happy
  • Every interaction you have with others is filled with patience and empathy
  • You can talk like a human, even when things get technical.  You are a human, and youâll be writing to humans.  We expect skilled and eloquent English writing and speaking skills
  • You are responsible, organized and prompt.  You do what you say you will do, without being reminded
  • You have a true desire to be the best part of our customerâs day
  • Canned and automated responses make your skin crawl
  • You are open to change - weâre growing fast, and your role will evolve as we do

The Benefits:
  • Work with a passionate team, growing a global customer base
  • Work for a company who sees Customer Support as a key voice in product decisions
  • Competitive Market Salary
  • Work remotely from anywhere you'd like (US residents only)
  • Hours will be based around US Eastern or Central time workday

Ready to sit at the Adult Table?  Your move.

To apply: https://recruiterbox.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0mmwx?cjb_hash=O_kTGZ15

jobs.content:
The rising popularity of GitLab means that our professional services are in high demand. If you have the skills to help our clients we would love to talk to you.


We are looking for skilled people around the world. If you would love to work from home and help GitLab grow, this is the right spot for you.


Responsibilities



  • Engage with our customers—anything from a small advertising firm or a university, to Fortune 100 clients and help them with anything from a simple support ticket to a customer training

  • Communicate via email and video conferencing with potential and current clients

  • Maintain GitLab.com and our other services such as GitHost.io

  • Participate in the rotating "on-call" list to provide 24/7 emergency response availability

  • Ensure that everything we learn from running GitLab.com is set as default or communicated to our users

  • Write and update documentation based on customer interactions

  • Submit and comment on feature requests based on customer interactions


More information can be found on the support page in the handbook.


Junior Service Engineer


Junior Service Engineer's responsibilities cover all the support channels that are supported by a level 3 or 4 SLA, per the definitions on the Support page.


Senior Service Engineer


Senior Service Engineers are experienced Service Engineers who



  • have deep knowledge of GitLab internals and a variety of possible configurations

  • help hire and train new Service Engineers

  • are a go-to person for the other Service Engineers when they face tough challenges

  • improve the support process (Optimize Zendesk flow, suggest rake task additions)

  • write blog articles

  • take ownership of documentation and feature requests that is based on customer interactions

  • create merge requests to fix bugs
jobs.title: Service Engineer

jobs.content:
GitLab Inc. is a company based on the GitLab open-source project. GitLab is a community project to which over 1,000 people worldwide have contributed. We are an active participant in this community, trying to serve its needs and lead by example. We have one vision: everyone can contribute to all digital content, and our mission is to change all creative work from read-only to read-write so that everyone can contribute.


We value results, transparency, sharing, freedom, efficiency, frugality, collaboration, directness, kindness, diversity, boring solutions, and quirkiness. If these values match your personality, work ethic, and personal goals, we encourage you to visit ourprimer to learn more. Open source is our culture, our way of life, our story, and what makes us truly unique.


Top 10 reasons to work for GitLab:



  1. Work with helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people.

  2. Work remote so you have no commute and are free to travel and move.

  3. Have flexible work hours so you are there for other people and free to plan the day how you like.

  4. Everyone works remote, but you don't feel remote. We don't have a head office, so you're not in a satellite office.

  5. Work on open source software so you can interact with a large community and can show your work.

  6. Work on a product you use every day: we drink our own wine.

  7. Work on a product used by lots of people that care about what you do.

  8. As a company we contribute more than we take, most of our work is released as the open source GitLab CE.

  9. Focussed on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life and don't burn out.

  10. Open internal processes: know what you're getting in to and be assured we're thoughtful and effective.


See our culture page for more!


At GitLab, developers are highly independent and self-organized individual contributors who work together as a tight team in aremote and agile way.


Most backend developers work on all aspects of GitLab, building features, fixing bugs, and generally improving the application. Some developers specialize and focus on a specific area, such as packaging, performance or GitLab CI. Developers can specialize immediately after joining, or after some time, when they have gained familiarity with many areas of GitLab and find one they would like to focus on.


Responsibilities



  • Develop features from proposal to polished end result.

  • Support and collaborate with our service engineers in getting to the bottom of user-reported issues and come up with robust solutions.

  • Engage with the core team and the open source community to collaborate on improving GitLab.

  • Manage and review code contributed by the rest of the community and work with them to get it ready for production.

  • Create and maintain documentation around features and configuration to save our users time.

  • Take initiative in improving the software in small or large ways to address pain points in your own experience as a developer.

  • Keep code easy to maintain and keep it easy for others to contribute code to GitLab.

  • Qualify developers for hiring.

jobs.content:
As the Head of Engineering (m/f) for one of our companies, you will guide technical teams building systems and products that may be used by tens of millions of people around the world every day from our headquarters in Berlin.


You will manage one or more cross-functional teams, taking them from concept to production, while remaining involved from a hands-on technical standpoint.


About the position:



  • You are responsible for the development and supervision of a team consisting of developers, testers and system experts and will be interfacing with a product counterpart.

  • You find and hire talented people to build up great teams.

  • You lead the development of multiple high-traffic sites and mobile apps.

  • You learn from and share knowledge with other Rocket ventures worldwide.

  • With your deep knowledge, you are able to solve complex problems and support your team in a hands-on manner.

  • You are in charge of code quality and architecture.

  • You manage projects, timelines and releases.
jobs.title: Head of Engineering

jobs.content:
Qubit’s platform consumes and enriches billions of events a day, and serves out millions of personalisations to some of the biggest properties on the Internet. Our platform provides the backbone on which all of Qubit’s rich SaaS products are built.


ARE YOU…


Passionate about software engineering? Do you like hardcore programming in a wide range of languages or are willing to learn to do so? Do Big Data problems keep you up at night? Are you looking to get your hands dirty with some of the hottest technologies in the industry right now? Then look no further and apply for this position.


Experimental? You are happy to embrace new technologies and tools that help us solve the hard problems intrinsic to a rapidly growing, disruptive technology such as ours. The current version of the platform leverages the following: Kafka, Hadoop, Storm, Spark, Dataflow, HBase, BigTable, BigQuery, Hive, Redshift, Redis, Java, Scala, Python, Go, Clojure, Avro, Protobuf, et al. We love open source and so should you.


YOU WILL BE…


Helping us engineer and maintain a low-latency, high-throughput platform that is responsible for capturing, validating, enriching, storing, and serving billions of data points a day.


This entails full-stack engineering from writing real-time processing applications to scaling up our distributed data storage solutions and from tuning JVMs to working with globally distributed infrastructure. Stable, deterministic, well-documented, fully-tested, scalable, and concurrent are some of the keywords that will apply to your code.


What the team has worked on recently:



  • Brought down our end-to-end processing SLA from the order of hours to minutes.

  • Productionised a Javascript and Clojure service under Nashorn in a distributed big data engine (crazy? we know).

  • Upgraded our data ingestion and processing pipeline to support validation and evolution of our clients’ data fabric.

  • Implemented systems for web-scale data lookup and temporal count distinct operations.


Oh, and we get early access to technology before anyone else in the industry. We are also agile with scrums and stand ups but we still maintain the chaos inherent to a dynamic engineering environment: we build and fix stuff as rapidly as we break and scale it.


What you’ll need:


In addition to a zest for problem solving, an ideal candidate should possess the following skills:



  • Experience with at least one programming language (even if it’s esoteric).

  • A degree in Computer Science/Mathematics/Engineering or a related field or equivalent industry experience.

  • “Never say never” approach to challenges.

  • Ability to take up new technologies with ease.

  • Excited by the prospects of working in an engineering team that spans three continents, multiple timezones, and endless enthusiasm.

  • Willing to embrace Qubit’s values: “Voice it. Own it. Do it.”

  • Up for telling the world the Truth About Data


Plenty of perks


As well as the opportunity to solve complex problems, we like to look after our fellow Qubyte, so you'll get:



  • Generous equity options and performance centric bonuses.

  • Acknowledgment and recognition for your performance and skills via the ability to climb up the engineering ladder.

  • Top of the line medical and dental insurance.

  • Free onsite yoga and meditation classes.

  • A competitive office where we play foosball, football, scrabble, go-karting… you name it, we’ll play and ace it.

  • A fridge fully stocked with healthy snacks and the ultimate espresso machine for both your “cookie” and “Java” fixes (puns intended).


At Qubit, we champion diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace difference with open arms and see it as a huge benefit to our community. We are dedicated to equal opportunity regardless of  race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. If you have a disability or need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
jobs.title: Polyglot Software Engineer to work on a cutting edge Big Data Platform

jobs.content:
Canonical, the company behind Ubuntu, is seeking a software engineer on the Juju Networking team. This role is critical to the success of the Juju product. In this position, you will not just write code; but will be defining and solving very complex cloud networking problems within a model driven environment. Example problems include handling of overlay networks, public and private networks on a single L2 device across OpenStack, bare metal, containers and public clouds. These exciting challenges make our customerâs experience modeling Big Software like OpenStack, Big Data and Kubernetes across bare metal and public/private clouds a breeze.

Juju is the leading operations modeling tool. We aspire to be at the center of a revolution in the datacenter, moving from âhardware definedâ static resource allocation, to a new dynamic software defined datacenter. By bringing your in-depth cloud networking skills, this will enable our customers to build dynamic and scalable solutions to their orchestration problems.

Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, in particular, software defined networking and modern networking topologies. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

  • Networking expertise, especially with modern network topologies and software defined networks.
  • Experience with production deployments and network configurations of OpenStack.
  • Experience with networking functionality of multiple major public cloud providers.
  • Understanding of container networks.
  • Experience with LInux networking fundamentals.
  • Knowledge of tun/tap devices, veth pairs, GRE tunnels, bridges, VLANS, network bonds, routing, iptables, L2/L3 topologies.
  • Experience with IPv6.
  • Experience with the Go programming language is a plus otherwise C or similar experience required.
  • Lead by example by being a respected and effective team lead on the juju-core networking project.
  • Must be able to travel at least two times a year for a week at a time.

To apply: https://ldd.tbe.taleo.net/ldd03/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=CANONICAL&cws=1&rid=1212

jobs.content:
Olo’s software engineers develop the next-generation of digital ordering technologies for many of the country’s largest and fastest-growing restaurant brands. We are laser focused on continually improving ourselves and our products while prioritizing relationships at work and at home. We thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment, collaborating with some of the best engineers across the nation.


Our current technologies include modern versions of C#, F#, ASP.NET MVC, Ember, React, Javascript, HTML/CSS, Xamarin, and MSSQL. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, and Octopus.


As a part of Olo’s Engineering team, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will help us build new features and products, with responsibilities that span software design, test automation, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of our applications and services.


Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, nearly half of our engineering team is remote!

jobs.content:
What Will You Do?


You will be working on the development of web and mobile applications in the Cloud and in environments of the customer’s choice. We need an individual who takes a specific interest in building upon the latest of Google’s various Cloud Platform products, and other 3rd-party systems, to create robust and complete solutions for our customers.


Software development projects will range from Google App Scripts to full, web/mobile applications. Understanding and potentially being able to use different tools in the appropriate situation, such as AngularJS, React, Backbone, Mustache, jQuery, Python, Go and Node.js will be important – as is the ability to solve problems with a variety of tools. You have built applications on Google App Engine and/or Container Engine or other cloud platforms, and are comfortable modeling data with Google’s Datastore, specifically NDB.  If the following site excites you, that’s a big step in the right direction: http://javascript.crockford.com/


Who are You?


You spend hours learning web/mobile development frameworks, and are never satisfied with a solution being ‘good enough’.  Keeping up with the most cutting edge technology the world has to offer – you know that the Google Cloud Platform is poised to be the most advanced system in the world.


You’ve already built some apps that integrate with their REST APIs, and consider yourself skilled in Apps Script, App Engine, Compute Engine, Container Engine, DataStore, CloudSQL, Coud Storage, Big Query and are eager to expand your knowledge of the Maps APIs and Machine Learning.  You’ve got a few go to frameworks like Angular.js and jQuery, and have experience developing applications in Java, Python, PHP, Go, Angular.js and other JavaScript libraries. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop professional, highly scalable and interactive web and mobile applications as custom solutions for clients

  • Full lifecycle application development

  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.
    Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis using the Agile Scrum development process

  • Performance unit-based software testing and quality assurance while building out the application

  • Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality

  • Integrate software with existing systems

  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation

  • Work closely with Project Manager on client discovery, project estimating and project progression, testing, deployment, and iterations

NOTE: No sponsorship for US residency, No agencies, No Candidates outside the US or Canada

The Quality Analyst is responsible for the testing and validating of software and systems to ensure that internal and external customers’ requirements and needs are met. Your willingness to listen and improve, problem solve, and take charge in quality improvement and control will help us succeed and innovate our products.  The QA Analyst will be also be responsible for finding problems with design and root causes for bugs before they can be discovered by our customer base.

jobs.content:
Our microservice architecture of 17 loosely coupled Rails services (http REST, async queuing etc) has been developed for the last 2 years. It's in production, supporting multiple brands and driving millions of dollars of revenue every month from US sales.


We are looking for one more smart developer to join a new team and help us deliver more features, faster for our long-term client. Are you an experienced engineer looking for a new challenge? Does working in a company that specialises in high performing distributed teams sound exciting?


What do we offer?



  • Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team

  • A focussed adherance to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)

  • Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) - and the opportunity to own the solutions

  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people

  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc

  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks

  • Competitive rates

  • A long term working relationship: at least a year working on this project, then others.


You'll be:



  • Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time)

  • Solving hard business logic with elegant software design

  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale

  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.

  • Writing well tested (rspec), defect free code with CI/CD

  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality

  • Occasionally going full stack and also building functionality for the SPAs in javascript (experience in node/react/backbone is useful) 


Good english verbal and written communication skills are essential. 


This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full time project) for the the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office.

jobs.content:
Are you an amateur? Someone who enjoys talking code theory but rarely ships? Do you like to overcomplicate, and see pragmatic development principles as another theory to discuss, rather than work by? Do you need meetings and micromanagement to feel important and hide the fact youâre not producing anything valuable?

If you answered yes to any of the above, please stop reading now. Find yourself a nice startup in San Fran that has reached itâs series Z round of funding for a product no one wants and that is still in beta. Iâm sure they'll be happy spending someone elseâs money to pay you an exorbitant rate for producing little. Milk them for the few months they remain in business before realising at some point they need to make money.

We're a small team building a big sugar dating site, we get shit done and donât take ourselves too seriously. Weâre looking for another Rails pro. Someone who relishes the fact we donât have meetings, and everyoneâs too busy shipping to look over your shoulder and make sure you're doing the same. You'll enjoy the freedom to express yourself and have a say in the design and functionality of the features you build. 

The day you join the team you will double our number of back end devs. Youâll love the fact there's nowhere to hide if youâre not producing, youâre a pro after all. We need you to have experience shipping code on user-facing sites. You will learn and teach in this position, just not the basics. 

Initially you'll join the team on a per-project basis - perhaps as a part-time reprieve from the bureaucracy of your day job. Weâre bootstrapped and care about profit but have the means to reward you well if youâre creating value. Do the work and weâll enjoy many years of creation together. We have no interest in becoming a giant team thatâs hard to manage, so hopefully you're the last back end dev hire we ever need to make.

If you were mildly entertained, or want a job we would love to hear from you! Tell us about the user-facing work you've shipped, and why weâd be stupid not to hire you. Bonus points if youâve developed for mobile or social apps before.

Thanks
Zak, <insert ego-satisfying title>

PS. If youâre quick with your application and proving youâre a Rails beast, weâll fly you to join us for a week of hacking in Italy later this month. We hear the pizza is good, they make a decent tiramisu and a chianti or two never hurts our creativity.

To apply: Send your proof of being able to do the work - e.g. past experience shipping user-facing work to apply@secretbenefits.com
jobs.title: Rails Pro Needed

jobs.content:
There are no benefits and the pay wonât go far in New York or San Fran. The work may be tedious with dating profile reviews and often answering similar support questions. At times you will lose faith in humanity and wonder how the asker gets by each day. If you need your social life packaged in a meal-deal with your work, prepare to be underwhelmed. No one will look over your shoulder to ensure the work gets done.

If youâre still reading, this might be your dream job. Our sugar dating site users are in need of your TLC. You will send support emails that help them succeed in finding matches, and ensure they donât have a Kardashian as their profile pic. Repetitive clichÃ©s will amuse you. The photos that make you wish iPhones never had cameras will morbidly fascinate, rather than offend. 

If customer service is your passion, perfect! More likely itâs not but this job will free you to follow it. Your working hours will be flexible, although ideally aiming for full-time with most during 7am-9pm EST. Put in the work without someone having to prod you, and you can have a great time. Prove yourself and join the ranks of our core team that has been together for years.

Our small team is distributed globally. We get shit done but donât take ourselves too seriously. We are not a startup and measure success by the apparently-unsexy metric of making more money than we spend. We donât use words like âdisruptâ, and implemented our âexit strategyâ when we escaped the confines of the 9-5 tedium and commute.

If you were mildly entertained, or want a job we would love to hear from you! 

To apply: Send your best proof of being able to do this work to apply@secretbenefits.com

jobs.content:
Your most exciting challenge yet!



Location: Bangkok, Thailand - permanent role

Visa sponsored

.Net C# / Java

Architect, Technical Lead, Fullstack Web Developer, Senior Engineer.

Whatever you want to call it one thing is for sure, you've got exceptional Engineering pedigree and are looking for an opportunity to shine!

At Agoda we believe in empowering you to perform your best work. Period.

From scoping thru' design, build, testing and deployment, what you build today will be live and used by millions tomorrow. From top to bottom we give you the tools to succeed and autonomy to get the job done. After all, you're an exceptional Engineer passionate about your craft; you don't need babysitting.

But you DO love working as part of a team, and welcome the abundance of collaboration at Agoda. You're not hung up on job titles, no matter who's round the table we've all got an equal voice, and we love working together to solve complex programming problems.

Scalable, distributed architecture is your bread and butter, you love scaling systems that serve millions of customers in diverse markets and working out the best way to scale out the platform whilst focusing on performance, reliability and user experience.

Experience?

Commercial experience of scalable distributed systems, full SDLC incl. unit testing, Java, .Net C# or Scala OOP expert (we work in C# .Net framework), front end skills nice to have, anything like ASP.Net MVC an absolute bonus.

We want passionate people on a mission to self-improve and help their team do likewise - this is beyond compromise... Finally you've played a lead role in projects serving millions of end users and understand what makes users and systems tick.

Our offices in Central World are ultra-modern too - with all that technology to play with and chance to work with the brightest Fullstack Engineers from around the World, this could be your biggest and most exciting challenge yet!

Interested?

This truly is the chance of a lifetime so apply now, we won't leave you hanging.

Thanks for spending some time with us, we can't wait to hear from you.

Visa sponsored - we welcome applications from both International and locally based Software Engineers.
jobs.title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer - .Net / Java - Bangkok

jobs.content:
Make your next move count.

  • Want an Engineering job where you can make amazing achievements?
  • Can you build technology that Chinese consumers really like?
  • Want the chance to improve your international language skills?




If so, Agoda is the place for you! Join our exciting new innovation team at the start of something big! Agoda is an award-winning website and one of the fastest-growing online hotel platforms worldwide; we're also the biggest pure 'Tech' company in Thailand.



This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand.



We offer English language lessons so you can improve your business and technical skills at Agoda!



Our Engineers describe Agoda as interesting, challenging, fun, friendly and supportive. In short, the kind of environment where you get license and ownership to produce your best work!



In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.



About you:



We're looking for Architect level expertise but you still love to code! If you're the kind of person that looks at the bigger picture and want to build something that has a real impact on the end user Agoda is the place for you.

  • Architect level expertise but still love to code!
  • Broad fully-rounded full stack Engineering experience
  • Strong backend Engineering expertise (C# .Net, Java or other OOP)
  • Strong frontend web development skills are highly desirable
  • Knowledge of core architectural elements of e-commerce websites
  • You'll be able to describe in great detail the SDLC, all factors that impact your end build and relish the prospect of a job that enables you to do that day in, day out
  • And when we start talking about performance, security, unit testing and automation? Well that's music to your ears
  • Excellent written and spoken Cantonese or Mandarin language skills
  • You don't need to be fluent in English at all, but if you are that is good also




We program in C# .Net but would love to hear from Java aficionados or proponents of other OOP languages with unparalleled Engineering experience - you know as well as we do it's what you build not how that's most important!



Interested?



Get in touch and apply now!



Doubtless you'll have many unanswered questions; we'd expect nothing less after all an enquiring mind is what we're looking for. But fear not there's plenty of chance to discuss when we talk.



With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered. English language lessons available to improve your international business skills
jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Chinese Markets

jobs.content:
Every (milli) second counts.

  • Can you make large scale eCommerce websites go faster, without breaking?
  • Have you got Front End programming expertise to build 'proof of concept'?
  • Can you sell your ideas to be adopted across the business?
  • Do you take a helicopter view considering all implications?




Brilliant - If speed is of the essence then skip to the good bit and apply now!



On the other hand, if you're a stickler for detail and want to know more about Agoda and the job read on before applying



About us



As one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce sites we have a deep-rooted Engineering focus at Agoda. We're modest and humble but scaling rapidly. As part of the $bn Priceline Group we employ c.2,500 people and are fanatical about building a world-beating eCommerce travel brand.



About the job



Part developer, part researcher, part evangelist. The Web Performance Engineer role involves developing and experimenting the most optimal way to deliver web pages and content to the customer as fast as possible on any device or browser.



You will be a technical leader able to rapidly prototype, measure and deliver best practice for high performance website development.



You're the kind of person with the need for speed and appreciate that a faster website means a better customer experience! You'll create lightning quick websites and know how to maintain optimum performance as we give our site some serious scale. Your life is measured in milliseconds not seconds and delivering an uninterrupted customer experience is your mantra.



You'll be exposed to the business side, and be able to measure the true value of your work. As a technology evangelist you will have to identify areas for optimization, then research and prototype solutions to develop best practices to propagate across the website development teams. You'll be required to analyse and tune bottlenecks in code, content delivery and on the full array of browsers and client.



Key Skills:

  • Front end Web Development experience - HTML / CSS / JS etc
  • Performance metrics, RUM data, site speed monitoring and performance A/B testing will also preferably be in your armoury
  • Deep understanding of web protocols and networking.
  • Strong knowledge of TCP/IP http/http2 protocols
  • Server Side coding expertise (but it doesn't matter which - C# .Net / Java / PHP / Python / GO etc)
  • Understand browser behaviour and events and how browsers interpret HTML, CSS, DOM etc. to produce pages on any device as fast as possible.
  • Database - Cassandra or similar experience is a plus - Hadoop / MySQL / SQL Server etc
  • Experienced in optimising performance of large scale websites
  • Explain the full flow of Navigation Timing, Page Load Timing, Resource Timing and how each step can impact the customer and how to measure and monitor this information.
  • Web application design, architecture and optimization.
  • Database tuning and stored procedure optimization.
  • Experience designing high traffic websites.
  • Knowledge of broadband, 3G and 4G Networks as well as how traffic passes through internet exchanges is a considered a plus
  • Business-level Enlgish language skills both written and spoken




Every millisecond counts. We want innovative ideas about how browsers can render content in milliseconds, that we can process TB's of data in minutes, or how to architect the server side to support tens of thousands of requests a second.



A business-level standard of English both written and spoken is required.



Please note this role is open to both Thai and International candidates.



With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!
jobs.title: Web Performance Engineer - Work for Asia's No1 leading OTA

jobs.content:
Agoda Overview:

We are looking for world class development managers to lead our mobile app engineering team and bring it to where it belongs: the number one spot. The development manager role at Agoda is one of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate should be extremely hands-on, technically excellent and well versed on solid engineering principles as well as exhibit strong leadership and people development skills.

Responsibilities:

It's vital to have a love of engineering and a passion for building things. You will be expected to guide and review the team's work, but at times you also may need to get hands-on and code yourself. You'll also be expected to stay in touch with where the industry is going as well as have strong opinions about how systems should be engineered and maintained. Our company believes in full stack engineering so you must have solid experience in all parts of the technology stack: infrastructure, client-side (iOS and Android), back-end, performance, data and others.

As a technology company, we keep up with the latest ideas and innovations and make key decisions on when to adopt, when to follow and when to innovate. Previous experience of making the right choices will be required as you will be responsible for the technical direction of our fastest growing asset: the Agoda mobile app.

Despite our investment and belief in technology, people are still our greatest asset. The right candidate will have a keen interest in developing people: inspiring those around them so they can achieve their potential. Being able to recruit other A-players and integrating them into the business will also be important.

Qualifications:

Skills:
  • Extremely proficient in an object orientated language (Objective-C, Swift, Java, Kotlin, C#)
  • Extremely proficient in modern coding practices (dependency injection, reactive programming, MVVM, design patterns)
  • Extremely proficient in mobile platforms SDK (iOS, Android)
  • Proficient in back-end development (MVC, REST API, data retrieval)
  • Proficient in mobile OSs (memory management, context switching, threading)
  • Extremely proficient in automatic testing (specta, jUnit, appium)
  • Good understanding of Internet technologies (HTTP, SSL, TCP)


Qualifications:
  • Passionate about technology and mobile apps
  • Experience working in a successful agile development team
  • Able to take full responsibility for the product - from early planning stages to deployment and maintenance.
  • Inspirational leadership - know what will make your engineers go the extra mile
  • Previous experience managing engineering teams of at least 6 people


If you feel you are the right candidate to take us to the next level then get in touch! Agoda is full of like minded people who demand success and ensure we reach it.

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.
jobs.title: Mobile Apps Development Manager - Bangkok

jobs.content:
Do you consider yourself a hardcore engineer? Are you always the smartest guy on the team? The one who knows what the problem is, what the best solution is, what the most appropriate technology is? Would you like to work in a team of people EXACTLY like you?

We're looking for some extreme programmers to assist us with the core platform of the website. Responsibilities here are really varied: our platform team takes on a lot of different, cool stuff!
  • Containerization technology
  • Migration of .NET apps to .NET core
  • Load testing
  • R&D into JavaScript frameworks and their implementation
  • Refactoring & implementation of new design patterns
  • Data access
  • Software comparison (Should we Aerospike or Cassandra? Spark or Storm?)
  • Machine learning of outlier data to provide predictive models of incidents so we can take preemptive action
  • Automation of managing events


So normally comes the technology bit where we say which tech you must have in order to be applicable.

Just. Be. Smart.

In order to be successful you will be the kind of person that will learn new technology easily. That can understand new paradigms as just part of their day job. We are interested in the super-geeks: those who adapt and apply technology because it's the right choice. We're not looking to build just another application; fun for the first 3 months and that's it: this is a true opportunity to work consistently on an exciting innovative platform. Introducing latest tech, fixing the hardest problems. If you're genuinely looking to make an impact this is here.

Below is a list of tech that people in this team use frequently (this is not a list of requirements, but to give an idea of the diversity in tech talent we have and are looking for):
  • Scala
  • Python
  • node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • .NET core
  • Open stack
  • Docker swarm
  • JavaScript + test frameworks


In short - this is an exclusive role, open to the smartest people passionate about technology, always aiming to be the best and constantly improving. If you're looking at last year's code and thinking "what was I doing??!" this role may be for you! Come, challenge yourself.

Visa sponsored - we welcome applications from both International and locally based Software Engineers.
jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - Agoda Bangkok

jobs.content:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

As such, we are collecting huge amounts of data from every aspect of the business - marketing, web, finance, supply and much more.

We are looking for people who can help us focus on profiling data, discover inconsistencies and other anomalies, as well as perform data cleansing activities to improve data quality. Including analyzing data to develop quality guidelines and test cases, as well as executing routine tests to ensure the data is accurate and ready to use.

This role requires technical knowhow of data quality concept, while at the same time ability to analyze, understand, find out and foresee the data quality issues and impact

This position is based at our Global Operations Office, Bangkok, Thailand and reports to the Head of Data team.

Responsibilities:
  • Work as part of the Business Intelligence team to assure data quality and reliability across all systems
  • Bring forward data problems of today as risks to be mitigated in the target system of information
  • Debug failures, identify design flaws, and suggest solutions on both existing and new applications
  • Developing key stakeholder relationships to feedback and follow up data integrity issues.
  • Lead the testing, QA infrastructure, root cause analysis and automation tasks for data quality


Skills & Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or any related fields.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in Quality Assurance or any related experience in data quality processes, data quality checks, validations, data quality metrics definition and measurement is a plus
  • Strong in writing SQL Language and understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Experience with OLTP and Warehousing platforms, specifically in ETL transformations of data in different forms and experience reconciling data in different formats
  • Strong analytical skills with a methodical approach to problem solving
  • High attention to detail and constructive attitude in reviewing data

With world class talent from over 65 countries, the atmosphere of a start-up and the muscle of a $3bn business, this company is an incredible technical creative melting pot. Our client is building a research center of excellence in Tel Aviv, Israel and are looking for top notch talent to join them.

jobs.content:
Overview:



Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia, and as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world.



We understand the value of a great mobile experience for our customers and are constantly investing in mobile app development. Last year we launched a very successful update to our iOS and Android apps - a totally reengineered and redesigned experience - built from the ground up with the newest technologies. This doesn't stop us from constantly extending our product, re-evaluating outdated technologies, and constantly pushing to become the world's best.



We are looking for engineers who love and understand native apps and seek the challenge of using cutting edge technologies to create robust, smooth, and beautiful apps. You will be expected to deliver high quality, well-designed, and thoroughly tested code within tight time constraints, so a solid understanding of modern app design principles and testing will be crucial. You are also expected to be fluent in explaining and justifying your design decisions. Expertise in clean architecture and reactive programming is a major plus, but we expect candidates to be able to master these and many other tools as we go.



In addition, we expect superb attention to detail on the UI and performance of code produced. We believe a high-performance back-end is not enough. We also have to deliver the best possible UI and UX experience to our customers when it comes to layout, animations, and transitions.



Ultimately, we are looking for real technologists who have a great passion for mobile apps. We want innovative ideas on how to enhance our products using the latest cutting edge technologies, and if needed, define our own new standards.



Responsibilities:



Candidates will join the mobile app scrum team with iOS, Android, and backend developers, and as part of their day-to-day responsibilities will:

  • Come up with the best suitable technology and architecture for their tasks
  • Work closely with all team members to understand full stack functionality and architecture
  • Communicate constantly with product owners to understand and measure business values of developed features
  • Contribute ideas (technological and product) to enhance the overall app experience




Qualifications:



Technologies of interest (we are not expecting you to have them all):

  • Java 7/8
  • Latest trends in Android SDK (Native)
  • Android Studio/Gradle
  • RxJava
  • Dagger2
  • jUnit 4, mockito, Robolectric, espresso
  • Retrofit
  • Fresco
  • Analytics (Fabric, Google Analytics, etc)
  • A/B testing
  • Git




Engineering topics of interest:

  • Clean architecture
  • UI Design-patterns (MVP and etc)
  • Design-patterns (Gang of four)
  • Object oriented programming and design principles
  • Testing (unit/integration/system/...)
  • Automation of work process (CI, tools, etc)
  • Strafe-jumping like a pro in Quake 3 with your colleagues




Please note this role is open to both Thai and International candidates, however a good standard of English (both written and spoken) is a must.

jobs.content:
This is a full time position working on site in our Agoda offices in Singapore.

Please note we can only accept applications from Singaporeans or those with PR status

Overview:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Are you:
  • Top-notch developer with extensive knowledge in Scala, Java or C#?
  • Has strong background in design and implementation of scalable architecture and a good understanding of Algorithms, Data structures and design patterns?
  • Hungry to learn new tools, languages and technologies?
  • Based in Singapore or interested in moving here?


Responsibilities:

Agoda Platform team is looking for a developers to work on mission critical systems that deals with the designing and development of a system that serves millions of users a day.

Qualifications:

What we are looking for
  • Singaporean or eligible to work in Singapore only
  • You will have 3+ years' experience under your belt developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using Scala and or Java.
  • You have RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySql or other)
  • Some plus if you have knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL (especially, but not only Cassandra), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), Play framework, Akka library and/or Hadoop.
  • You have a Good command of the English language.
  • You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills.


What we can offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a fun start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.
jobs.title: Senior Scala Software Developer - IT Platforms

jobs.content:
Who is Agoda?



Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia, and as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world.



Why Agoda?

  • At Agoda, you'll find a team of smart and engaged people collaborating to find elegant and beautiful solutions to complex problems
  • We have each other's backs and you'll work closely with the team to build great products
  • The team you will be joining is multi-cultural, multi-lingual, and we're all travelers at heart




If you're passionate about the idea of joining a strong engineering team that's obsessed about learning, getting better every single day, and tackling big and interesting technical and business challenges, then read on.



Why Agoda Mobile Apps Team?



We're very proud about our iOS app, which has become a core part of our business. You'll be working on a product that's evolved tremendously and still has lots of room to grow.



Here are some interesting facts about us:

  • Initially the app was written in Objective-C, and we're currently actively developing in Swift and using the latest trends in Cocoa
  • We're implementing with the VIPER architecture, which means you'll enjoy reading our codebase again and again because of how alluring it is :)
  • We love A/B testing features, this will help you better understand your audience and the impact of the work you do on the business
  • All of our work is covered by a solid suite of unit and UI tests (we're very serious about this - we have around 5 hours of UI tests if you run them serially!)
  • We support over 40 locales (and still haven't solved one key localization challenge which is RTL)
  • And of course we take code reviews very seriously, because we're obsessed about quality and developing together as a team




What else?



With Agoda you can grow rapidly as an engineer.

  • You will work with top iOS developers
  • Have the ability to use and expand your experience
  • Have a big impact on the business.




If you are keen to try and learn new things, you can always challenge yourself by improving the CI systems at the core of our process, experimenting and introducing new languages and design patterns and even chipping in to our Android app! It's not unusual for our engineers to step outside of their scope to help the whole team grow and get better.



And since we have many scrums in the team, it's also not uncommon for engineers to have experience across different scrum teams where they can learn about different parts of the product.



Agoda puts engineering and product at the front and center of the business. That's even more true of the mobile team, where, more and more, new strategic projects start with the app. You will get to work on lots of cool stuff and important business decisions are made right here.



If that's the kind of team you want to join, let's talk!



Agoda is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.
jobs.title: iOS Developer - Come work with the best

jobs.content:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online travel agency company with very strong emphasis in technology. With cutting edge technology, we manage a massive amount of booking that allow people around the world to visit places they have never been. Here, you will work in a system at the Internet scale, so large that you can find in only very few company. In addition to the basic functional requirement that solution has to work perfectly, it also need to handle the spikey load where peak load can be 100x of usual load. More importantly, the system need be able to scale to handle our neck breaking growth rate. The challenge that only successful company can offer.

Responsibilities:

We are looking for exceptional engineers to extend our fulfillment system to next level. This fulfillment is the heart of the company where we process all bookings, from payment, confirming room availability & price with hotel, all the way until the customer depart the hotel. Entire customer experience heavily depend on this system. If you are looking for serious engineering challenge where you need to keep data integrity while maximizing availability and scalability, this is it. Successful candidate will need to both master the art of creating scalable system and also understand that his/her work will have an impact on business as a whole and be innovative to come up with solution that enable new business opportunity. In this role, you will have exposure to wide array of technology to help us move to the next level of growth. At the same time, we expect you to extend our technology stack/solution to stretch the boundary with cutting edge technology. If you are sharp technologist who are looking for opportunity to apply your skills to solve real world problem, Agoda is your place.

We are looking for top notch candidate from local and international. Relocation assistant will be available for successful candidate.

Qualifications:

What we are looking for:
  • 5+ years of commercial software development experience.
  • Experienced in designing large scale system that process very large number of transaction (or dataset) and run across multiple datacenters in parallel.
  • Deep experience in one or more of C#, C++, or JAVA and its tooling/technologies. We believe that excellent engineer will learn new technology deeply and quickly as long as they have strong fundamental in some technologies.
  • Ability to communicate in English clearly and concisely in written and verbal form
  • Experience in designing data model/working with relation databases; i.e. MS SQL Server, Oracle.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. We are pushing the boundary so innovative solution from you is critical.
  • Unit test and continuous integration. Take pride of the quality of the work.


Highly Desirable but you don't need to have them all:
  • Designed and implemented high availability system
  • Exposure to web service technologies such as WCF, REST, SOAP, ASP.NET Web API
  • Exposure to distributed queue technologies such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ
  • Experience in NoSQL family of technology and good understanding of its trade off
  • Experience with Internet company that operate with large number of user
  • Experienced in cross functional SCRUM practice.


We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.
jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Fulfilment

jobs.content:
Agoda, Asia's Leading OTA (Online Travel Agent) is looking for top talent to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand - full visa and relocation provided.

Overview:


Are you:
  • An application developer with a background in finance?
  • Open to working abroad?
  • Strong technically and hungry to learn new tools, languages and technologies?
  • Looking to work for a fast-paced internet company?
  • Based in Bangkok or interested in moving here?


About Agoda

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?


Responsibilities:


Agoda is looking for Software Developers to work on financial payment and reconciliation systems. These systems are the backbone of our company, ensuring that hotels get paid on time for each customer booking. We are currently expanding the team to create and scale these systems, and we're looking for experienced developers to come and join us.


Qualifications:


What we are looking for
  • You have 2+ years' experience under your belt developing financial or other reliability-critical applications that run in a production environment.
  • You write code that is well designed, testable and maintainable.
  • You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills.
  • You have deep experience in one or more of C#, C++ or Java.
  • You have experience working with SQL and large data sets.
  • You have great written and spoken English communication skills, and are happy working with developers, QA and business users.


If you have any experience or interest in the following it would be useful:

- The .NET/Microsoft development ecosystem

- NoSQL and caching solutions

- Web development frameworks

- Tools such as Git, Puppet and Jenkins

What we can offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Work as part of a team of experienced Scrum developers.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.


This is a full time position working on site in our offices in downtown Bangkok, Thailand.





We are happy to receive CV from both international & local candidates as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible candidates.

jobs.content:
ABOUT US
At Close.io weâre building the sales communication platform of the future. Weâve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are hiring engineers to help us unify the world's sales calls and emails into one beautiful workflow.

Our appâs front-end is a single-page HTML5/JavaScript web app written with Backbone.js (now starting to dabble in React), jQuery, RequireJS, Handlebars, QUnit, Grunt, etc. Itâs built entirely on top of our public REST API and targets only modern browsers. Our UI updates in near real-time and is written in LESS/CSS atop Bootstrap.

We â¤ open source â using 40+ frontend libraries/plugins with contributions to many of them.

ABOUT YOU
We're looking for experienced full-time developers to join our core team who have a strong understanding of web technologies and want to help design, implement, and launch major user-facing features.

YOU SHOULD...
  • have 8+ years experience building modern front-end applications in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS
  • have great product sense and be able to think through user experience issues before diving into the code
  • write maintainable, testable, and performant JavaScript
  • have a love for great UI
  • enjoy debugging all aspects of the front-end app including memory leaks and quirky CSS across browsers
  • have experience implementing real-time (e.g. websockets, polling, etc.) web apps
  • have significant experience with REST APIs and thoroughly understand HTTP requests

BONUS POINT IF YOU...
  • have an eye for design and experience with Photoshop, Sketch, or similar
  • have contributed open source code (core or plugins) for a popular frontend framework such as React, Backbone, or Angular

WHY WORK WITH US...
  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world! Just be willing to do a bit of traveling twice a year for some face-to-face time with the whole team :)  
  • Help build a truly successful SaaS company with a stellar team where you can have a huge impact. 
  • Above market salary and benefits
  • Join a company that embraces a healthy work/life balance 
  • A culture that values: trust, ridiculousness, entrepreneurship and autonomy 

To apply: APPLY HERE: https://jobs.lever.co/close.io/10a1e32b-1a59-48dc-b8f4-e6f0dfae4e20/apply?lever-source=WWR

jobs.content:
Primotus is developing a unique user-configurable mobile workflow platform where practically every aspect is configured by users using drag and drop “builders”. Technologies in our stack are some of the latest and includes Scala, BPM, Angular, Ionic, Selenium, Protractor, and Saucelabs.


We’re an international team of (currently) 8 full-time developers and getting close to launch of base platform. We’re looking for an experienced team-focused Test Analyst to assure platform is bug free, performant, and user-friendly. Position is open to US and non-US residents who meet the requirements outlined below and are in or near the ET timezone. 

You’d be: Spearheading manual testing efforts of a complex mobile and web platform by developing and executing test plans, uncovering bugs and suggesting UI/UX modifications, interacting with developers, and updating documentation with goal of improving platform’s usability, reliability, and responsiveness. Some of the specifics include:



  • Assisting with platform design with eye on UX design/usability

  • Creating and implementing test plans and manual tests both for performance and functional purposes

  • Reviewing app error logs and metrics

  • Construct instructions for bug duplication

  • Documenting test procedures and communicating problems and solutions to team

  • Juggling multiple stories and implementations simultaneously

  • Improving platform testability and augmenting testing tools

  • Enhancing documentation

  • Pairing with frontend, backend, and analysts

  • Available to work on Eastern Time (ET)


If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in helping to build something highly configurable and really innovative, please shoot us an email.

When they aren’t building our developer sandbox, creating V.2 of LevelUp analytics, working to optimize our payment processing, or designing time-based advertising campaigns for our merchants, our Rails engineers are thinking of innovative and epic ways to make LevelUp even better.


Curious about current projects?


Here are some of the challenges that drive development for the Platform team:


- How can we empower businesses to excite and reward their customers in new ways?

jobs.content:
No phone calls or emails, please. We only accept applications via this form.

ABOUT US

Museum Hack is a creative company that offers irreverent, renegade museum tours and cultural offsites to corporate and private clients. Founded in 2013 and having grown to $2 million in sales in 2016, Museum Hack has uplifted the lives of tens of thousands of new museum guests. We work at renowned cultural institutions and quirky locations in New York City and other major cities to bring these innovative experiences to companies and groups.

Museum Hack has been featured by The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, PBS, TimeOut New York, Huffington Post, TEDx, and more. Beloved clients include private citizens, schools, industry groups, and large companies like Google, Lego, LinkedIn, and CitiBank.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Museum Hack is looking for an ambitious seller with 3-5 years selling and sales team management experience to be our Sales Manager. Youâll be a major part of helping Museum Hack grow, grow, grow! We are excited for this new hire. The right candidate has massive growth potential with our company on a Sales Director track.

The Sales Manager will coach the remote team that oversees our inbound sales as well as lead our budding new biz team. The Sales Manager has lots to do upon getting started by shoring up our processes and improving our healthy inbound flow. Then thereâs lots of room to grow by helping us think about new markets, developing ways to make our happiest customers even happier, and reaching out to identify and cultivate new customers.

If youâve been managing a few salespeople at a company you donât love or for a product you donât use, and are looking to shine again... then this is for you. Step into a leadership role at Museum Hack to help us share our beloved, 5-star rated experiences with the world!

ABOUT YOU

Youâre a creative and ambitious person with experience in sales, management, and doing what it takes to build a company up. You have B2B or enterprise sales experience.

You live in the United States or Canada, and you're readily available during East Coast working hours. You have a home office and have some prior experience working remotely. This is not a position for digital nomads.

Important: You must have prior management experience in sales, with direct reports whom you had hire / fire responsibility and gave coaching and reviews to.

THINGS YOU SHOULD BE / HAVE...

  • Experience managing at least 2-3 salespeople in a positive sales culture
  • Focus on B2B or enterprise sales. Retail sales managers need not apply.
  • 3-5 years in a sales role with a passion for becoming an energetic sales leader
  • A sales track record that shows your ability to grow revenue and relationships
  • A strong reputation with your clients for driving high satisfaction
  • Experience proposing new sales processes, markets, or ideas to your leadership
  • Experience managing/overseeing CRM software to track activity (we use Base)
  • Proficiency with the usual office suites (Excel, Word, Google Docs, contract programs)
  • Ability to work remotely and communicate in a variety of channels (we love Slack)
  • Youâre inspired by arts, culture, and institutions that let us experience them (we love museums!)
  • You want to help Museum Hack become the most successful cultural experience company in the world!

THE RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Train and coach the inside sales team and new business exec to improve performance
  • Manage a remote team with success, empathy, and strong communication
  • Set benchmarks and tone for sales calls, emails, and communication
  • Set sales goals and help our sellers to meet and exceed them
  • Get us organized by managing lead assignments, creating new sales processes, and logging activity
  • Create a strong and positive sales culture with a strong emphasis on our customer
  • Measure sales KPIs and take creative and difficult steps to improve them
  • Develop one off sales into quality, lasting relationships through customer development
  • Research, manage, and reach out to new customer prospects to grow revenue
  • Navigate larger organizations to get to the right decision-maker
  • Be obsessed with our corporate customers and how to make them even happier
  • Set a great example for how to lead creatively and effectively at Museum Hack
  • Work alongside the Museum Hack management team to help grow the company
  • Love Museum Hack and how it transforms people into healthier, happier humans obsessed with these great cultural institutions! (Theyâre not always boring, we promise.)

OUR SALES TEAM

This team and department is being led by an overall sales manager and an inside sales team lead. The existing sales manager's role is evolving into focusing on partnership development with our high performance clients.

To apply: Apply here: http://museumhack.com/sales-manager-wwr/

Senior Javascript Engineer


At Qubit, the frontend team is focused on building well engineered, beautiful products with JavaScript. Our products provide an intuitive way for marketers to modify their website, understand and target user segments and measure the impact of their changes.


ARE YOU…


A team player? We are an opinionated team looking for like minded people. Are you excited by the prospect of solving complex challenges on an interesting technology stack?


Independant thinker? We like to hire engineers that thrive in a world of ambiguity. We want people that can be given hard problems and can go off and find the best technical solution.


Experimental? We are constantly experimenting with new technologies, right now some technologies that we really like are:



  • React, Flux and Redux

  • ES 2015/16

  • Git(hub)

  • Node.js

  • SuitCSS

  • Docker & Mesos

  • Make

  • Webpack

  • Mocha & Karma


Passionate about open source? Sharing is caring after all. We always contribute back to the open source community. Qubit's array of open source projects include:



  • react-test-tree: Simple and concise React component testing.

  • cherrytree: A flexible client-side router.

  • marty: A Javascript library for state management in React applications.

  • bamboo: HAProxy auto configuration and auto service discovery for Mesos Marathon.


You'll be responsible for:

  • Building end-to-end products with Javascript (Node.js, React).

  • Instrumenting, testing and deploying your code to production (We like to deploy multiple times a day).

  • Working closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale our applications.
