jobs.content:
Hey, I'm the CEO of my company and I am looking to hire an extremely motivated go-getter to master the art of media buying (buying ads online).

You will work side-by -side with me and I will personally train you. 

I will also pay top consultants in my industry, some who cost $500-1,000 per hour, to train you to be a highly skilled and indispensable employee and gain a skill you can use for life.

The goal is to eventually have you manage millions of dollars in annual ad spend, planning our ad strategies and overseeing all our ad campaigns, making sure ROI is maximized, no unnecessary money is lost and no costly mistakes are made.

I prefer someone with no prior experience whom I can train from scratch. You must, however, have a serious work ethic, a great attitude and a strong desire to achieve big things in the world.

You're getting in on the ground floor of this company, which means there will be tons of opportunity for salary growth and new responsibilities to take on, including hiring and overseeing additional employees.

ABOUT THE POSITION:

Here's what you'll be doing (and will be trained to do)...

- Using existing ad networks to put our advertisements online (Facebook, native networks and more)

- Setting ad budgets and closely measure the performance and profitability of every ad

- Canceling low-performing ads and investing in high-performing ones

- Split testing different ads against each other to improve ad performance

- Keeping STRICT track of ad performance daily to make sure no unnecessary money is lost and ROI is maximized

- Setting up and testing different landing pages to increase conversion rates and returns

- Using ad spy software to spy on competitors and other advertisers to find new places to advertise and come up with new ideas for creatives

- Working with sites and adnetwork compliance teams to create compliant ads and landing pages that meet their approval

- Negotiating discounts on adspace and credit from networks

- Keep tabs on new ad networks

- Doing grunt work to find solo sites and negotiate ads on those sites

(NOTE: If you're not totally sure what all this means at this point, that's totally fine.)

ABOUT YOU:

You are highly detail-oriented, you never make mistakes twice, you are comfortable taking on new responsibilities, are a fast learner, ambitious, a go getter, you want to achieve success in your career and be the best you can be.

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

We are an edgy company that sells dating and sex advice courses as well as a new foray into health supplements. Our revenue hit $3M in 2015 and we expect will double in 2016. We are a small team of "work hard, play hard" individual's building something great and it seems to be taking off with great speed -- we hope you'll join us!

Work is a fast-paced environment, you'll be expected to wear many different hats and learn quickly on the fly, but you will become good at what you do.

Must be 100% OK with adult-content, as some of our ads appear on adult sites.

DETAILS ABOUT THIS POSITION:

Compensation: $40k -- 50k+

Hours: 10am -- 6pm EST, Monday-Friday (semi-flexible)

Location: Currently work from home. Monthly in-person work weeks. 

Our Team: We're located in NYC and 16 strong, plus part-time employees.

==========
DEADLINE:
==========
Deadline for this application is Monday, 2/6/2017

=======
To Apply:
=======
This is a THREE ROUND application process. 

A written application, a 3-minute video interview and finally, if you make it, an in-person or skype interview.

To begin your application, please send an email to jobs@gothamdatingclub.com with the Subject Line: "Your Rockstar Media Buyer Is Here!" Also include in the email the following: 

(1) Explain your interest in the topic of men's dating, sex and/or supplements (5 sentences max). This is absolutely NOT a deal-breaker. 
(2) What qualifies you as the top candidate for this position? (5 sentences max) 
(3) What is your current position and why are you leaving (or have left) your current position? (5 sentences max) 
(4) How would you want your role to grow or change in the next 2-5 years?

jobs.content:
Do you want to be part of a build & run team, and help colleagues gain insight into their applications? Become System Engineer for the strategic domain Metrics, Logging & Monitoring.


With over 6 million customers, 28 million monthly visits and 10 million products, bol.com is the most successful on-line retailer in The Netherlands and Belgium. As these numbers imply, bol.com is a big data-driven organization. We currently employ over 1.000 people, including 300 IT professionals in 50+ Scrum teams. And we’re now looking for a System Engineer for our Metrics, Logging and Monitoring platforms to join us!



As System Engineer you are responsible for the engineering and administration of our Metrics, Logging and Monitoring platforms. These platforms receive data from all layers of our on-premise multi-dc Puppet managed infrastructure and are used by everyone in the IT department (~300 ppl).



Together with your colleagues you will be responsible for metrics system based on Graphite/Grafana, receiving 80k datapoints/sec and logging system based on the ELK stack, receiving 40k events/sec (18 nodes ES). You will manage systems that collect huge amounts of data and make that data easily accessible to end users. Occasionally you will develop solutions for ‘missing pieces’ in Python, Ruby or GO. You are also continuously addressing the question how to keep these systems manageable, scalable and connected as the environment continues to grow and change around us.



You will be working in a small autonomous team called Technical Engineering Support (TES), which is a component of our Technical Platform Space and responsible for the Metrics, Logging & Monitoring platforms. Team provides solutions for Scrum and business teams. We are looking for a colleague (senior or medior level) to help us build, run, scale, hack our systems.

jobs.content:
Forget the formalities: write us a cover letter that reflects the real you, include some links to what you're capable of, and let's make great stuff together!


Join a small, yet energetic and rapidly growing team working remotely around Australia to build exciting web and next-gen tools for the future.


If you're someone who enjoys a good laugh, is always looking to take the next step on their own, and cares about the finer details, then our door is open to you!


We create bespoke web app builds – amongst other visual media – for a variety of clients and we're coming to StackOverflow (because Seek is... [insert PC insult here]) to find an Aus-based web dev who can be at the forefront of our development pipeline and help forge new and creative ways to present a variety of client-provided and user-generated information.


Working primarily from home, with periodical design/dev sprints and client meetings, you will be coding and crafting in conjunction with our web designer/manager and another web developer to improve our code/database structure, oversee best practice and future planning, and integrate our web solutions with other services and platforms in the emerging technology space.


We believe you're the most productive you when it suits you, which isn't always 9-5. That's why we all work our own hours and will encourage you to do the same. We're therefore highly flexible with working around your extracurricular activities and other life obligations.


We have a generous company performance-based bonus structure, aim to continually increase wages above CPI, and have an Employee Share Option Program for you to benefit from.


Take a peek at our skills/requirements and if you think it is something you'd be perfect for (and if our amazing wordsmith-ing and Oxfard commas have got you even just a little bit excited) we'd love for you to apply.


We're currently looking to fill this position by mid-December for a mid-to-late-January start.

jobs.content:
IRESS is seeking a Python Software Engineer to join our growing team responsible for building our award-winning financial planning product – XPLAN. It’s been rated the number one financial planning software for the ninth consecutive year, being used by the majority of the Australian Financial Planning market with over 25,000 clients in Australia and New Zealand alone.


IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help with life’s big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people’s lives and financial well-being.


As a Python Software Engineer in our Feature Team, you’ll be playing a vital role in building new functionality across the entire development lifecycle from inception, design, and deployment. You’ll be part of a collaborative; AGILE team passionate about developing high performance, scalable web applications.


Being part of our Sydney office, as a Python Software Engineer, you’ll have the chance to develop your skills across our entire stack which includes Javascript, Python, CSS3, React, Backbone and HTML5.  As we continue to grow, you’ll have the opportunity to make an impact on different projects while developing your technical or leadership skills.


We're passionate about improvement as we introduce continuous integration and continuous delivery best practices into our engineering environment.  You'll work alongside talented Engineers who are passionate about keeping up to date with the latest trends and tools while having access to formal training opportunities at IRESS.


We’re recruiting for multiple roles and are open to candidates at all levels from Junior to Senior. This includes Full Stack Engineers as well as Backend Engineers. We’re open to applicants both locally and overseas and can provide sponsorship for suitable candidates.


This is a fantastic chance to join an established, innovative, high growth Fintech that has doubled in size in the last five years while entering new and exciting markets.


About You


Required



  • Similar experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, Programmer, etc

  • Experience with at least one dynamic language including Python, C++, PHP, Java, Ruby, etc

  • Strong understanding of web standards and architecture

  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL

  • Knowledge of multi-tiered object-oriented application development

  • Experience in the cycle of software development, and agile methodologies

  • Ability to structure test code efficiently and write robust test cases


Desired



  • Exceptional Python and front-end development skills using modern HTML 5, CSS 3 and JS

  • PHP development experience

  • Experience with xUnit testing frameworks and selenium testing


Culture and Perks


We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either; our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon!


Perks include subsidized healthcare insurance, share scheme, community events, flexible working opportunities and access to various learning and development programs.

jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Job Function:

This position is responsible for all phases of the risk intelligence cycle, from identifying emerging security risks and collecting intelligence, to analyzing, collaborating, and sharing intelligence. The position is responsible for using analytical techniques to identify trends and forecast the potential direct or indirect impact to Abbott's assets worldwide: people, facilities, and operations. The position interfaces with Company personnel across multiple business units and countries, and offers proactive and reactive recommendations to mitigate identified risks. Reports to the Director of Crisis Management and Business Continuity.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

This position is responsible for managing a global team of business risk intelligence staff in providing strategic risk analysis and developing risk mitigation strategies to prevent and minimize the companys exposure to risks. Additionally, the Sr. Manager assists Global Security Leadership in implementing programs and strategies to ensure safety of employees, assets and special events security. The position also serves as a liaison with private sector counterparts, law enforcement and government partners.

The position is responsible for managing the Abbotts travel safety program. The position overseas and coordinates preparation of strategic assessments, presentations and updates to senior management.

Position Accountability/Scope:

The position includes both a domestic and international scope and is accountable to the Director of Crisis Management and Business Continuity.

Minimum Education:

Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience required. (Masters Degree preferred).

Minimum Experience/Training Required:

8+ years of experience with a major public or private sector security organization. International work experience and previous global risk and analytical experience are highly desired.

JOB FAMILY:

Administrative-Other

DIVISION:

GES Global Engineering Services

LOCATION:

United States - Illinois - Abbott Park

ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS:

WORK SHIFT:

Standard

TRAVEL:

Yes, 20 % of the Time

MEDICAL SURVEILLANCE:

No

SIGNIFICANT WORK ACTIVITIES:

Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day), Keyboard use (greater or equal to 50% of the workday)

Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.


JOB DESCRIPTION:


Primary Job Function
* This is a technical role with the candidate expected to be a critical contributor to building compelling informatics products within Abbott’s Diagnostics Division.
* The individual will develop software on informatics programs from concept through launch. She/he will also be responsible for supporting on-market products post-launch.
* She/he will be responsible for defining, developing and documenting either presentation tier, application tier, services tier of desktop, mobile or cloud hosted informatics products.


Core Job Responsibilities


Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.
* The individual will be responsible for design and development of applications using contemporary platform architectures such as SOA (Service Oriented Architectures), Cloud Computing, Big Data, Web, Mobile, other.
* The individual is responsible for executing the various software development lifecycle (SDLC) activities – user stories, use cases, software requirements, design, development and design verification (incl. unit, functional and system testing).
* She/he is responsible for developing test plans and test cases for software components.
* The individual is responsible for root cause analysis including troubleshooting of informatics work products during development and for on-market products.
* She/he will be responsible for creating and maintaining documentation for the artifacts created during the SDLC.
* The individual will be responsible for ensuring the continuous improvement and evolution of software work products.
* The individual should independently conceive plans and implement development artifacts (requirements, analysis, design, documentation and software work products) as-needed to meet program goals.
* The individual may travel occasionally per needs of the assigned project.


Position Accountability / Scope
* The individual is responsible for the design, development and commercialization of informatics products in compliance with internal policies and procedures, both US and Foreign regulatory standards and requirements.
* The individual will participate in development efforts using Agile development frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban.
* The individual will interact with project managers and R&D leadership on project scope, timeline, risks and budget.
* She/he is accountable for the development of one or more informatics modules as assigned on individual programs.
* The individual will work as part of cross-functional teams in Global Marketing, Research & Development, Information Technology, Quality, Operations, Regulatory and Business Development to deliver informatics products.
* She/he will work with a broad range of technologists and support personnel both within and outside of Abbott.


Minimum Education


Bachelor’s degree in one or more following disciplines: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Decision Sciences, Symbolic Systems, Informatics, Mathematics, Physics or Information Systems. An advanced degree in one of the above disciplines is preferred.


Minimum Experience / Training Required


Minimum of 5-8 years of experience at a startup, mid- to large-sized...

The Data Scientist will join CIS' Data Science Practice, a central team of data experts who support a range of data-intensive projects across the university. The Data Scientist's primary role will be to collaborate with top researchers in economics at the Rhode Island Innovative Policy Lab (RIIPL) to design, maintain, and optimize secure database infrastructure that integrates sensitive data from various state agencies, and to develop predictive models that inform smart policy.


This is a 2 year fixed-term staff position, with the possibility of promotion to a permanent staff position contingent upon available funding.


Please note: Cover letters and resumes must be included with all candidate applications.

jobs.content:
The Paul Scherrer Institute PSI is the largest research centre for natural and engineering sciences within Switzerland. We perform cutting-edge research in the fields of matter and materials, energy and environment and human health. By performing fundamental and applied research, we work on sustainable solutions for major challenges facing society, science and economy. PSI is committed to the training of future generations. Therefore about one quarter of our staff are post-docs, post-graduates or apprentices. Altogether PSI employs 2000 people.

For the Laboratory of Macromolecules and Bioimaging in our Synchrotron Radiation and Nanotechnology (SYN) Division we are looking for a


Software Engineer


Your tasks



  • Develop software to support researchers in managing their experimental data (data curation), in particular to provide a user portal to a metadata catalog, to orchestrate underlying data movement processes and to automate ingestion processes

  • Communicate with the researchers and colleagues to iterate on the fulfillment of the requirements. This includes occasional traveling to Copenhagen/Lund

  • Build up and operate a test and deployment infrastructure

  • Provide technical and user manuals related to these activities

jobs.content:
As .Net Senior Software Engineer and member of our Development scrum team, you are responsible for our innovative solutions. You help to outline new enterprise applications and think actively, in collaboration with the team, about software design and technical solutions. Furthermore, you have your own ideas about architecture and are not afraid to share your knowledge.


A fullstack Developer at FRISS is eager to grow, not afraid to take chances and thinks out-of-the-box. You combine this with excellent knowledge of C# and JavaScript, our main languages, through which you create new possibilities and advantages.


The function


By keeping an eye on the latest insights and trends, you have your own say in how products of FRISS can be optimized and used at our clients. You apply quality improvement processes like unit testing, code reviews and continuous delivery and are familiar with design patterns and architecture principles as dependency injection and Service Oriented Architecture. Moreover, you apply problem solving patterns such as reliable messaging and improve the scalability and reliability of the FRISS platform.

jobs.content:
We’re looking for Java/Spring Developer to work on creating technical articles.

Budget and Time Commitment
========================
Article budgets are simple:

Level 1 (OK article - editorial work needed)
750-1000 words – 35$
1000-1250 words – 40$
1250-1500 words – 45$
1500-1750 words – 50$
...

Level 2 (good article - almost ready to publish)
750-1000 words – 40$
1000-1250 words – 45$
1250-1500 words – 50$
1500-1750 words – 55$
...

Level 3 (very good article - ready to publish)
750-1000 words – 45$
1000-1250 words – 50$
1250-1500 words – 55$
1500-1750 words – 60$
...

Additional budget levels you can access based on experience and a few other factors.
In terms of time commitment, a good target is one article a week - but that’s very flexible (as long as our  communication is good).


About the article (+ some examples)
=============================
We’ll usually pick articles out of the existing content calendar of the site (based on the areas you want to work in). You can also suggest your own topics as well.

Here are a few examples of topics:
Using the Spring @Scheduled annotation
Spring JDBC Pagination
Sorting in Hibernate
Spring Data Redis introduction

And here are a few finished article examples:
http://www.baeldung.com/spring-data-rest-intro
http://www.baeldung.com/spring-data-elasticsearch-queries
http://www.baeldung.com/registration-verify-user-by-email

jobs.content:
The role


We’re looking for an expert in designing and coding algorithms, with a strong interest in applying these within an ecommerce setting.  You’ll be fueling rapid business growth in an industry leader by producing new analytic insights and developing tools to assist with price optimization, forecasting, recommender engines, etc.   As you work closely with colleagues from a broad spectrum of business units, both technical and non-technical, you will develop a deep expertise not only technically but also in marketing, finance and product development, growing a comprehensive understanding of ecommerce in general and the vacation rentals industry in particular.


The position will be based in the Amsterdam office, with some travel required to the Eindhoven office.


Tasks and responsibilities

jobs.title: Algorithm Developer

jobs.content:
WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. .Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned us several prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financial services website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one of the products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seeking hardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance and make a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.


More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:



  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.


In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.


Responsibilities include:



  • Designs and develops web applications using Java, PHP, Spring Framework, MySQL

  • Designs and develops unit test cases to make the code more robust

  • Participates in pairing and code reviews.

  • Support and troubleshoot problems with existing applications

  • Participates in the areas of architecture, design, implementation, and testing

  • Security automated testing and improving architecture of application with the goal of increasing security


This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed either remotely (including from outside the U.S.) or from WalletHub’s offices in downtown Washington, D.C.

jobs.content:
LiveRamp is looking for senior DevOps engineers to help us maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Here at LiveRamp, we’re changing the world of data connectivity. Our technology unites the marketing technology ecosystem, enabling brands to measure the impact of digital marketing on sales and deliver highly relevant messages to consumers on virtually any channel or device.


As a Senior Engineer, DevOps, you’ll be responsible for helping bring the LiveRamp vision to life and doing whatever it takes to get the job done.We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 1,000 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability of an infrastructure that processes many billions of customer records on a daily basis. 


On the engineering team at LiveRamp, we value ownership and individual contribution within a collaborative environment. Be ready to leave your ego at the door, roll up your sleeves and start solving huge challenges as soon as you begin.


A Day in the Life of a LiveRamp Senior Engineer, DevOps:



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Configure as code, leveraging Chef and VMware.

  • Monitor and detect what may break and when, using tools like Datadog and ELK

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and development.

  • Automate everything!

  • Push your teammates to be stronger engineers. They will do the same to you.

  • Take our engineering, business development and culture in a whole new direction during one of our four Hackweeks every year.
jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer

jobs.content:
Groove is a eCommerce agency with a focus on driving online results for our clients. Award winning with a international focus. We offer a great culture, and were voted one of "Top 15 Best Young Companies to Work for in America".

Our Technology Team is looking for a smart, forward thinking Magento Developer to join us. Curious? This photo tour captures the essence our space and culture: http://groov.co/1aG87qr

You must be very detailed oriented and have excellent communication skills. You will be working on websites that get significant traffic and exposure - and regularly be challenged to push your skills. This is a high growth, high reward opportunity for the right individual.

Responsibilities

  • Scope, Document and Develop Tech Specs
  • Perform a Mix of Magento New Development, Enhancements and Troubleshooting
  • Evaluate and Contribute to an Effective Dev Process
  • Mentor Junior Groovers in Magento and PHP Related Technologies

Qualifications

  • 3+ years Experience with Magento
  • Magento Developer Certification(s)
  • Solid understanding of OOP, MySQL, JavaScript and PHP
  • Full Stack Skills
  • Bachelors in Computer Science or Equivalent
  • Advanced Understanding of eCommerce Platforms and Systems

Why Groove?

  • Free Lunch Fridays
  • 100% Paid Benefits for Groover’s
  • Quarterly Social Events
  • Paid Vacation Time
  • Office Wide Sonos (Sorry - No Country or Show Tunes)
  • Continuing Training and Education

No one outside US need apply. EOE. Remote Work Considered.

jobs.content:
Company Information:

Paktor is the leading SE Asian provider of various social networking platforms that are dedicated to helping Asian singles meet other singles in the region. Paktor emphasizes anonymity, locality, and usability for our users. We find out who you’d like to meet nearby and connect you with them if they’re also interested. Or to put it simply, we bring people together: without the pressure. After all, that’s what Paktor means.

Paktor was founded with the mission of connecting singles in Asia through technology-enabled platforms. To date, Paktor has grown into a leading multi-social entertainment network Company in Asia, with assets in dating, social networking, video live streaming and media sharing. Headquartered in Singapore with presence in Taiwan, Korea, Japan, Indonesia, Vietnam, Malaysia and Thailand, Paktor has over 7 million users and successfully made over 20 million matches. Paktor is backed by institutional investors including Vertex Ventures (subsidiary of Temasek), Majuven, Convergence Ventures, Infinity Venture Partners and Yahoo Japan.

The projects on our plate are amazing, and we're looking for talented people to meet the exciting technical challenges we face. We're looking for an experienced Java Engineer to contribute to the continual improvement of the Paktor experience for our users. We're open to your ideas for cool interactions and interesting ways to bring people together. The best ideas - from any source - are acted on quickly here. If you're an intelligent and highly ambitious entrepreneur, we want to talk to you!

Requirements:

  • Experience with Java Spring MVC
  • Deep knowledge of RDBMS (MySQL preferred)
  • Experience with AWS S3, EC2, RDS
  • Experience with Agile programming with scrum, code reviews, rapid iteration
  • Experience with Git

Bonus points if you have:

  • A BS/MS in Computer Science or Engineering from a top school, but a wonderful project list trumps all
  • Prior start-up experience is awesome (not necessary); being scrappy will help you hit the ground running.

Location can be remote. Need not be in Singapore
jobs.title: Senior Java Developer

jobs.content:
SmartBug Media, a leading digital and content marketing agency, is seeking a remote freelance UX Designer to join its 28-person strong team of talented and passionate marketers. You will lead research, strategy and wire design for strategic web redesigns. Based on your work, the position will have the opportunity of full-time when the initial redesign is completed.

In this role, you will report to the Creative Director and work closely with her, the project manager and developers. This is a client-facing role where you will be leading research in the form of client and customer interviews, persona development, buyer’s journey creation and usability testing.

We’re looking for a passionate, detail-oriented UX Designer who will be a team player deliver high-quality work. If you are looking for a challenge where you can do great work with a collaborative team, this opportunity is for you.

We’re building a different kind of agency—one that lets you do great work without the sweatshop grind many agencies are known for. We believe people can deliver great results, have a great time with people you respect, and still embrace the things that matter in life. And we do it all remotely.

Responsibilities

  • Lead research and strategy for web redesign
  • Attend client and internal meetings
  • Work collaboratively with the CD and project manager
  • Conduct client and customer interviews
  • Create personas and buyer’s journey
  • Perform content audit with subsequent sitemap recommendation
  • Deliver clear design strategy
  • Design clean, strong wireframes or prototypes
  • Validate designs through usability testing

Requirements

  • 2-4 years of UX design experience with documented examples of working on large projects
  • Ability to simplify and distill complex ideas into intuitive experiences
  • Ability to present cohesive design approaches to internal and external teams
  • Ability to prioritize and manage workload to adhere to project timelines
  • Strong design chops with the portfolio to prove it
  • Proficient in Axure, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Suite or comparable tools.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in design, human-centered interaction, related field or relevant work experience

Key Attributes

  • Excellent teamwork skills and the ability to deliver high-quality work, on deadline
  • Not afraid to speak up and contribute to make a project better
  • Values, ethics and integrity
  • Exacting attention to detail
  • Fun to work with
jobs.title: UX Designer

jobs.content:
We’re looking for a creative designer with strong UI/UX skills, an eye for form and an ear for the user.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Designing new desktop and mobile interfaces for our existing products

(This is a remote and contracted position.)

jobs.content:
The role:

High Horse is a London based development agency building startup technology in the ecommerce and SaaS space. We are looking for a dedicated React Native developer to produce world class apps for our clients.

What you’ll be doing:

Building React Native apps for iOS and Android in ecommerce and Saas. At times you may be responsible for multiple projects, building new products or adding features to existing apps.

About you:

  • Self directed / self managed, you clean up a mess when you see it
  • Self learner and an early adopter - you loved react before it was cool
  • You care about writing thoughtful, maintainable code
  • Adequate communication - fluent english required, native / bilingual ideal

Remote work by remote workers:

  • Remote work makes us happier and more productive but it comes with more personal responsibility
  • You must work a fixed schedule on an EU timezone
  • We do daily standups and communicate constantly through chat and video
  • You should always have access to a strong internet connection that can handle video calls

The benefits:

  • Compensation: £25k to £40k
  • The latest hardware delivered to you inc. your choice of an iMac 5k / MBP
  • The latest peripherals and software with a product first mindset
  • A travel budget to meet the London team and relevant events
  • A generous education and training budget inc. books, courses, events etc.

Skills and requirements

  • You have built React Native Apps
  • You are comfortable with Redux, Nodejs and unit testing
  • You are a javascript enthusiast and expert, you counted down the days for ES6 features to be released
  • You implement designs and animations with great care and attention to detail

About High Horse

High Horse is a small, fast growing development agency in central London. We build technology for startups in the ecommerce and SaaS space working with full stack javascript. We are a remote first company and incredibly passionate about building lasting products with thoughtful coding and fantastic ux. We are looking for engineers who care about what they build and want to be impactful in a small team. Our growth and ambition means we are looking for people who can rapidly adapt and grow in their roles.

Why we hire remote https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sxEE8Ch2Cmk

jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

We are seeking software developers who are looking to work with a team of well-seasoned product developers. Our team successfully and pragmatically delivers product for a core set of interesting clients.

We have many years of experience successfully working remotely.

REQUIREMENTS

We are not tied to any particular language or framework. We are looking for well rounded people who care about their craft and understand product development. That being said, here are some of the most common languages, frameworks and tools we are currently using.

Languages

Javascript, Ruby, Python, Go

Frameworks

Rails, React, Ember, Angular

Tools

Git

We don't look at years of experience and formal education as much as we look for tenacity, drive, attitude, humility and competency.

BENEFITS

One of our core values is taking care of people. This is not just something we say, but something we hold very dearly.

We are a no-nonsense happy team that enjoys working together and what we deliver.

Whiplash is empowering next-generation eCommerce entrepreneurs with simple and powerful warehousing and fulfillment solutions. Our software translates complex retail requirements into simple, failsafe instructions for warehouse employees across the globe.

Our goal is to make life easier for our customers and partners, and to leave them with the “wow” feeling of having solved logistics and fulfillment issues with ease, style and class.

We’re looking for web developers with strong backend skills to become experts on our relationships with logistics carriers, materials selection and communication across our global network.

We value hard work, integrity, and a strong moral compass. We were founded 6 years ago and bootstrapped to profitability (and #457 on the Inc 5,000) before accepting funding from Draper Associates (Tesla, Twitter, Skype) in 2016.

jobs.content:
Objective

To add a designer to our growing team who can make our beautiful code look beautiful to the end users.

Contract Description

Bonk Studios seeks a front end web designer to join the team. Before we bore you with the requirements of this position, why Bonk Studios?

  • We are a small team that throws out the politics, and focuses on developing great technology.
  • Adapting the SCRUM Methodology, your voice will always be heard, and your strengths will be utilized.
  • Each year, you will be flown out for a business vacation, and getting to meet the team. This year, we went to Hilton Head, SC.
  • Being able to work with the freedom of a contractor, but the stability of an employee gives you the best of both worlds. Never hustle finding gigs as a freelancer, yet being able to program in your underoos. At Bonk Studios, you will always have 40 hours of work each week. This always has been and always will be the case. No more hustling to find gigs!
  • Sick of writing emails back and forth? We utilize slack, and a bug tracking system to communicate. This leaves more time to focus on developing great applications, and posting funny pictures!

Now that you know a little bit about our team and how we operate, what skills are essential to join Bonk Studios?

  • Great design must be second nature to you. Ideally, someone with a wide range of taste. For example, our website is quite unique to the typical website. Business professional, edgy, retro, etc. should all be styles that you are comfortable with.
  • Expert with CSS and SASS.
  • An expert with Bootstrap.
  • Must be a team player, great communicator, and able to work on multiple projects at the same time.
  • Master of time management.
  • Strong desire to always increase your skill set and adapt to new technologies.

Other skills that are a big plus:

  • Knowledgeable with SCRUM Methodology. If you have never practiced this, we can help you.
  • Knowledge of jQuery and Angular
  • Knowledge of Typescript.

Contract Details

From time to time, Bonk Studios and the team will be flown out to visit clients to go over projects. The contractor should be available for this.

Note: This is a contracting position. No benefits will be given, nor will any taxes be with held.
jobs.title: Front End Web Designer

jobs.title: Hybrid Developer

jobs.content:
About the position

This is a full stack position with an expected duration of 3 months. You will work remotely and can choose the hours that you work, as long as we have a couple hours of overlap during the day (Toronto is UTC -5:00).

We are seeking someone with intermediate Python/Django experience and novice/intermediate experience with React.js (with Redux a big plus). The position is heavily weighted towards front-end development yet will require interfacing with our back-end. The position will entail several small tasks rather than undertaking a large project and really is a great opportunity to learn/strengthen React.js skills quickly.

About the company

ClinicSense offers clinic management software to small wellness clinics. We help automate several of the tedious day-to-day administrative tasks, so that our customers can spend less time on paperwork and more time with their clients.
jobs.title: Full Stack Developer

jobs.content:
ExecVision is building software to help companies extract insights from call recordings. We integrate with over two dozen different sources for calls, using APIs or scrapers to retrieve users' content, which is then matched to CRM records to provide metadata. The recordings then flow through a content pipeline which transcodes, transcribes, and performs analytics, and the results are then indexed in elastic search for usage in the website.

We're looking for a Sr Python Engineer to work in the content pipeline team. You'll be focusing on scalability, task distribution, efficiency, and quality. If you're an engineer who likes to optimize algorithms and prove correctness, this is a perfect job for you.

Our team is distributed, and no travel is required.

A home office stipend is available. US or Canadian citizenship is required.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years commercial Python experience, expert level Python skills
  • BSc Computer Science or equivalent
  • "Big data" and distributed systems experience
  • Expert level SQL skills
  • Clear communicator, good time management, and experience working from home

Nice to have:

  • Audio transcoding / processing (sox, ffmpeg, pyaudioanalysis, scipy)
  • Fast Fourier Transform
  • Elastic Search or Solr
  • REST, SOAP, OAuth, etc
  • Machine Learning, NLP

If you think you're a good fit, we'd love to hear from you.
jobs.title: Sr Python Engineer, Backend/Pipeline

jobs.content:
FoxCommerce is a Seattle, Washington based company looking to add to our remote engineering team located in Russia and Ukraine.  We are seeking both Front and Back End engineers with the hunger to be more than just a cog in a giant machine.  This is the perfect role for a technical leader that cares deeply about their craft.  You’ll be a good fit if you want to contribute to a platform by writing excellent code, planning the architecture, mentoring junior engineers, and working to continually improve our approach to software development.  


We’re a polyglot organization and we believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our stack today includes Scala, GoLang, Elixir, and React.js.  


What we're looking for:


You're the right person for us if you strike a balance between pragmatism and pushing the envelope.  You want to be part of a small, high-performance organization in a rapidly growing company and market.  You want to build something people will use.  You care as much about going fast as you do about doing it right.  You want friendly teammates who aren't dogmatic.

jobs.content: FoxCommerce is hiring an UX/UI Designer anywhere
jobs.title: UX/UI Designer

jobs.content: FoxCommerce is hiring an UX/UI Designer anywhere
jobs.title: UX UI Designer

jobs.content:
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
URL: www.foxcommerce.com

FoxCommerce is looking for a talented UX/UI designer to work directly with our Product and Engineering teams to craft and deliver elegant user experiences for our clients. You will be joining our remote team in Eastern Europe. 

FoxCommerce is building a modern SaaS eCommerce platform, optimized for mobile and global commerce. Our founders know eCommerce and have done this before. They’ve built real companies with $200M+ in revenue and more than 400 employees.

Who we're looking for:

  • You strike a balance between using industry-standard design patterns and pushing the envelope.
  • You are comfortable working on a variety of projects, from web and mobile apps to branding and marketing assets.
  • You are able to gracefully balance multiple projects at a time.
  • You have an impeccable aesthetic and attention to detail.
  • You value communication and organization.
  • You enjoy and value direct communication with clients and external stakeholders.
  • You’re a self-starter who can always be relied on to get things done.
  • You have a challenge-seeking attitude and the follow-through to thrive in a rapidly growing company and market.
  • You care as much about going fast as you do about doing it right.
  • You actively seek out feedback, handling it with humility and an open-mind.
  • You have the skill and experience to design a product end-to-end: developing and collaborating on concepts, researching, crafting user-centric wireframes and intuitive UI, collaborating with engineers, and delivering a pixel-perfect product.

Responsibilities:

  • Crafting designs up and down the fidelity spectrum - from user flows and sitemaps, to wireframes, to detailed mockups with specs.
  • Creating interactive prototypes of designs in some way, shape or form.
  • Working directly with existing and prospective clients to understand their customer base and business needs, in order to inform the design process and project scope.
  • Working with existing and prospective clients to identify opportunities for UX/UI improvement to create business value.
  • Working with our product and engineering teams to create and ship designs.
  • Driving research, user tests and A/B tests to inform product and design patterns;  proposing and crafting improvements based on findings.  
  • Maintaining design patterns and style guide to help drive clarity and velocity.
  • Nurturing the inner-designer in all of your teammates, whether they be engineers or account executives.
  • Providing ongoing feedback to engineers and product leaders about current implementation.
  • Training and mentoring new design teammates.

Requirements:

  • Experience designing production web and/or mobile applications at a high-performing organization.
  • Experience in a client-facing role and long-term projects.
  • Excellent verbal and visual communication skills, with experience presenting to both clients and coworkers.
  • Exposure to B2C eCommerce/digital retail design, with an understanding how to design for both small and enterprise businesses. Exposure to B2B design is a plus.
  • Expert ability with design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator and Sketch.
  • Experience creating rapid, interactive prototypes with tools such as InVision.
  • Experience with, or desire to learn, After Effects/motion graphics for prototyping is a plus.
  • Exposure to reading or writing UI code (HTML/CSS/JS) is a plus.

To apply: Please send a resume and cover letter with your location to jessica@foxcommerce.com
jobs.title: UI/UX Designer - Russia and Ukraine

jobs.content:
FoxCommerce is seeking a Senior UI Engineer with the hunger to be more than just a cog in a giant machine.  You will be joining our remote engineering team based in Eastern Europe.

We're a fast-growing business that sold our product before we built it.  We bootstrapped for more than a year, and were cashflow-positive before we raised any outside capital.  Almost everyone in the company writes code.  Our founders have done this before.  They've built real companies with $200M+ in revenue and more than 400 employees.   

Weâre a polyglot organization and we believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our stack today includes Scala, GoLang, Clojure, and React.js.  

What we're looking for:

You're the right person for us if you strike a balance between pragmatism and pushing the envelope.  You want to be part of a small, high-performance organization in a rapidly growing company and market.  You want to build something people will use.  You care as much about going fast as you do about doing it right.  You want friendly teammates who aren't dogmatic.  

Responsibilities:

  • Writing excellent code on our core platform product
  • Contributing to key architectural decisions
  • Actively pair-programming with teammates when they need help
  • Drive formal and informal code reviews
  • Adopting best-practices in code structure and tool chain within the company
  • Diving into R&D when necessary to help the organization explore which new technologies are the best fit

Ideal Characteristics:

  • Experience building production UI applications using a modern toolkit such as:
  • React.js
  • Angular.js
  • Node.js
  • Ember.js
  • Backbone.js
You have an active interest in building great user experiences

You're addicted to building performant UI applications

Youâre not afraid of CSS and HTML5

You believe that UI engineering is first-class software development

Exposure to functional programming and modern concurrency primitives is a plus

To apply: Send your resume and location to jessica@foxcommerce.com

jobs.content:
Alchemy+Aim is a strategy and website development company, specializing in helping thought leaders, entrepreneurs and creative businesses. 

The Basics of the Technical Director Job:

+ You would be lead developer on the team. We're looking for someone who is really knowledgeable about Wordpress development, PHP, CSS, and Javascript, who can lead the team in learning and developing websites. You'll also be helping team members troubleshoot problems on projects as they arise, and onboarding new developers to the team, showing them the systems we use and performing regular code reviews.


+ You would be developing custom Wordpress sites. You would be developing custom Wordpress themes and websites from designs provided via Photoshop, Illustrator, and Sketch. Your syntax style should be consistent, understandable, and commented where needed. You must ensure content population is intuitive and easy for the client by using appropriate fields and comments.


+ You would be responsible for technical support requests and our technical support system. We want a team member who can handle/organize incoming tech support requests and communicate with clients. For sites we've developed, you would be responsible for making changes where necessary to site and keeping repos up-to-date with changes.


+ You would be regularly researching new plugins, codes, or other trends in website development. We want to truly serve our clients and make sure we're well-informed and constantly learning about the best features, plugins, and ways of doing things that are out there.


+ You would be responsible for overseeing some general company systems, such as backing up site data and running regular security checks.


+ You would be communicating with the team regularly. We use Slack for regular communication and Basecamp for project management. There are also some team meetings and individual meetings.

Job benefits:
 + You can work from anywhere. No moving for a job involved. If you’re happy where you are, stay there. If you’re unhappy, move somewhere new. This job will go with you. (If you want to spend a month working from the Italian countryside or in a Scottish pub -- we do that sometimes, more power to you.)

+ You decide what you want your hours to be. You just need to communicate with the team regularly, with your hours overlapping EST business hours for at least 4-5 hours per day.

+ You start out as a contractor, with the option to move to a full-time position. We want to make sure you're the right fit for us and we're the right fit for you. After 3 months, we'll discuss the move to full-time. We have a solid benefits package and lots of flexibility for our team members.
jobs.title: Wordpress Developer Technical Director

jobs.content:
ExecVision is building software to help companies extract insights from call recordings. We integrate with over two dozen different sources for calls, using APIs or scrapers to retrieve users' content, which is then matched to CRM records to provide metadata. The recordings then flow through a content pipeline which transcodes, transcribes, and performs analytics, and the results are then indexed in elastic search for usage in the website.

We're looking for a Sr Python Engineer to work in the content pipeline team. You'll be focusing on scalability, task distribution, efficiency, and quality. If you're an engineer who likes to optimize algorithms and prove correctness, this is a perfect job for you.

Our team is distributed, and no travel is required. 

A home office stipend is available. US or Canadian citizenship is required.

Requirements:
5+ years commercial Python experience, expert level Python skills
BSc Computer Science or equivalent
"Big data" and distributed systems experience
Expert level SQL skills
Clear communicator, good time management, and experience working from home

Nice to have:
Audio transcoding / processing (sox, ffmpeg, pyaudioanalysis, scipy)
Fast Fourier Transform
Elastic Search or Solr
REST, SOAP, OAuth, etc
Machine Learning, NLP

If you think you're a good fit, we'd love to hear from you.

To apply: Send a resume to rfirmin@execvision.io
jobs.title: Sr Python Engineer, Backend/Pipeline

jobs.content:
You love programming, latest technologies (ES6, React, Angular), DON´T want to support legacy code, enjoy to develop from scratch, are interested in topics like functional reactive programming - and want to do all of that in a very nice team, located in Berlin? Keep reading!


About GoEuro


Driven by our team of over 180 people from 40 different countries, GoEuro is changing the way we travel across Europe. Our search provides the best options for you by train, bus or flight to any city, town or village in Europe all tailored to your individual budget and schedule.


At our headquarters in the heart of Berlin, we take advantage of our diversity to find new and simple ways to help our customers as we build a revolutionary product and of course, have fun.


We are now looking for the next great addition to our team as a Frontend Developer.


As Frontend Developer at GoEuro, you will…


...be part of an international, talented and agile Development team that is responsible for building the user interface of GoEuro´s desktop, mobile web apps. You will work with latest technologies and have a great impact on our product. Even though we are very proud of what we have achieved at GoEuro already, there´s still some space for improvement and lots of interesting technical challenges to overcome going forward. That´s why we are searching for you!


In an agile context you will share the following tasks with your teammates:



  • Building new features and rewriting old parts of GoEuro frontend with modern technologies (yes, no legacy code support)

  • Writing Unit, integration and end-to-end tests

  • Working with product designers and product owners

  • Taking feedback from users and making interaction changes

  • Troubleshooting performance issues

  • Technologies you will be working with: CSS3, ES6, React, Angular, RxJs, jQuery, HTML5
jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer

Are you passionate about quality work? Do you prefer Quality Assistance rather than Quality Assurance? Do you love automation? Then, this will be the perfect job for you!

Football Addicts is bootstrapped and profitable, which means no interference from investors - we have full control over our company and products, and we only build things we are proud of. We keep things simple, we have no middle managers and we avoid lengthy company policies and bureaucracy.

We are now looking for a QA Engineer to join our team in Gothenburg, Sweden. The office has around 30 employees divided on three agile teams, all dedicated to building great mobile apps for football fans all over the world.

As a QA Engineer at Football Addicts you will be responsible for driving quality improvements and quality work of our main product - Forza Football - on both Android and iOS platforms. You will be doing both manual/exploratory testing as well as taking us to the next level of automated testing.

To succeed in this role we believe that you are passionate about quality work and that you enjoy working in agile teams. We are looking for an automation champion who will enjoy the challenge of working in an agile and fast-paced environment.

jobs.content:
Our internet-based technology company based in Phoenix and Orlando is looking for a full time U/I and U/X designer with strong CSS/JavaScript skills and an very strong eye towards modern interactive design to help us create a better user experience for our existing application.

Qualified candidates must understand and care deeply about the purpose of our proprietary application and various types of users that utilize this valuable tool. Each screen must be designed with the specific user and their needs and capabilities in mind, not in the candidate's own personal design aptitude. Candidates must be able to express a Zen sense of minimalism that considers the necessity of every element on a page to determine whether each element directly contributes to achieving the goal of the page.

Candidates must push management to simplify the application versus management pushing them.

Candidates must be able to create usable interfaces for both experienced and one-time users and understand their needs are vastly different. Also, candidates must be able to build a U/I a user can use without little of no instruction and without confusion. Candidates must want to step-up and take ownership of the user interface and take pride in its successes and be willing to take responsibility for its weaknesses understanding the design will constantly evolve and must always improve.

Our company is looking to take our application to the 'next level' and we want a candidate who is self-managed and always pushing for progress without the need for constant supervision. As a leader of the design of this application, the candidate we select will be joining a team with two backend developers and a small sales staff. This candidate must be able to balance the requests from sales with the programmers ability to deliver features and functions that do not negatively impact the user experience.

Lastly, the ideal candidate should be the kind of person who could name famous designers in your field that you follow or want to emulate rather than the type who lives in a bubble of his own personal design ego. During the interview process, the candidates should be able to discuss their inspirational leaders and discuss what I is about them that impresses you most.

If you feel you have the requisite skills and experience for the position, and have a portfolio of work you would like to share, please email us jobs@allresnet.com

jobs.content:
Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo?
Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


FPGA Engineering at IMC



  • On most exchanges the trade goes to the party that gets there first, so latency is incredibly important to us and we’re always trying to find ways to become a little bit faster.

  • As an FPGA engineer you work with the trading and infrastructure teams to implement the trading strategies while getting the most out of our infrastructure.

  • You'll work in a small team that takes responsibility to own the complete solution. This includes finding ways to become more productive, improve testing and thinking about measuring and monitoring.

  • Manage the deployment process of solutions as they are developed. We do our best to get changes to production as quickly as possible as improvements can have a very clear effect on our profitability.

  • However we are very careful that this focus on getting our work in production does not compromise quality. We value good engineering practices and we take our responsibilities for stable financial markets very seriously.

  • We currently use a combination of Verilog/VHDL, C++ and scripting languages for our FPGA systems. We automate our testing as much as possible. We connect to exchanges over Ethernet so understanding the details of network protocols and network infrastructure is a very important aspect of the job.


What makes it fun?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop. We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology. If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.

  • To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds. What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


Our Culture:


We are at the core a trading firm, however we value trading and technology equally and we believe that cooperation between traders and technologists is one of our great strengths. This is also reflected in our organizational and remuneration policies. We believe in fostering a truly flat environment in which great ideas can be recognized as well as put into practice from anybody within our organization
jobs.title: FPGA Engineer

jobs.content:
Your impact 
As a Customer Success Manager, you'll push the business forward by building relationships with prospective Help Scout customers. You aren't selling so much as you are becoming a trusted advisor, a partner that will work with people to find the best product fit. 

About the Role
  • As a member of the Growth Team (traditionally Marketing and Sales), youâll help people evaluate Help Scout for their business. This will likely be a mix of people in an active trial, or on our free plan.
  • Youâll work to better qualify the thousands of inbound leads we get each month, leveraging creative approaches to email marketing, marketing automation, and one-on-one conversations. Your goal will be to help self-directed customers find their own way and help larger or more complex customers find the right person to talk to.
  • Your job doesnât really end when the deal closes. You may find yourself training new customers in their first 45 days, or working with long-term customers to make sure they have what they need.
  • Weâre hiring you to own this part of the customer experience, to take in all the perspectives you can, and then build a plan. We have years of historical data and many hypotheses to experiment with.
  • Youâll experiment with, measure and document strategies that help us increase revenue cycle effectiveness and be a critical part of improving our revenue playbook.
  • We believe nurturing current and potential customers is a team sport, which is why this role is paid a full salary based on your experience and what you would make as an inside sales rep âon planâ in another company. We have no plans for commission plans or quota targets.

Who you'll work with
  • Tim Thyne, Head of Customer Development- Timâs spent the past year building and adapting our approach to driving revenue and building relationships with customers, with an approach that fits our values and reputation in the market.
  • Suneet Bhatt, Chief Growth Officer - Suneetâs been here since July and has been a partner to Tim in building out Customer Development at Help Scout; Suneet also manages our Content Team, Marketing Analytics, and Product Marketing.
  • Nadia Basil, Head of Product Marketing - Nadia runs Product Marketing at Help Scout and will be a go to resource and partner to you as you find and create content that will be most relevant to our customers and potential customers.

About you
  • You have a history of digging into challenges and opportunities first-hand to understand whatâs going on, and then get jazzed about codifying what youâve learned so (elements of it) can be automated and scaled.
  • Youâve operated in and around the traditional handoff between Marketing and Sales (Demand Generation, Inside Sales) and are excited to bring those two disciplines even more tightly together.
  • You can easily lose track of time geeking out with Marketing Automation (HubSpot) and Sales Automation (Salesforce) tools. Mastering this stuff can be challenging but you love it.
  • This role is exciting because you love helping people win! It energizes you to work alongside people to help them grow their business.
  • Youâre curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. Your curiosity is well-suited to this part of the customer experience because you are great at listening to customers and working with them to solve business challenges.
  • You maintain a healthy disrespect for the way things are traditionally done in Enterprise/SaaS sales. You look to do things differently in order to better align motivations between teammates and customers.

About us
  • Help Scout is a remote team with employees in eleven countries (eight people in the Boston office). We optimize for excellence over geography and overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, chat and video conferencing.
  • Weâre a customer-driven company and always will be. Everything follows the customer experience, no exceptions.
  • Our company is growing and has aspirations of helping millions of people around the world. Accomplishing our goals will present countless challenges and require you to excel in every aspect of the position. Itâs hard work, but the people weâre looking for love exploring and solving hard problems.
  • This is not the typical startup ârocket ship.â Weâll never compromise customers or the experience in favor of growth. Our purpose is to build a profitable company that small businesses love and sustain it. We optimize your career at Help Scout for the long term as well, so keeping a healthy work/life balance is an important priority.
  • We value diversity at Help Scout and welcome all applicants regardless of actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, sexual identity, gender identity, gender expression, economic status, ability, disability, religious beliefs or disbeliefs, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, marital status, parental status, or caregiver status.

Benefits
  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. Weâll even buy your home office furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Harvard Pilgrim HMO or PPO policies.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider.
  • International Benefit Stipend - If youâre based outside the US, youâll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
  • 401k with 1% match- 1% Retirement Plan matching for both US and International Employees
  • Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent). Weâll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need as well as high-end furniture to get your home office started
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

To apply: https://help-scout.workable.com/jobs/400795
jobs.title: Customer Success Manager

jobs.content:
Your impact


PHP is at the heart of Help Scout’s web app. It touches everything, and also powers our back-end administration app. Your work will empower over 7,000 businesses around the world to provide great customer service, and will support other senior engineers on your team.

Tools We Use



  • PHP

  • Backbone.js, Marionette.js, and React.js

  • Node.js

  • RabbitMQ

  • Java (APIs)

  • MySQL and MongoDB


ABOUT THE ROLE



  • The engineering team currently has twenty-five people, nine of whom work on the PHP and JS powering the Help Scout web app. On a typical day you may help a customer with an issue, work on a new feature, update a third party integration or create back-end tools to support our growth team. On any given project, you will be communicating with internal APIs, integrating with 3rd party services, optimizing processes using Redis and RabbitMQ, and wrapping it all up in support of a Backbone/Marionette (and sometimes React) front end.

  • Our engineering teams work in two-week iterations, communicate mostly via Slack and are committed to remote, agile development. When you are ready, you’ll create and send a pull request with test cases and tag your team for review (often over a video and screen-sharing session). We are investing heavily in continuous integration and delivery so your development branch can be easily tested on environments that closely match production. You’ll work autonomously for the most part and we trust you to get work done when/where you can be productive.

  • Your team performs engineering support when a question can’t be answered by our in-house support team and passes triage. We’ll get you up-to-speed with engineering support so you can help our customers and improve the product along the way.

  • Every 10 weeks, two PHP engineers from the team will work exclusively on either growth projects or support tool engineering. When you are on the growth rotation, you will work closely with the design team on internal tools or integrations, improvements to the onboarding process or other features aimed at customer growth. When you are on the support tool rotation you will work closely with the support team to improve their efficiency through tool building, automation and helping customers with our APIs.

REQUIREMENTS

About You
  • You are very experienced with modern PHP development practices and open source frameworks. Youâve worked on these sorts of projects at scale and feel confident solving complex problems.
  • You have created Backbone (or a similar framework) single page applications before and can write JavaScript from scratch to implement a feature. Marionette and/or React experience is a bonus, but not required. We can help you pick it up.
  • Your code is not only reliable and performant for customers, but can be read, maintained and understood easily by other engineers on your team. You can also speak and write in terms that non-geeks understand. Clear communication is super important in a remote culture like ours.
  • You believe in writing unit and integration tests and have at least tried TDD. You like owning the quality of the code you write â QA doesnât mean throwing it over the wall for someone else to test. You understand that some things are too costly to automate and must be manually tested to get it right.
  • You believe remote teams are the future of work, or are at least excited about the idea. You have experience working with remote teams or can adjust your work/management style to be remote-friendly.

ABOUT US

  • Help Scout is a remote team with employees in eleven countries (eight people in the Boston office). We optimize for excellence over geography and overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, chat and video conferencing.
  • Weâre a customer-driven company and always will be. Everything follows the customer experience, no exceptions.
  • Our company is growing quickly and has aspirations of helping millions of people around the world. Accomplishing our goals will present countless challenges and require you to excel in every aspect of the position. Itâs hard work, but the people weâre looking for love exploring and solving hard problems.
  • This is not the typical startup ârocket shipâ. Weâll never compromise customers or the experience in favor of growth. Our purpose is to build a profitable company that small businesses love and sustain it. We optimize your career at Help Scout for the long term as well, so keeping a healthy work/life balance is an important priority.
  • We value diversity at Help Scout and welcome all applicants regardless of actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, sexual identity, gender identity, gender expression, economic status, ability, disability, religious beliefs or disbeliefs, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, marital status, parental status, or caregiver status.

BENEFITS
  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. Weâll even buy your home office furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Harvard Pilgrim HMO or PPO policies.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider.
  • International Benefit Stipend - If youâre based outside the US, youâll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
  • Retirement Plan/401K - 1% matching for both US and International Employees
  • Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent). Weâll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

To apply: https://help-scout.workable.com/jobs/397739

jobs.content:
About the position
This is a full stack position with an expected duration of 3 months. You will work remotely and can choose the hours that you work, as long as we have a couple hours of overlap during the day (Toronto is UTC -5:00).

We are seeking someone with intermediate Python/Django experience and novice/intermediate experience with React.js (with Redux a big plus). The position is heavily weighted towards front-end development yet will require interfacing with our back-end. The position will entail several small tasks rather than undertaking a large project and really is a great opportunity to learn/strengthen React.js skills quickly.

About the company
ClinicSense offers clinic management software to small wellness clinics. We help automate several of the tedious day-to-day administrative tasks, so that our customers can spend less time on paperwork and more time with their clients. 

To apply: Please send your resume to daniel@clinicsense.com. Please let us know about specific projects that you've worked on in the past using Python/Django and what your contributions to the project were. We'd also like to know about your React.js experience - and whether you are a total beginner, have done self-guided projects, or if you've worked on full-fledged React.js projects. Please also send your hourly wage expectation.

Hello,
I am a marketing consultant who routinely gets more business than he canhandle.

Due to the overload of work I need someone to help out withvarious clients and projects.
This is the first time I hire out for an ongoing marketing position(I have had designers work with me for years) so bear throughout the hiringprocess.
 

I am looking for a marketing generalist. Someone who hasdone
  • Email marketing
  • SEM (AdWords, Bing etc)

  • LinkedIn ads
  • Landing page A/B Testing having used Optimizely, Ominconvertor any other tools
