jobs.content:
Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form-building application, is looking for a UX Designer to add to its already awesome Product Design Team!

Formstack is a 10 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. 

Who You Are:

You're passionate about web apps, user-centered web design and have a passion for learning new skills. You also enjoy working in a collaborative environment that values critical & constructive discussions about design.

What You'll Do:


  • Work with the Product Design, Product Management and Development team to design and iterate user interface designs for the Formstack app.

  • Collaborate with our Product Manager, Fellow Designers, UX Researchers and Development team to create wireframes, prototypes, user flows, mockups and polished final designs.

  • Produce final user interface designs, while adhering to, and improving our UI library and Design Guidelines.

  • Work with your cross functional team to implement your designs in an agile workflow environment.



How You Qualify:


  • 3+ years of experience.

  • BA degree or higher.

  • Experience working closely with product development teams.

  • Practicing UX design as a major role in your job.

  • Knowledge of how to best design to solve business and user problems. Ability to understand the needs of customers.

  • Design fundamentals including information design, visual design, industry UI standards for desktop and web-based applications, and ease of use best practices.

  • Experience with relevant design tools (Adobe CS, Sketch, Invision...)

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.



Extra Credit Qualifications:


  • Experience working on a UX team.

  • Strong understanding and/or experience using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

  • Experience with designing, running and analyzing A/B tests or any other quantitative data analysis.

  • Experience designing for mobile apps (iOS, Android, Windows, etc.) and the mobile web.



Why You Want to Work at Formstack:


  • Remote environment

  • Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits.

  • 401k with matching company contribution

  • Friday Lunch (Indianapolis Office)

  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job

  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning

  • Yearly company gatherings

  • Generous PTO



Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out our about page and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life!
jobs.title: Product Designer

jobs.content:
Formstack, Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, is looking for a Front-End Developer

to add to its already awesome Product Design team.



Formstack is a 10 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform.



Job Description:



In this position you will work on a cross-functional team around a specific part of the app. Your team will work together in a scrum methodology to deliver new features and improvements to the Formstack platform. You will be responsible for implementing new front end code, improving and maintaining existing functionality. You will also work with the product design team to improve and maintain our custom built UI Library. You will also have a lot of fun collaborating, playing games, solving really difficult problems and building relationships with some really awesome, talented people.



What You Will Do: 




  • You will collaborate with a cross functional team around a specific part of the app. You'll work with Product Designers, Product Managers, Developers, QA Testers and UX Researchers.

  • Work with your team in a agile process to deliver each projects goals.

  • Develop and test across multiple browsers, platforms and devices - including smartphones and tablets.

  • Help improve and maintain our custom frontend UI library, optimizing it and making our whole front end codebase as efficient as possible. The next great Formstacker will also work with the Development department to assure a smooth hand-off of assets for implementation, work with both the Product Design and Development teams to implement their designs in an agile workflow environment and effectively manage their time across multiple projects and tasks in a deadline-driven, team environment.



Who You Are:



You enjoy working in a collaborative environment that values critical & constructive discussions about design and development. You're passionate about web apps and modern, user-centered web design and development. If that's you, you might be just what we need!



How You Qualify:



You must have a minimum of 1-3 years experience working in a fast-paced environment AND: 




  • Experience using CSS preprocessors such as SASS or LESS.

  • Experience writing awesome HTML5 and CSS3.

  • Solid experience with JS, particularly AngularJS.

  • Experience with version control systems (Git).

  • Comfortable using command line tools.

  • Experience with responsive design concepts.

  • Experience or a high level of interest in usability and user experience.

  • Knowledge of how to best design to solve business and user problems. Ability to understand the needs of customers.

  • Experience with relevant design tools.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.



Extra Credit Qualifications: 




  • Experience with frontend UI libraries (Foundation, Bootstrap, custom).

  • Experience with frontend unit testing (Mocha, Jasmine, Karma, Protractor etc.).

  • Experience with task runners such as Grunt/Gulp (or Makefile).

  • Experience with javascript frameworks (AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Polymer etc.).

  • Experience with Node.js.

  • Experience with Lean/Agile methodologies.

  • Experience working on a SaaS product



Learn More About How Our Team Works:



Everyone on our team blogs about working at Formstack. We dive into the details on our process, tools and anything else we feel like sharing. http://designstack.io/



What Formstack Offers:




  • Remote environment

  • Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits.

  • 401k with matching company contribution

  • Friday Lunch (Indianapolis Office)

  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job

  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning

  • Yearly company gatherings

  • Generous PTO



Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this Video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life!

jobs.content:
Our Tech Team, located in a centric office in Amsterdam is looking for a full-time Architect to evolve our Ad Serving platform.


As an Architect you will be in charge of evolving and developing our current Ad Serving platform, to make it stable, fully featured, and outstanding in the market. We have algorithms to pick the best offers for particular users, specially ads that deliver value for everyone involved in the process (users enjoying free apps and websites, advertisers looking for new users, and publishers looking to monetize their work).


We believe that ads should deliver value - and for that's it's crucial selecting the best offer for the right person. In order to achieve it we track the user's countries, preferences, likes and dislikes, and trends in the offers inventory.


We want you to bring us knowledge about the advertising industry; good coding skills to write clean reliable code, and take ownership of the features that will allow us to evolve our product. As the team grows you will coach the new team members in the features, coding style, and how to achieve their goals and improve their skills.


The current codebase is written in PHP and deployed in AWS, where we use intensively EC2, RDS and DynamoDB. We are open to using other technologies, and we want to take our stack to the next level with your expertise and experience. We know we will need to get deeper into interesting stuff, such as machine learning, real time reporting, real time event processing, consider other backend languages for our microservices platform... and who knows what else? 


Join us and help us shape the future of advertising!

jobs.content:
This is an opportunity to lead the sales team at a self-funded, fast growing startup. You will report directly to the CEO and be responsible for executing on ConvertKitâs sales goals.
ConvertKit is an email marketing company for professional bloggers. We have 10,000 paying customers, send 150 million emails per month, and are growing revenue quickly.

Think of ConvertKit as the power of Infusionsoft, but easier to use than MailChimp. We're a remote team of 22+ people in 7 states and 4 countries. We're bootstrapped, profitable, and growing quickly.

Because we are self-funded and profitable we focus on serving our customers, not doing whatever is necessary to close our next funding round. As Director of Sales youâre responsible for recruiting the right high-value customers to ConvertKit.

The right person for this position will have:

  • Experience leading a sales team with the goal of consistent revenue growth, with an inside sales focus.
  • The ability to create, maintain and document a process for an organized sales pipeline.
  • A self-motivated attitude, focused on meeting and exceeding sales quotas and leading the sales team to do the same.
  • A strong understanding of the blogging industry with many personal relationships to turn into customers.
  • The ability to understand the needs of ConvertKitâs largest customers, when it pertains to email marketing, in order to accurately position ConvertKit to potential clients.
  • Great empathy, communication, and listening skills to understand the needs of their team.
  • A desire to lead a small, highly effective team rather than just increasing headcount to meet goals.
  • The ability to set and implement sales plans & forecasts for both long-term and short-term goals.
  • The ability to run a data driven sales team, with real-time metrics and dashboards for each team member.
  • Ability to work well with others and initiate consistent communication across teams.
Key metrics:

  • New customer accounts retained for 90 days or longer (focus on obtaining the right customers who are a good fit for ConvertKit).
  • New customers from affiliates and growth of affiliate referrals over time.
  • ROI from signups from conferences/sponsorships.
  • Measuring results from each step of the sales funnel.
Areas of responsibility:

  • Direct Sales for accounts over 10,000 subscribers.
  • Booking and hosting webinars and other affiliate promotions.
  • Attending and sponsoring conferences for new customers and partner relationships.
  • Affiliates.
  • Real-time tracking and analytics on all areas of responsibilities.
  • Sales forecasting
  • Sales funnel
  • Understanding potential customer characteristics and how it affects their progression through the sales funnel
Weekly, quarterly, yearly sales planningManaging and coaching sales team
  • Hiring/Firing as needed
  • Performance reviews
  • Weekly 1-on-1s
  • Regular team meetings
  • Sales training
Developing sales budgetsRegular communication and partnership with marketing director for across team projects/promotions
Perks and benefits

  • Competitive salaries
  • Commissions on new accounts
  • Generous equipment budget
  • Work from anywhere
  • 3 weeks paid vacation
  • 9 paid holidays
  • 3 sick days
  • $1,000 yearly vacation bonus

To apply: Apply here: https://convertkit.workable.com/jobs/398706/candidates/new

jobs.content:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

jobs.content:
The Full Stack Developer / Senior Developer will work on a variety of projects to support our Story Tools, Metered Paywall and Identity Arc Suite of applications including building out new features, making improvements to existing features and functionality and maintaining and improving our AWS infrastructure.



The ideal candidate has a demonstrated history, and passion for, solving complex technical challenges with a particular focus on efficiency and performance. Our development team is an energetic and forward-thinking team which uses rapid agile development in an open-source, devops cloud-based environment.



Responsibilities include:



  • Developing new, and contributing to existing, platforms that have a critical role in the digital landscape that supports washingtonpost.com.

  • Leading and participating in major architectural decisions, helping to review code and implementations, and bring in new and emerging technologies into the organization.

  • Promoting an agile - prototype first - culture that prizes continuous learning and growth, while maintaining a high regard for quality.

  • Owning the end to end technical requirements and roadmap for major engineering products.

  • Working in tandem with editorial and business partners to build leading edge media products that have a material impact on The Washington Post and the industry.



Requirements include:

jobs.content:
We're looking for a support programmer to work with us as we build a safer, faster, better Basecamp. As well as working on Basecamp and our other apps, you'll be an important part of our work on Basecamp, the company. You'll be joining our existing support programmer Jim and working as part of our Security, Infrastructure and Performance team in a fun and varied role that will allow you to develop personally and professionally.

We recognize the strength that comes from having diverse teams built from different backgrounds, experiences and identities, and the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best work of your career. That starts with regularly working no more than 40 hours a week, and hopefully getting 8+ hours sleep a night. Our benefits are designed to support a sustainable, healthy relationship with your work.

Currently our team works from 32 different cities, spread across 6 countries. You can work from anywhere in the world, but your normal working day should have 4 hours or more overlap with Central Time (CST).

About you

Do you have questions?
Do you like finding answers?
Does helping people make your heart sing?
Can you approach problems calmly and compassionately?
Do you think clearly, and can you express yourself in English and in code?

About the job
Here are some examples of the kind of work you'll be doing. Every single day, you'll get to work across teams to support three major areas:

Making our customers happy. 

  • Youâll be helping our customers to perform tasks they canât do easily in Basecamp itself. We refer to these as concierge-style requests. They often involve writing small snippets of Ruby and working in a console
  • Youâll make it easier for companies to trust us by answering security and compliance questions
  • Every day youâll be supporting our wonderful support team, to help them to ask better questions and find better answers for our customers
  • Developers who are working with our APIs sometimes need some help too, and youâll be on hand to offer the right documentation, and suggestions on the best way to approach things

Working on our legacy
In the pursuit of answers, you'll go delving into the codebase for all of our apps (including the very first Rails app!) to discover how things work. You'll be comfortable looking at code, exceptions and logs, identifying problems and suggesting fixes. 

Experience with Ruby, Rails and JavaScript would be very helpful, but if you have been using different languages and stacks, that's fine too. Be sure to tell us all about it in your application.

As well as spelunking through our apps, you'll work with people across Basecamp every day:
  • Delving into the codebase for all of our apps (including the first Rails app!) to discover how things work
  • Working with our ops team to track down mail delivery issues, or networking problems or SSL certificate fun
  • Working with programmers to triage bugs, suggest fixes, and write code
  • Exploring issues with our Android or iOS apps, and working with our mobile teams
  • Support our QA team as they lead our feature retrospectives

Helping us find ways to be better
  • Triaging security reports & identifying fixes
  • Looking at reports of slowness in our apps and searching for the cause
  • Researching & planning improvements across teams, like ending support for RC4, or taking part in PrivacyShield certification
  • Looking at exceptions in our apps, and identifying fixes
  • Providing thoughtful commentary on product pitches, ideas and suggested fixes based on what you have seen
  • Investigating common cases, and coming up with ideas on how to reduce them

Youâll get support and trust every step of the way, and the freedom to make decisions to make things simpler, clearer, easier and more honest.

To apply: If this sounds like the kind of work youâd love to do, you can apply here: https://basecamp.workable.com/jobs/395476. Weâre accepting applications until February 3rd, 2017.

jobs.content:
As a MySQL DBA at Catawiki, you are the master of hundreds of servers and dozens of services. All Catawiki users will appreciate you for placing great importance on high-availability and fault-tolerance in each and every piece of infrastructure. Your colleagues will praise you for the awesome runtime you are building to provide them with the highest level of service and security.


With your broad knowledge of the infrastructure and X-Ray vision you can see everything what will happen in the next second. Any cloud provider is envious of your magical provisioning script when setting up a new cluster. You know that the heaven is a place where each packet, connection and log line matters. You'll achieve all of this and more by working closely together with the team of system engineers and back-end developers who really appreciate the pragmatic approach you are taking. Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:



  • Automating database systems management;

  • Actively monitoring and troubleshooting of all database infrastructure;

  • Providing knowledge and support for software developers.


The list of the tools you'll be faced with includes but is not limited to: Linux, KVM, Ansible, Git, Nginx, MySQL, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, InfluxDB, Solr, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, Cassandra, Redis, Zabbix, ELK, AWS.

jobs.content:
The opportunity



Zalando's success also tells the story of our exceptional team and our efforts. We are always happy to welcome new colleagues who join us in creating the world's best online fashion experience.

We are currently looking for self-driven, detail-oriented NetSuite Developers. Using the NetSuite platform, you will play a critical role in designing, implementing and maintaining effective and scalable solutions for our fashion platform. This is a great opportunity to join a fast growing fashion company in a greenfield NetSuite deployment. With the help of your excellent technical and communication skills, you will work collaboratively to deliver solutions to a wide variety of stakeholders throughout the business.

What we are looking for



  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Science or Computer Science

  • 3+ years of hands-on NetSuite experience in administrator or developer role

  • NetSuite Administrator and/or Developer Certification is a plus

  • Working knowledge of JavaScript programming in an application/workflow environment

  • Prior application development experience with ERP systems

  • Experience designing and developing solutions for data migration, systems integration, and scripts containing business logic to support functional requirements

  • Ability to develop functional solutions following best practices and taking into consideration the impact on performance and security

  • Highly motivated self-starter, ready to learn new technologies with the ability to be flexible and creative

  • High aptitude to understand complex assignments, analyze problems and provide effective solutions

  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, and time management skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to thrive in an energetic, fast-paced, high-growth, entrepreneurial environment.




Your responsibilities



  • Work closely with Product Owners to Interpret functional requirements to scope and implement solutions in NetSuite based on evolving business needs

  • Develop, test, and deploy customizations, custom objects and record types, roles/permissions, page layouts, reports and dashboards

  • Leverage and customize out-of-the-box NetSuite solutions

  • Configure NetSuite to align to company use of forms and data sets to manage unique business processes

  • Perform regular data audits and resolve identified issues

  • Coordinate with NetSuite support on issues that cannot be resolved internally

  • Understand design interdependencies and deploy thoughtfully without putting existing infrastructure at risk

  • Prepare and perform due diligence prior to NetSuite releases

  • Debug and troubleshoot production issues

  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders with regard to project status and delivery timeframes




What you can expect from us



  • Gaining experience from a startup-driven environment where you work closely with our VP of Technology

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical leads who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals.




About Zalando



Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams - and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our Tech recruiter Antonia Samanns.

jobs.content:
Job Summary


The TMT Observatory Software (OSW) effort provides a wide range of critical configuration-controlled software for observatory operations, including science operations support software and the software infrastructure that integrates and controls all telescope and instrument systems. Science operations software includes proposal and observation planning tools, observation execution and visualization software, data handling and management, telescope-control and instrument-observing user interfaces.


The Observatory Software (OSW) Senior Software Developer will be a key member of the project team; it is an opportunity to bring high-standard software design and extensive development experience to an exciting science project. The position reports to the Observatory Software Project Manager. The OSW Senior Software Developer will be a part of an international software development organization as the development of observatory software is shared between the TMT Project Office and the India partner institutions. The majority of the software design effort is performed at the TMT PO; the software implementation effort is performed by qualified software development companies based in India – a major TMT partner. This position will play a key role in the software design effort as well as leading and supporting software implementation activities in India.


The planned location for this position is the TMT Project Office in Pasadena, CA. Some travel to partner locations is expected as part of this position to support the software development process during construction. Some travel to the observatory site is also expected during the integration and commissioning phases of the project.


Job Duties




  • Work closely with the TMT Software System Architect to develop detailed designs for all OSW subsystems




  • Become a technical expert in the OSW architecture, design, tools and languages in order to support development teams in India and elsewhere in the project




  • Support the development and maintenance of software requirements and interfaces between OSW and other TMT subsystems




  • Develop TMT Systems Engineering deliverables required for preliminary and final design phases, including interface control documents (ICDs), detailed design description documents, preliminary hazard analysis (PHA), FMEA and reliability analysis, user story list and definitions, requirements traceability, verification plans and compliance matrices, etc.




  • Lead and support software implementation activities in India, including sprint planning, review of implementation approach and delivered source code, testing and acceptance of delivered software, review of delivered software documentation, sprint conclusion review and lessons learned, daily technical support, review of software quality metrics, issue prioritization, tracking and resolution, etc. Travel to India to kick-off and support implementation activities as necessary




  • Perform integration, verification and acceptance testing of delivered software working closely the with test team at the India partner institutions, using the TMT Software Test and Integration Lab (STIL). Support tracking, prioritizing and resolving of OSW software bugs using the JIRA issue management tool




  • Develop prototype code as needed during the preliminary and final design phases and provide coding as needed to resolve bugs working with the India partner institutions and vendors




  • Support development, implementation and improvement of TMT software systems engineering and software quality assurance processes. Help develop software quality metrics and work with the STIL staff to implement them




  • Apply TMT software systems engineering and software quality processes and tools throughout the software development life cycle. Provide leadership and support to the TMT partners on TMT software processes and best practices in software development and testing




  • Participate in cross-functional software working groups and provide support to resolution of issues and lessons learned




  • Participate in TMT software formal systems engineering reviews and attend review panels for other TMT software subsystem reviews




  • Support the Assembly, Integration and Verification (AIV) effort at the TMT Observatory site




  • Provide input into planning for early operations with respect to OSW
jobs.title: Observatory Software Senior Software Developer

jobs.content:
__Objective__

To add a designer to our growing team who can make our beautiful code look beautiful to the end users.

----

__Contract Description__

Bonk Studios seeks a front end web designer to join the team. Before we bore you with the requirements of this position, why Bonk Studios?

* We are a small team that throws out the politics, and focuses on developing great technology.
* Adapting the SCRUM Methodology, your voice will always be heard, and your strengths will be utilized.
* Each year, you will be flown out for a business vacation, and getting to meet the team. This year, we went to Hilton Head, SC.
* Being able to work with the freedom of a contractor, but the stability of an employee gives you the best of both worlds. Never hustle finding gigs as a freelancer, yet being able to program in your underoos. At Bonk Studios, you will always have 40 hours of work each week. This always has been and always will be the case. No more hustling to find gigs!
* Sick of writing emails back and forth? We utilize slack, and a bug tracking system to communicate. This leaves more time to focus on developing great applications, and posting funny pictures!

Now that you know a little bit about our team and how we operate, what skills are essential to join Bonk Studios?

* Great design must be second nature to you. Ideally, someone with a wide range of taste. For example, our website is quite unique to the typical website. Business professional, edgy, retro, etc. should all be styles that you are comfortable with.
* Expert with CSS and SASS.
* An expert with Bootstrap.
* Must be a team player, great communicator, and able to work on multiple projects at the same time.
* Master of time management.
* Strong desire to always increase your skill set and adapt to new technologies.

Other skills that are a big plus:

* Knowledgeable with SCRUM Methodology. If you have never practiced this, we can help you.
* Knowledge of jQuery and Angular
* Knowledge of Typescript.

----

__Contract Details__

From time to time, Bonk Studios and the team will be flown out to visit clients to go over projects. The contractor should be available for this.

___Note: This is a contracting position. No benefits will be given, nor will any taxes be with held.___

jobs.content:
Goshipages is looking for a part-time remote Customer Support Hero to join our team.

We are a small start-up that has been helping thousands of people find housing in South Korea each year with our super simple accommodation management and search product.

We are currently investing heavily into our technology and finalizing a complete re-imagination of our entire business and will launch a shiny new product in the coming months.

Our goal is to build the business tool of choice for accommodation providers around the world. We are starting in South Korea and plan to quickly grow to the rest of Asia before taking over the entire world - We have a lot of work to do and we need you to help us get there.

----

As our customer support manager you will be the voice of the company.

* You will be communicating with our existing and trial customers via phone and chat for customer support and lead generation
* You will grow our leads database of potential customers and contacting leads via phone to convert them to paying customers
* You will be maintaining our blog and social media channels in Korean and English for both our housing-managers and housing-seeker users.
* This is a __remote and part-time role__, which means we are accepting applications from anywhere in the world - so long as you can be available to work Monday to Thursday 9am to 5pm __South Korean time__.

__We offer__

* A lot of room to learn and work on your own ideas
* The freedom to work from anywhere in the world that you want
* A competitive salary + commission

__About you:__

Must haves:

* Exceptional phone manners
* You are a sales genius and can prove it
* Native Korean fluency
* You're fluent in English, verbally and written
* You are able to work during Korean working hours
* You are able to work independently and to structure your work day on your own

For bonus points:

* You have good knowledge of the housing/accommodation industry in Korea
* You have experience working remotely and can tell us about it
* You also speak other languages - Mandarin or Japanese would be a plus!

jobs.content:
Hiring: Junior Full Stack Javascript Developer with React experience

Howdy! I'm Dave Stevens, Co-founder & CEO of Chartlytics. We're looking for a very passionate full-stack javascript developer to help us build the most powerful behavior measurement platform for accelerating learning outcomes across all of human learning the world has ever seen! Phew...

Accelerating learning outcomes

Our mission is to help each learner reach their latent potential. With my business partner, Dr. Rick Kubina (Professor of Special Education at Penn State) we are transforming how teachers, analysts, coaches, and trainers understand the effects of their instruction on individuals so they can make more timely decisions to produce accelerated outcomes.

Remote FTW!

We all work remotely, and so can you! We use slack, github, zoom, to communicate with each other regularly. We're fun, candid and focused on building good software and good solutions. We're bootstrapping the company so there are no VC's or angels to change our business model and force us down paths we'd rather not go. This has it's pros and cons but we're at least in control of our own destiny. If you're looking for free lunches, a built in spa and gym, and a bus to pick you up because you have no where to park your car - we're not for you. :)

Got Skills?

Ideally you should have:

  • Strong skills in modern Javascript (ES6/ES7) techniques.
  • A solid understanding of React, and unidirectional dataflow architectures i.e. flux/redux.
  • An appreciation of working with open source code.
  • Interest in implementing functional programming techniques.
  • The ability to create a straightforward user interface
  • Knowledge of designing schemas (currently using MongoDB, long term looking to switch to PostgreSQL).
  • Familiarity with node.js for creating restful API’s.
  • A strong attention to detail
  • An appreciation for maintainability over cleverness

Node all the things!

Our stack:

  • All on AWS
  • Node.js & Koa
  • React & Redux
  • React-Native
  • Mongo
  • Terraform

We are looking for passionate javascript developers. If you think this - http://demo.chartlytics-stage.com/ - is cool, checkout our blog and facebook to get an idea of who we are and what we exist for. If you like the mission, love the stack, and would like to be involved on the ground floor and meet the qualificaions above we'd love to have you on board.
jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Javascript Developer

If you are another dev shop, independent contractor, or located outside the United States, please do not inquire about this opening. We treat all such emails as spam. Sorry, but otherwise we get flooded with emails that make it harder to find the candidates we're actually advertising to find. Thank you.

To apply: Please send a link to your resume, Web site, and Github account, whichever is applicable, to:jobs@pandastrike.comPlease use the subject line: âSenior Developer / Full-Stack / Rails.âPlease also include links to any projects or code that demonstrates your capabilities. Given the volume of replies we usually get, this will help us differentiate you from other candidates.If you don't hear back from us, please accept our apologies in advance. We're a small shop and we don't have dedicated HR staff or a recruiter, so we reply only to the most promising candidates.
jobs.title: Senior Rails Developers

jobs.content:
The Red Van Workshop specializes in top-tier eCommerce web development on the Salesforce Commerce Cloud (formerly known as Demandware) platform for some of the world's best companies, and we shine in customized development, complex scenarios, and international expansion. We perform system design, architecture, integration, development direction, implementation, testing, customization, support, and delivery.

We try to be the best consulting company anyone has ever worked for, and the best help any client can ever get. We will challenge you, our clients will challenge you, and we respect you.

You should apply if you're a talented front-end or full-stack web developer who has the capacity to use server-side templating and is very comfortable working in JavaScript, CSS, and markup to build, enhance, and troubleshoot high performance and high-traffic eCommerce sites. If you prefer integration, server-side functionality, and architecture in context of the platform, we do that too. 

Web development experience is required, and experience with a large eCommerce or CMS platform is preferred (Demandware, Magento, Sitecore, etc.). We do expect that you can show at least a few examples of sites or code that you've worked on and are proud of - they don't have to be intrinsically exciting, just tell us a bit about what, why, and how you did it. 

To be considered, applicants must be located in the United States of America, legally authorized to work in the United States of America, and fluent in written and verbal English. Recruiting and staffing firms will not be considered.

The Red Van Workshop is a distributed company, so your geographic location within the USA is not critical: your office is your choice. Occasional travel availability to client locations is necessary, however, so reasonable proximity to an airport with good commercial service is necessary. Most of our crew travels rarely, at most a few days per quarter. 

To apply: Send a portfolio and/or resume to work@redvanworkshop.com
jobs.title: Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware) / Web Developer

jobs.content:
Have you built sizeable applications for thousands of users? Do you value simplicity over over-engineered solutions? Do you want to work on an elegant solution to infrastructure monitoring that just works for our enterprise and startup clients? If so, read on.


We’re on a mission to bring sanity to cloud operations and we need you to build the data pipelines to ingest, store, analyze and query hundreds of billions of events a day. 


Join us to build powerful and resilient data systems.


What you will do



  • Build distributed, high-throughput, real-time applications

  • Do it in Go and Python, with bits of C or other languages on the back-end and Reactjs (with flux and redux) and d3.js on the front-end

  • Use Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and other open-source components

  • Join a tightly knit team solving hard problems the right way

  • Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company
jobs.title: Software Engineer

jobs.content:
Have you ever wondered what happens inside the Cloud?

DigitalOcean is on a mission to simplify cloud infrastructure for the millions of software developers around the world. We are a small, distributed, and cohesive team. At DigitalOcean, every single engineer has a massive impact on the organization and product, and we wan to keep it that way. We believe in autonomy for teams and individuals, and that's why we like to work with people who have an area of expertise but either already have or are willing to learn skills needed by their teams to deliver the best product in small, frequent increments.

Ultimately, we want you to be passionate about creating products that you and your peers would love.

Our systems make our users' lives simple by letting them deploy, scale, and manage their operations with a simple call to our API. As a software engineer focused on the back-end, you will build and own the services that power this cloud.

You will join a team of engineers experienced in the construction of distributed architectures using microservices. The bulk of your work will be in Go and Ruby, but you will use other technologies and platforms relevant to your team's work.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Join an end-to-end team, responsible for all aspects of a given product or platform
  • Design, build and own various services and APIs, from their conception to production and maintenance
  • Work in a business domain you already know and are passionate about
  • Own the operations, performance, and reliability of the services developed by your team
  • Solve unique problems as you cross the border between product and infrastructure

What We'll Expect From You:

  • 8+ years experience as a software engineer, developer, or programmer
  • Excellent skills in at least two programming languages, preferably (but not restricted to) Go, Ruby, JavaScript, Python, Java, or Scala
  • You have some experience in distributed application architecture technologies
  • You have extensively used some form of RPC (e.g. grpc, REST, SOAP, ProtocolBuffers, Thrift)
  • Strong opinions, weakly held

Why You'll Like Working at DigitalOcean:

  • Because we have amazing people. We can promise you will work with some of the smartest and coolest people in the industry. We work hard but we always have fun doing it. Archery classes, DJ lessons, and office pie fights are a thing. We care deeply about each other and take our “no jerks” rule very seriously.
  • Because we value development. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development. You’ll need to be great to get hired here and we promise you’ll get even better.
  • Because we care about you. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to keep you fit, and a monthly commute allowance to make your trips to and from work easier.
  • Because we invest in your future. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match. We also provide all employees with Kindles and reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
  • Because we want you to love where you work. We have a great office space located in the heart of SoHo NYC and offer daily catered lunches to keep your hunger at bay. We’re also very remote-friendly—we use Slack to communicate across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to take an all-expense-paid trip to our HQ to get quality in-person time with the team at least once a year. We also allow employees to customize their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in HQ.
  • Because we value diversity and inclusivity. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer Services Applications

jobs.content:
Why weâre hiring a developer

Simple: Weâre growing.

Weâre growing, and weâre growing fast. Weâre searching for the best and the brightest developers cities across the country have to offer! Weâre searching for ambitious, driven, and creative game changers with a passion for revolutionizing digital marketing technologies, and creating amazing Wordpress sites. We want talented innovators, who never settle for the adequate, and always strive for greatness.

Why? Because thatâs who we are.

 

Weâre not just searching for developers â weâre searching for great developers.

To us, a developer is a scientist as much as an artist; a dynamic individual who can think logically and creatively. A great developer is someone who can write custom, compact, and efficient PHP from scratch and transform WordPress from its default settings into a secure, scalable, and beautifully organized paragon of blazingly fast custom functionality. Weâre searching for developers with a strong commitment to delivering exceptional work, without compromises. We want the rock stars who face challenges with tenacity, an exceptional work ethic, and a positive attitude.

 

Who are we?

http://uptrending.com/

 

Location

This position is 100% remote. Hired candidates may work out of the U.S.-based location of their choosing. 

 

What we offer

As a part of our team, youâll have the opportunity to work on a variety of startup, entrepreneurial, and enterprise-grade projects â projects youâll be excited about. Youâll have the chance to work alongside industry leaders, and learn from their experience and expertise. Youâll have the opportunity to master new technologies, as well as sharpen your current skills. We want our developers to do more than just grow -- we want our team to thrive. We offer a competitive compensation plan, robust benefits, and paid vacation.

 

Required Skills:

PHP --Custom PHP app experience
Wordpress -- WordPress API, PHP classes in the internal codebase, plugin development

DB -- MySQL setup/optimization, custom SQL query experience

Server Admin -- Experience in LAMP setup and configurations
Git -- Multi-dev workflows, branching and merging

Deployments -- Deployments into staging and production server environments

APIs -- Experience with multiple popular APIs; salesforce, marketo, twitter, facebook, etc.
Responsive / Media queries -- Everything we do is fully responsive

CSS -- Sass / Compass / Bourbon / Bourbon Neat

HTML5 -- Clean, semantic, valid HTML

JS -- jQuery, Angular / Ember

UI / UX -- Experience and passion to create beautiful work

QA -- Writing clean code and testing it throughout the development process to ensure the quality is up to standards

 

Additional Requirements:

Portfolio â A robust sample of start-to-finish responsive WordPress development for beautiful web apps and marketing sites. We want to see your best work.

Client Communicationâ Exceptional verbal and written communication skills -- The proven ability and willingness to engage clients directly, brainstorm solutions, and anticipate problems before they arise.
Collaboration â Self-motivated individuals who work well independently and alongside a team. Qualified candidates are comfortable with participating in peer code reviews, learning from constructive feedback, and educating others on best practices and new technologies.

Agility -- We want individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly, and regularly master diverse web technologies, techniques, and best practices.

Growth and Learning â We want curious and motivated individuals who enjoy learning in a company that values personal growth and knowledge

Digital agency experience strongly preferred.


To apply: Send us your cover letter, rÃ©sumÃ©, and a portfolio of your best work to the link below. We look forward to hearing from A+ candidates!https://uptrending.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0m66c/

jobs.content:
We are looking for an SEO pro that's passionate about using organic search, content marketing, and social media to elevate the exposure of websites within search engines. If that's you, keep reading!

As a member of the TakeLessons marketing team, the Senior SEO Manager will report directly to the VP of Marketing and own the development and execution of the companyâs SEO and content marketing strategy to reach target audiences and grow the business.

With hands-on experience and a proven track record for driving qualified traffic, this individual brings expert-level knowledge and experience within SEO, content marketing, and social media. This role is responsible for team management, including the recruitment, coaching, and development of staff. 

Remote workers are also welcome to apply!

This person will ...

  • Define, execute, and evolve the SEO strategy and goals for TakeLessons
  • Be directly responsible for qualified traffic growth through organic search
  • Develop annual and quarterly operating plans and forecasts in-line with business objectives
  • Maintain monthly, quarterly, and yearly reporting to support team objectives and goals
  • Manage the SEO budget to maximize performance and meet or exceed budget goals
  • Identify opportunities, develop proposals, and forecasts results for SEO initiatives
  • Manage link building efforts and develop targeted campaigns for growing domain authority
  • Oversee our content marketing program including research, promotion, and measurement
  • Build our social media presence and drives engagement as part of cohesive SEO strategy
  • Monitor keyword rankings and analytics to measure performance and identify opportunities
  • Iterate and tests to continuously learn and maximize the impact of our SEO efforts
  • Work collaboratively with the marketing team and across departments for driving conversion and growth
  • Recruit, manage, and motivate a highly skilled team necessary to deliver outstanding business results
  • Monitor and appraise staff performance and identifies training and development opportunities that will ensure consistently high performance and retention of key employees
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technical knowledge, and tactics by reviewing professional publications, establishing professional networks, and participating in professional groups
  • Other duties as assigned or required

In order to succeed you need.. 

  • Bachelorâs degree highly preferred or equivalent education and experience
  • Minimum 6 years of B2C digital marketing experience
  • Minimum 4 years hands-on experience managing SEO and content marketing
  • A proven track record of developing, executing and scaling high impact, profitable, SEO programs that drive business results
  • Proven ability to define and execute on assigned goals and objectives
  • Exceptional data and analytics skills with the capacity to be both analytical and creative
  • Organized and detail oriented with the ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
  • Excellent communicator at all levels to drive alignment and action towards goals
  • Significant knowledge of the consumer internet marketplace industry and the ability to continuously evaluate trends and adjust strategy to compensate and take advantage of shifts
  • Strong familiarity across a broad range of digital marketing activities including but not limited to SEM, paid media, email marketing, and conversion preferred
  • People management/supervisory experience
  • A "Rollâupâyourâsleeves" entrepreneurial, startup attitude

We offer a great benefits plan, PTO and 401k plan. We are a startup where you can make a high-impact because of the amount of ownership you have! 

To apply: https://takelessons.com/about/careers

The Role


Roadtrippers is looking for creative problem solvers to help us write code that simplifies the complexities of travel planning and discovery at scale.  As an Android Developer, you will work with other developers as well as our business, content, and design teams to enhance the Roadtrippers mobile experience. Join us to empower the world's travelers and travel companies!
jobs.title: Android Developer

jobs.content:
We are seeking an extremely talented programmer for the CTO of our company.  This is a hands on role, as you will be the sole programmer to start.  Once you have settled within the company, you will be able to build a team with hires you will recruit, manage and build alongside.  

Our company is an established and profitable top 1000 eCommerce website launched in 2008.  We occupy a niche product category with broad appeal.  As our CTO, you will have a significant impact on the trajectory of the company over the next decade.

You should have great experience/passion about building websites that load quickly.  You should have experience optimizing websites for mobile use.  Our current ecommerce website is a highly customized version of magento enterprise.  As our new CTO, you will work on the existing magento website.  Eventually, we anticipate a complete re-platform to either another ecommerce system or custom/in house.

Below is a list of skills/experiences for this position, divided between required and nice to have:

Required:



  1. Exceptional technical skills, specifically with PHP, MYSQL, javascript, ajax and relevant web technologies.  Cream of the crop, top 1%

  2. Full front end and back end developer

  3. Server management/optimization

  4. Performance optimization

  5. Mobile optimization

  6. Email Management

  7. Good communication skills with non-technical stakeholders in the company

  8. Ability to integrate systems via APIs or any method necessary.

  9. A/b split testing

  10. Able to admit when unable to accomplish a technical task on your own, but able to identify the resources to get the task done.

  11. Understands security best practices and implementation.



Nice to have:



  1. Ecommerce

  2. Magento

  3. SEO

  4. Operation side experience such as warehouse management systems and order fulfillment systems.

  5. Google analytics

  6. Paypal integration



Benefits of working for our company include:



  1. Small/close knit team.

  2. Casual work environment.

  3. Results oriented, not process oriented.  Don't care how you get it done or during what hours you get it done, as long as you get it done!

  4. You will be working directly with the managing partners, so no bureaucracy.

  5. Opportunity to scale up an existing business has lots of room for growth, yet isn't starting from the ground floor.  We have hundreds of thousands of customers and have done millions in revenue.

  6. Opportunity to build a technical team from the ground up according to your vision within a stable company.

  7. You will not be on a time clock.  This is an on site position and you will be asked to be in the office 4-5 days per week.  However, you can set your own specific hours and put time in at home.

  8. Our office is in southern Westchester, easily accessible from New York City or Northern Jersey.  It is a 22 minutes express train from Grand Central



Compensation: Base Salary of 6 figures plus, negotiable based on fit/experience.  Performance based bonuses based on measurable metrics.
jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer For Established Ecommerce Company

jobs.content:
Bonfire is transforming the way people buy and sell high-quality custom shirts. As a leading custom apparel platform, weâve helped thousands of people and organizations raise millions of dollars by selling their own custom shirts â and weâre just getting started.

We have an amazing opportunity for an experienced, creative, and analytical marketing professional to join our team and help our fast-growing platform grow even faster.

What youâll be doing:

Most importantly, youâll be doing what you love. Discovering new channels, converting traffic, optimizing funnels, testing âcrazyâ ideas, and digging into the data to see what works (and what doesnât).

At Bonfire, growth is company-wide. Youâll get to work directly with our product, marketing, engineering, sales, and support teams to drive user and revenue growth across all channels of our platform.

Youâll also have access to implementation teams and internal resources at your disposal to execute high impact growth. Plus, youâll have a sizable marketing budget and subscriptions to modern tools such as Intercom, Heap Analytics, Optimizely, Unbounce, Ahrefs and Hotjar (among others) to help you get the job done.  

This is not an entry level role, and some of the low hanging fruit has already been picked. However, for the right person, this is an incredible opportunity to shape the future growth curve of our company.

What youâre all about:
  • Youâve marketed SaaS platforms, marketplace platforms, e-commerce sites, web/mobile apps, or your own product
  • Youâve scaled other companies/products, and you can prove it
  • Youâre an excellent problem solver
  • Youâve got grit
  • You like getting under the hood and asking âwhy?â and âwhat ifâ¦â
  • Youâre an analytics junkie who checks stats more often than youâd like to admit
  • You are forever curious
  • You donât mind bending the rules
  • You take ownership in your work, even if everything doesnât go as planned
  • You arenât afraid to take risks to make things happen
  • You love learning new things and trying new tools/tactics, even when it falls well outside of your comfort zone

What we are looking for:
  • 5+ years experience in digital marketing and/or product management
  • Deep understanding of paid advertising, SEO, content strategy, email marketing, and other user acquisition channels
  • Strong technical background with working knowledge of HTML/CSS and Javascript
  • Basic design skills with proficiency in Photoshop/Sketch/Illustrator
  • Experience running A/B + MVT and CRO tests with tools like Optimizely/VWO and Unbounce
  • Expertise with modern analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Heap, etc.

Youâre in good company (with a good company). We offer:
  • Competitive compensation with excellent insurance benefits
  • Unlimited paid vacation
  • Remote position - work from anywhere
  • An amazing workplace culture
  • An environment to grow your skills, learn new technologies and tools, and to challenge yourself (and have a lot of fun)
  • The chance to make a real impact in the companyâs growth and history
  • An opportunity to help make a difference in thousands of peopleâs lives

To apply: Does this sound like you? If so, weâd love to hear from you. Apply directly from our careers page https://careers.bonfire.com/growth-marketer/

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer

jobs.content:
NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies in the development, production, and marketing of entertainment, news, and information to a global audience. NBCUniversal owns and operates a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, and world-renowned theme parks. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Summary


Performance Engineering will be a part of the Technology Architecture team of the Sales, Research and Analytics Group at NBCUniversal. The role will report to a Sr. Director/Director of Technology and will help drive the performance & architecture solution of NBCU's Sales & Traffic system and its ecosystem. A primary focus will be to proactively identify, analyze, triage and implement performance improvements in conjunction with the internal DB & architecture team and the product vendor. This position will work closely with our business analyst, business domain experts, vendor resources, GDC staff, process architects and technologists.


Excellent organizational abilities and communication skills are necessary for this role. The candidate will in due course be required to understand both the functional (to the extent necessary) and technical aspects of the application. Previous exposure to Oracle Database Technology and/or the Media industry are desirable.


Specific duties will include:



  •  Work with application users and business analysts to understand their issues and concerns

  • Attend regular calls with the Vendor and prioritize issues and drive product improvements

  • Work closely with the application support team

  • Meet regularly with the Business IT teams to update on status of open issues and future improvements.

  • Troubleshoot application problems in both production and non-production environments; support RCA process and ensure all fixes are fully implemented, collaborate across infrastructure teams to determine RCA 

  • Prioritize and triage application issues relating to performance

  • Maintain a list of top issues and prioritize their fixes

  • Work with the application support team to test and rollout fixes

  • Identify gaps in the product and help set development prioritize.

  • Work closely with the QA lead to build test scripts (mostly relating to performance)

  • Work with the Architecture team on performance and load tests.

  • Monitor databases using vendor tools to identify bottlenecks, performance issues, locks etc. proactively.

  • Write SQL to analyze and research issues on the database.

  • Support scheduled and emergency maintenance events

  • Work with application teams to generate traces on windows and Oracle databases. Extract and send those traces to the vendors.

  • Review SQL and identify bottle necks in execution; read execution plans. With support of DBAs & Architects looks at options to improve performance.

  • In time taking on a more active role in optimizing execution of the application on the Oracle DB. SQL & DB tuning and feature usage.

jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer


Our Customer Engagement team is looking to grow to take on some really interesting, and technical, customer focused work. To do this we need a developer with a desire to cover front-to-back work: we do front end work seen by the customer; we build microservices in Clojure & Go; we deploy & monitor all of this using Docker and AWS ECS.  You really will get exposure across our technology stack.


The team is focused on improving the customer accounts experience: we care about the customer and we support the other uSwitch products; we balance delivering customer value against the technology used and we empower you to own those problems. 


We try to keep a startup feel to how we work: anyone can get involved in any aspect of the product and, sometimes, you might have to.  Expect to not only bring your knowledge and understanding but also to be pushed to grow and expand your experiences.


Technologies, we use: 



  • Languages: Clojure, Go, Ruby, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

  • Services: SQS, Kinesis

  • Analytics: BigQuery, R, Google Analytics

  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker, Terraform


GitHub: https://github.com/uswitch


Our culture


We empower people to make intelligent decisions. We give them the autonomy to experiment and develop innovative ways to deliver a better product.


uSwitch uses a micro-service architecture to help the company and the systems we build be as scalable as possible; teams operate and deploy independently, making as many updates and changes they want to throughout the day.


A World Class Team 


We work in small autonomous product teams with everyone needed across disciplines to help solve problems and deliver. The organisation helps set direction but how you get there is up to you and your team. We share our ideas internally and externally through hosting meet-ups, working on open-source and presenting at conferences.


Ownership 


We expect you to own your problem. If that is delivering a web product then you must understand traffic acquisition, user experience, monitoring, technology, user journey and, importantly, the problem we are trying to solve for the customer. Although the majority of our APIs are written in Clojure and our front end apps tend to be Ruby our philosophy is to use the right tool for the job. We employ polyglot engineers with an interest in experimenting with new technology; if you feel a different language or tool is more appropriate for the problem at hand (and you can bring your team with you) you will have the space to incorporate it - even it if means rewriting existing systems.


Conferences / Public Speaking / Hack days / Community events 


We support many conferences around the globe particularly in the Clojure world and help with both your attendance and speaking engagements (within limits).  You can also see us at Clojure Dojos, we hosted the first couple of clojurebridge events in the UK, have hosted codebar and DataKind.

jobs.content:
Functions


As Software Development Engineer, you will join the team of CAD and PLM experts in the CERN CAD Service to:
  • Participate in technical applications design, development and maintenance around the CAD and PLM tools. Typical application areas include; CAD Data Management, CAD and viewer automation, lifecycles, engineering related processes and configuration management, automated workflows, integration with other systems, tools to enhance data exchange in worldwide design collaborations.
  • Assist CAD and PLM experts to formulate and implement applications requirements specifications, develop high level data and process model, design specifications, and test- and user- documentation.
  • Design, develop and maintain utilizing object oriented, web-based, and RDBMS technology. The development languages and techniques include VB .NET, Java, SQL, HTML and other web technologies. It also includes using the languages of the application programming interfaces (APIs) of the commercial tools.
  • Perform software code analysis, programming, software review, testing, delivery, and support.
  • ...

Qualification required


Master's degree in the field of of software engineering, computer science, or equivalent.

The experience required for this post is:
  • Demonstrated experience in design, development, deployment and maintenance of complex systems, specifically in the domain of developing windows client applications, web applications and integration via web services.
  • Experience with providing user support, as well as technical support in operation, configuration and troubleshooting of applications developed in-house or purchased from a vendor is desired.
  • Excellent working knowledge of VB .NET (or similar like C#, Java Enterprise); expected to foremost work with VB .NET, good knowledge of .NET is thus required ; web technologies (such as ASP, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript) as well as knowledge of relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with CAD tools, PLM systems or mechanical engineering in general is an asset.

The technical competencies required for this post are:
  • Programming/Software development: creation, testing and documenting of new and amended programs; software development processes and techniques.
  • Solution architecture: design and development of complex software solutions.
  • Application support: system maintenance, performance monitoring and user support.

The language competencies required are:
  • English: spoken and written, with the ability to draw-up technical specifications and/or scientific reports, and to make oral presentations. Basic knowledge of French or an undertaking to acquire it rapidly.

Eligibility conditions


Employing a diverse and international workforce is a CERN core value and central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States irrespective of gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or personal situation.
This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 18.01.2017.
By applying here, you allow CERN to consider your application for any position it considers relevant with respect to your profile. Please ensure you update your profile regularly with any relevant information and that you inform the recruitment service if you wish your file to be removed from the database.


Note on Employment Conditions


We offer a limited-duration contract for a period of 5 years. Limited-duration contracts shall terminate by default on their date of expiry.
Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.
These functions require :
  • Work during nights, Sundays and official holidays, when required by the needs of the Organization.

jobs.content:
What you'll do

You'll collaborate to build, maintain and streamline our large application, working with Ruby, Rails, Postgres and more. Some examples of the work you'll be doing include the following:

continually improving our fetching code, which grabs information about millions of properties throughout each day
integrating against a new REST api to give our customers even more info about a house
making our mobile website a more pleasant experience
rewriting a SQL query to be 100x faster
You'll have both the opportunity and the independence to tackle all kinds of challenges: some days you'll work on refactoring a legacy part of the app to make it do something new, and on others, you'll build a brand new, greenfield feature.
You

You care about both building and maintaining a clean, readable, well tested codebase. We're looking for someone with Ruby experience. We do Ruby, Rails, Postgres, plus JavaScript, CSS and HTML on the front end. We don't require you to know all of those, but you should be comfortable in Ruby, and familiar with Rails. You communicate and collaborate with the whole team, be it to work through tough code problems or clarify product specifications.

About Us
We're a small team focused on opening up the old school real estate world.
Our goal is to build the best place for people to browse, shop for, and buy homes.
We employ an iterative approach to building products and deploy multiple times a day.
We have a big vision.
We believe in hiring smart people and giving them the support and flexibility to succeed.
If you work locally, you'll be in a relaxed and fun office in the Belltown neighborhood.
We're looking to hire the best people wherever they are in the world. If you don't want to relocate to beautiful Seattle, you should be awesome at working from home and available to join our daily standup at 10am Pacific. Some developers live in Seattle and come into the Estately office, but the majority live and work remotely, including several who live outside of the United States. We've had remote developers since 2011, and are seasoned veterans of working with a distributed team, across multiple timezones.

Our Hiring Process

We don't believe in algorithmic interviews under hostile conditions. We'll never ask you to invert a binary tree on a whiteboard or interview you with five interviewers at the same time. We like our recruiting process to be transparent to you. It roughly consists of the following steps:

An initial call between you and a member of our team
We'll tell you more about the work that you'd be doing, and why we think Estately is a great place to work. You'll have the opportunity to ask us lots of questions, too. We'll ask you about your experience and some technical questions, mostly to get a feel for where you're at as we move forward with the process.

Individual Exercise
We have a few practical challenges to assess technical knowledge. Over the course of a few hours, you'll be fixing a bug in our app (that we've previously fixed), so we can see how you approach solving a realistic problem.

Pairing on a Few Potential Features
Finally, during the pairing exercises you'll pair with one of our developers to implement an (existing) feature in the app. This will take a couple hours or so, and will mostly consist of discussion about approach, with some coding in the midst of it.

Diversity

Estately seeks to increase the ratio of women and underrepresented minorities in software engineering and development, we encourage women and people from underrepresented groups to apply for this position.

Estately is striving to be a diverse team, made of and built by people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We don't discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, religion, color, or any other group.

jobs.content:
We are looking for an amazing data scientist to join our team at Red Guava. This doesnât mean you need to have 5+ years experience in the industry, we care much more about skill and passion than credentials.

WHO WE ARE

Red Guava is a small, bootstrapped and profitable software company based in Melbourne, Australia. We love building software and working with talented people.

We build a product called Cliniko (http://www.cliniko.com/). Cliniko makes life easy for Allied Health professionals by handling appointment scheduling, storing treatment notes and a bunch of other things too. It is already used globally by tens of thousands of people every day.

HOW WE WORK

We work smarter, not harder. We think work/life balance is important and we work a 30 hour week as standard (you still get a full-time pay; itâs a full-time position).

Some of us work in our office in Melbourne, but not all (we have team members in the UK, USA, Canada, Poland, Brazil, Portugal, France, Malaysia and New Zealand). We want to hire the best person available, not just the best person within a 10km radius.

If you want to know more about how we work, Joel gave a talk (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o_2jXqzxBNU) recently about it.

WHO YOU ARE

You are a data scientist extraordinaire!

You love data, you love numbers and you're very interested in business. People get annoyed at you because you ask too many questions. You just consider it delightfully inquisitive.

You have strong maths and statistics skills. Even more importantly, common sense and logic are some of your best tools.

Getting answers is one thing, but answers that you can act upon, that's when you get excited.

Here's the tricky bit though, we'd love you to have some engineering skills too! If you can implement your own systems for getting the data, it's going to be better for you and us.

Youâre excited by the opportunity to make a real difference in peoples lives with your work. You want to have fun too!

WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON

Let's be honest, you'll know what you should work on better than we do. Of course we have some ideas on things that might be useful, or we wouldn't be hiring, but ultimately we expect you to know how your time is best spent.

A few things you'll likely be doing are: 

- Using the data in Cliniko help improve the experience for new customers
- Helping existing customers get the most out of Cliniko
- Knowing when things aren't going well for our customers so we can lend a helping hand

A lot of this will probably require building models which can predict outcomes so that we can be more proactive with our support for customers.

You'll also need to be setting up tools that make it easy to get the data. We do not have this currently, so this will be part of your role. We'll help of course!

Ultimately, you'll be helping us make better business decisions, and helping our Cliniko customers do the same.

IN SUMMARY

Letâs be clear, you need to be seriously amazing. We are a small team and we want to keep it that way. We will offer you the best job you have ever had with plenty of perks (we don't list them here, but I promise they are good), however we do expect you to be super-talented.

You should be absolutely passionate about making a difference to our business and to our customers. You should take pride in your work and be excited to measure the benefits from it.

Here's your chance to work on challenging and interesting problems with a bunch of talented people. If this sounds like you, we hope to hear from you soon!

To apply: Details for how to apply can be found here http://www.redguava.com.au/jobs/data_scientist/.

jobs.content:
At our Cranfield based Web Development Centre of Excellence, we are responsible for the development of a number key components of the iDirect product, as well as providing professional services, training and product support to our global user-base. Satellite networks are complex systems; configuration, maintenance, monitoring and reporting is made a lot easier with our innovative web-based Network Management System tools we develop here at Cranfield.


iDirect Pulse, our primary NMS, is made up of three key components; a C++ based Back-End which collects and caches real-time information from around the network, a JavaScript based Front-End which visualises this information for the user, and a Perl/Node based Middle-End, which acts as an interface between the BE and FE. All three components seamlessly work together to allow for management of the wider iDirect satellite platform.


Our organisation as a whole is very much Scrum/Agile focussed, and as such we work in diverse teams where thoughts and ideas are shared and collaboration is actively encouraged. This gives all our staff the opportunity to work across the product, really getting to understand exactly how and why it operates, and how it fits seamlessly within the larger iDirect communication platform.



About you:


We’re looking for the very best candidates to join us in Cranfield, where you will work alongside a wider team of smart, creative and dedicated colleagues. We value a good approach to problem solving, logical thinking and the enthusiasm, passion and ability to learn new skills quickly


Those who are successful within iDirect:



  • Are excited by and demonstrate a passion for the latest developments in web technology

  • Enjoy regularly coming up with clever, creative solutions to difficult problems

  • Have strong communication skills, and enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge with technical and non-technical colleagues across the globe

  • Show a strong ownership ethic

  • Display both flexibility and dedication to their work, colleagues and product

  • Show a genuine interest in learning about satellite communication
