jobs.title: Senior Software Developer

jobs.content:
Thumbtack is a local services marketplace that connects customers with the right professionals for anything they need done. Every day we rally around the impact Thumbtack has on people’s lives — helping brides plan their perfect wedding, families improve their homes, and small businesses grow and thrive. Thumbtack today has 1,100+ types of services, millions of customer requests, and hundreds of thousands of paying professionals. Join our growing team in the quest to build THE destination for anything you need done.


About the Engineering Team


At Thumbtack, our engineering team is building the future of hiring local professionals. We are focused on building a product that makes it easy to get things done. Along the way, we are solving quite a few not-so-easy problems, from building scheduling tools for our pros to scaling infrastructure to handle billions of invites.


About the Role


We are looking to build an amazing mobile experience for hundreds of thousands of users. Can you imagine what you might do if you could run your business from your phone? If you could hire a service provider at any time day or night with just a few taps? The sky's the limit. We develop much of our products mobile first and have seen this investment pay off incredibly. We’re looking for engineers excited to build a fantastic product.

jobs.content:
Thumbtack is a local services marketplace that connects customers with the right professionals for anything they need done. Every day we rally around the impact Thumbtack has on people’s lives — helping brides plan their perfect wedding, families improve their homes, and small businesses grow and thrive. Thumbtack today has 1,100+ types of services, millions of customer requests, and hundreds of thousands of paying professionals. Join our growing team in the quest to build THE destination for anything you need done.


Thumbtack’s engineering team is a diverse group of problems solvers always hungry for a good challenge. Whether on front end or back end, desktop or mobile, we’re handling some seriously comprehensive data, growing super fast, and building products used by thousands of customers and pros every day.


As a front­-end engineer at Thumbtack, your breadth of skills paired with our bottom-­up product process will give you as much autonomy and license as you can handle. If you can build it and it’s good for the company, do it! There's no limit to how valuable you can be or how much impact you can make here. We’re looking for people who want to make a mark on the world—who have the ambition to dream big and the talent to bring those dreams to fruition.
jobs.title: Front End Engineer

jobs.content:
Thumbtack is a local services marketplace that connects customers with the right professionals for anything they need done. Every day we rally around the impact Thumbtack has on people’s lives — helping brides plan their perfect wedding, families improve their homes, and small businesses grow and thrive. Thumbtack today has 1,100+ types of services, millions of customer requests, and hundreds of thousands of paying professionals. Join our growing team in the quest to build THE destination for anything you need done.


Our Site Reliability Engineers are a hybrid of software and systems engineers. We code our way out of operational problems and into chocolate chip cookies.


Our current mission is to design Thumbtack’s next version of the core infrastructure. We are responsible for reliability, scalability, and automation, while keeping an eye on latency, performance, and capacity.


Come help us build a scalable infrastructure to help millions of users get the right pro’s for all of life’s projects.


What we need your help with:



  • Automate the server provisioning process (we have 500 and growing) -- humans should not be involved.

  • Influence and create new designs and architectures for a growing number of distributed systems (multi regions, evaluating kubernetes)

  • Plan and execute configuration management (Puppet) and monitoring (DataDog) of our platform as it grows.

  • Design the system and processes that engineers use to deploy their software into production.

  • Design, write, and maintain software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Thumbtack's services, incorporating third-­party tools (ELK, pgbouncer, ZFS, HAproxy) when available and writing software of your own when nothing else fits the bill.

  • Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, anticipating performance bottlenecks and provisioning new hardware as necessary.

  • Run software performance analysis and system tuning.

  • Plan and execute DiRT.

  • Participate in rotating on-call duties.
jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer

jobs.content:
Job Responsibilities


Work with experts developing, iterating and testing robot algorithms, in one or more of these areas:



  • Robot motion planning and control

  • Visual modeling and perception

  • Language understanding

  • Grasp planning

  • Firmware programming for HW/SW systems

  • Other amazing robotics-based challenges!



About you


You are looking for the place to stretch yourself, able to work within a senior, highly performant product team, and aren’t afraid of a challenge.  You are a self-starter with the motivation and skills needed to effectively operate on your own time in your own way while being responsive to the needs of your teammates and the team as a whole.


You love working on the metal and/or deep in low-level or scaled algorithmic code.  You are effective at quickly understanding and operating on algorithms taken from research in AI, Robotics, and Vision, or you have have experience with sensors, motors, and other devices.  You are comfortable working alongside experts in these areas, or are an expert yourself. You have a proven track record of delivering ideas into working prototypes at high velocity.  You have commercial/agile development teaming experience.  You've architected some serious systems and may have even been a team lead.



Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work


These roles permit flexible working hours and are 100% remote.  You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. Whether you prefer contract work or a permanent position, we can accommodate you. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

jobs.content:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.


Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.


With "Share with Creatubbles", any company, organization or individual can very easily connect to and use Creatubbles™ to engage in meaningful (and creative!) ways.



  •        Main site: https://www.creatubbles.com

  •        Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com

  •        Partners: https://partners.creatubbles.com


About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 20 people, covering 12 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team in Tokyo.


Having recently raised a total of $10+MM from private and strategic corporate investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our team and to fund our global expansion.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.


We are now looking for a world class team lead to manage our mobile app engineering teams.


About our development Team and Technologies



  • Our development team is headed by an experienced CTO and has 3 senior iOS and 2 senior Android developers, in addition to 3 front-end developers, 4 full-stack developers and two test engineers.

  • We start the day with a Scrum call and organise our work in 2-weekly Sprints.

  • Github, CircleCI, Jenkins, Heroku and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.

  • ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.

  • Our team is small and flexible, and everyone participates in the decision-making process.

  • With our web apps we support desktop browsers, smartphone and tablet devices and keep pushing the boundaries of responsive web and CSS techniques. At the same time we are rolling out a range of native mobile apps with simplified and very robust navigation.

  • Our focus is building and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.

  • The back-end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.

  • Security is extremely important to us and we regularly work with experts to review our security strategy.


About you



  • You are excited by the potential of mobile technology to transform the lives of creative minds around the world

  • You eat, drink, speak and breathe iOS and Android, and are a guru in one or more object orientated languages (Objective C, Swift, Java, Kotlin, C#, ...)

  • You are extremely hands-on, technically excellent with solid engineering principles.

  • You are proficient in automated testing (jUnit, Appium, ...).

  • You have a strong eye for beautiful design and are passionate about smooth user experiences.

  • You have shipped a range of popular consumer focused apps (please include references in your cover letter).

  • You have experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc

  • You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.

  • You take full responsibility for the product - from early planning stages to deployment and maintenance.

  • You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).

  • You have a pro-active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-paced tech startup environment.

  • You exhibit strong leadership and people development skills and know what will make your engineers go the extra mile.

  • You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.

  • You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity


What we offer



  • A full time job opportunity, but part-time contractors are also welcomed.

  • We prefer remote work but relocation to Tokyo, Japan can also be arranged.

  • Super-flexible work schedule: we work across time zones and allow everyone to work when they are the most productive.

  • A very competitive salary and possibly stock options.
jobs.title: Lead Mobile Developer

jobs.content:
Hiring: Junior Front End Javascript Developer with React experience

Howdy! I'm Dave Stevens, Co-founder & CEO of Chartlytics. We're looking for a very passionate full-stack javascript developer to help us build the most powerful behavior measurement platform for accelerating learning outcomes across all of human learning the world has ever seen! Phew... 

Accelerating learning outcomes

Our mission is to help each learner reach their latent potential. With my business partner, Dr. Rick Kubina (Professor of Special Education at Penn State) we are transforming how teachers, analysts, coaches, and trainers understand the effects of their instruction on individuals so they can make more timely decisions to produce accelerated outcomes. 

Remote FTW!

We all work remotely, and so can you! We use slack, github, zoom, to communicate with each other regularly. We're fun, candid and focused on building good software and good solutions. We're bootstrapping the company so there are no VC's or angels to change our business model and force us down paths we'd rather not go. This has it's pros and cons but we're at least in control of our own destiny. If you're looking for free lunches, a built in spa and gym, and a bus to pick you up because you have no where to park your car - we're not for you. :) 

Got Skills?

Ideally you should have: 

  • Strong skills in modern Javascript (ES6/ES7) techniques. 
  • A deep understanding of React, and unidirectional dataflow architectures i.e. flux/redux. 
  • An appreciation of working with open source code.
  • Interest in implementing functional programming techniques. 
  • The ability to create a straightforward user interface 
  • Knowledge of designing schemas (currently using MongoDB, long term looking to switch to PostgreSQL). 
  • Familiarity with node.js for creating restful APIâs. 
  • A strong attention to detailâ¢ An appreciation for maintainability over cleverness 

Node all the things!

 Our stack: 

  • All on AWS 
  • Node.js & Koa 
  • React & Redux 
  • React-Native 
  • Mongo
  • Terraform

We are looking for passionate javascript developers. If you think this - http://demo.chartlytics-stage.com/ - is cool, checkout our blog and facebook to get an idea of who we are and what we exist for. If you like the mission, love the stack, and would like to be involved on the ground floor and meet the qualificaions above we'd love to have you on board. Email me at dave@chartlytics.com.

To apply: Please send samples of recent code along with your Github and LinkedIn profiles to dave@chartlytics.com. Recruiters & Agencies: please DO NOT contact us about this job. All hires at Chartlytics are made by our own team.
jobs.title: "We're gonna have to JavaScript the shit out of it..."

jobs.content:
Who: PHP Drupal Developer
What: maintaining Drupal 7 and Drupal 8 websites
Why: because we miss this skill
Where: center of Amsterdam
When: as soon as possible


We love innovators. ILUMY helps digital innovation organizations. We develop websites and apps for organizations like HEINEKEN, Willem & Drees, The Netherlands Institute for Human Rights, Erasmus MC, AMC, Accenture and the Telegraaf Media Group. In addition, we are launching our own platforms such as the Issue Manager, Plek social intranet and Zapaday. These different platforms are used by Ahold, KPN, Vodafone and Jumbo.


So who are we? What are we like? During the weekly Project Soup meetup we share results, questions and insights - and homemade soup! We also regularly go on the road together. Our team consists of 25 young people from many corners of the world. The language of instruction is mainly English. Our office can not be more central. The heart of Amsterdam, the Rokin.



Your challenge: to build and migrate great websites
ILUMY want to grow, also in Drupal projects. You can bring some of our biggest projects tot he next level, that is Drupal 8. You will be responsible for our websites in Drupal 7. We want to migrate some websites to Drupal 8, so there is your challenge! It`s your responsibility to make sure that websites of our clients work fast and that all the websites works well for users. To get the best result you will directly work together with designers. In short these are your tasks:



  • Maintenance of websites of our customers

  • Creating new Drupal 8 websites from scratch in the future

  • Migration of Drupal 7 websites to Drupal 8


What we have to offer you: Did we already tell you we`re established near Dam Square? But that's not the only reason why you want to work with us. You want to develop ILUMY to a powerful company together with our young, international team.


You will get the possibility to work on new innovative projects with modern technologies, and improve existing platforms towards their ultimate potential.


Additional benefits:



  • Competitive salary

  • We cover your travel expenses

  • Office in the center of Amsterdam

  • 10% of your working space to expand your knowledge

  • Speed when it comes to achieving plans or projects

  • No 9 to 5 mentality, we have flexible working hours

  • Trainingsbudget of €1500 euro to further develop yourself or to go to events and meetups

  • Free lunch with your colleagues

  • You get to work together with start-ups and global organisations

  • Fun and relaxed young team with Friday drinks, hackathons and great team adventures

This position is NOT full-time, but is a FREELANCE / Project based position.

Project Brief

We week a visual note taker who is highly skilled in taking complex stories around complex services and products and communicating them in visual sketch form.  This style of communication will be used to build a series of story boards that will be used to communicate complex ideas and services into a more powerful, visual picture.

Ideal Candidate

jobs.content:
We have positions available for enthusiastic Linux experts for the development of our Linux-based cluster management environment. You will be part of a team responsible for the development of our Linux based cluster management software.


You will be responsible for preparing our software stack for new Linux distributions and new CPU architectures; testing, packaging and maintaining third party software components;  managing software updates; keep track of the latest Linux distribution updates; developing integration between our software and third party hardware (e.g. GPUs, high speed interconnects, FPGAs) and software (e.g. Lustre, Kubernetes, Ceph, Puppet, OpenStack); and further developing our build infrastructure. Furthermore, you will also take part in the development of several Python based tools and applications.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and to take initiative. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest hardware (e.g. GPUs, Xeon Phi and high-speed interconnects such as InfiniBand, Omni Path and 40 Gig-E) and software technologies such as parallel filesystems (e.g. Lustre, GPFS, BeeGFS), Hadoop, Spark, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, Open vSwitch and Ceph.


Our development team consists of highly skilled developers that are passionate about building a  software product that meets our customers' needs today and in the future. With your help, we will be adding many new features to our product to allow Bright clusters to be used for a wider range of workloads, and to allow clusters to scale to hundreds of thousands of nodes (i.e. exascale). We will also target new CPU architectures such as ARM64 and Power8/9, and further integrate container technology into the product to allow workloads to scale up and down easily on-premise, and to public clouds.
jobs.title: Linux Software developer

Hays IT is working in partnership with the University of Leicester to recruit a dynamic developer to join their team on a temporary basis with immediate effect.


The University require a Sitecore developer to work with their marketing and communications team to deliver the next phase of the Sitecore CMS/Marketing development, upgrading from version 7.1 to 8.


The team has a high performing culture and is based at a University that is ranked within the top 2% of Universities worldwide and has a 5 star rating.


In order to apply for the role you must have knowledge and experience in the following areas:


Essential



  • Educated to degree level preferably in an IT related discipline or with equivalent additional experience

  • Substantial software development experience gained in a complex IT organisation

  • Experienced programmer with extensive technical skills

  • Sitecore Certified Developer

  • Microsoft MTA Developer Certifications (or the ability to evidence equivalent experience)

Effective team working is a key requirement of the role. The post holder must be able to manage their own time and workload with minimal supervision.

The Mission: Safe Food for Everyone!



Sample6 is making food safer by delivering two powerful tools to the food industry, Sample6 DETECTÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ and Sample6 CONTROLÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢. Sample6 DETECTÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ is an enrichment-free, on-site, in-shift pathogen diagnostic. This transformative detection technology is paired with a powerful software suite called CONTROLÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢. Together the two enable our customers to evolve their food safety practices from reactive to preventive!



After a recent $12.5m round of funding, Sample6 is well positioned to provide this necessary next-generation of products and services to food processors regardless of segment. Meat, seafood, dairy, produce, and dry goods processors have already partnered with Sample6 in order to integrate these revolutionary products into their plants. Join us in the drive to protect the public by making food safer!



Position:  Software Architect/Team Lead



We are looking for a talented, highly motivated person to lead the development of our CONTROL software application. You will report to our CEO and work in concert with our VP of Software & Customer Success to deliver a transformative product that owns the market. You will be a part of Sample6's management team, working closely with the company's senior executives..



Position details:



The Software Architect will be a champion for the introduction of health and safety data management into food production. He/she will take a hands-on approach and will be responsible for:




  • Leading an agile SW development environment that facilitates innovative software delivery while actively participating in sprint planning, backlog prioritization, daily stand-ups

  • Driving the SW architecture to deliver a solution that is robust and scalable, and agile enough to handle a growing list of feature/functionality requests

  • Guiding the design of user interfaces that are intuitive, easy to use and mindful of the target end-user's expectation

  • Managing the current CONTROL development team which today is an off-shore team of developers/QA

  • Building a team in-house that is well balanced to meet both SW creation and support requirements

  • Working with Sales/Customer Success to map market requirements/competitive considerations to solution designs that strike the right balance between cutting-edge technical excellence, robustness and time-to-market requirements

  • Demonstrating proficiency in tracking projects, keeping them on schedule and meeting all product release requirements/deadlines



SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS:




  • B.S degree in a technical discipline (preferably computer science) or equivalent experience

  • 5-10 yrs. years' software development experience, with technical development management experience

  • Ability to code 50%+ of the time.  (Groovy, Grails, Java, Javascript/Coffeescript frameworks a plus)

  • Expertise in agile software development

  • ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂªProven ability in delivering on-time SW products of high quality

  • Take ownership of the codebase/product technologies and make it yours

  • Experience working with mobile devices and other hardware devices a plus.

  • Excellent Communication and customer-facing skills



Benefits



The people we hire form the company we become and determine the goals we can accomplish. We hire GREAT PEOPLE who are smart, ambitious, hardworking and dedicated.



In addition to providing a comfortable work environment, we offer an array of benefits which include but are not limited to the following: competitive salaries, a 401K plan, generous vacation time, equity for qualified hires, parking and commuter benefits and, most of all, an outstanding opportunity to develop your career.

jobs.content:
Cake Solutions is looking for a DevOps Engineer with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.


The role will involve creating and maintaining Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure automated and repeatable development processes.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud-focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.  Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research, innovate, and to publish thought-leading insights.


Reporting: This role reports to the Lead DevOps Engineer, Core DevOps Team.
Location: Cake Solutions Global HQ - Houldsworth Mill


Role Overview:
A DevOps Engineer in the Core DevOps team is responsible for implementing, and driving best practices for enterprise deployments and software development lifecycle automation. This includes providing solutions that are robust, scalable, and highly available. Ideally, the candidate has previous exposure or experience with distributed system design, which includes cloud-capable systems and deployments.
jobs.title: DevOps Engineer

jobs.content:
The Organic Academy helps people learn to grow organic food. Growers join our friendly online community and build their skills with courses that take them by the hand through the gardening year.

Is this you?

  • Experienced organic grower
  • Love writing
  • Divide your time between being in the garden and online where you contribute to gardening blogs and forums

We'd like help with:

  • Writing courses about organic growing
  • Writing blog posts about organic growing
  • Helping growers on our community forum
  • Being active on social media

Things you should probably have:

  • A garden or allotment where you grow some organic fruit and veg
  • A quiet place with good internet access and a computer where you can work for several hours a day
  • An active blog or website about gardening or an active presence on a forum, online community or social media
  • Confidence at communicating with people online using forums, email and chat (e.g. Slack)
  • Excellent written English skills
  • Ability to type reasonably quickly (at least 30wpm in a test like this: http://www.ratatype.com/typing-test/)
  • Experience taking photos and uploading to the web
  • Definitely not necessary, but bonus points if you have experience making videos

Initially we will contract you for three months from the beginning of January 2017. We're looking for a commitment of about 20-30 hours per week spread over four or five days. Salary dependent on experience.

If we work well together, we'd love to make this a long-term position. You will be a core member of the team at an early stage of the company. The ideal person will be excited about what we're creating. You'll be able to contribute ideas and be involved in decision making about the future of the business.

Location

You can be located anywhere in the Northern Hemisphere. We would prefer someone living in a region with climatic conditions similar to the UK, or US climate zones 5 to 7.

To apply: Send an email to jobs@theorganicacademy.com and include:(1) A summary of your organic growing experience (2) Links to your writing online (can be a blog, website, forum posts etc) (3) In no more than 150 words tell us about a gardening experience that inspired you
jobs.title: Content Writer and Community Champion

jobs.content:
Your new company 
RepKnight is an award-winning software development company that provides real-time cyber intelligence to keep people, companies and assets safe from internal and external threats. It now seeks a User Experience Designer with demonstrable experience in designing and building web applications. You will manage design projects from start to finish, turning ideas into beautiful conceptual designs and finally into real life functioning modules. This is an excellent opportunity to work with an innovative forward thinking company. If you like a relaxed informal environment and are passionate about what you do, then this is the ideal job for you. 


Competitive Salary

Your new role 
As a User Experience Designer in this job you will be required to work closely with the rest of the team, turning ideas into beautiful conceptual designs and finally into real life functioning modules for my clients web application. You must have at least 3 years’ experience in application design and show experience in managing design projects from start to finish.The role requires the candidate to show a flair in design 

What you'll need to succeed 
We’re asking for mid-level. For this I would expect the candidate to show and talk through a portfolio (even small) of work that they have compiled in designing and building web applications using front-end frameworks such as Twitter Bootstrap. I think experience in Design and Building web apps is the key ask.” 

What you'll get in return 
This is an opportunity to work with an innovative forward thinking company operating in a fast paced environment.   

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
jobs.title: User Experience Designer

jobs.content:
Your new company 
RepKnight is an award-winning software development company that provides real-time cyber intelligence to keep people, companies and assets safe from internal and external threats. It now seeks a highly experienced Java software developer passionate about web applications and code to join its team


Competitive Salary

Your new role 
Would you describe yourself as a talented Software Engineer to join the team.  If you have 5+ years experience in software development, are passionate about applications and love to code, then please get in touch.

What you'll need to succeed 
The role requires the candidate to have 4+ years experience in Java Web Development.  They would like if you could demonstrate experience in some or all of the following XML, JSON, REST etc, Spring & Hibernate.  Experience working with Linux operating systems and knowledge of one or more Big Data products such as Elastic Search, Cassandra, Hadoop, MongoDB is desirable.

What you'll get in return 
This role offers a competitive salary and benefits package combined with a flexible working environment and exposure to up to date technologies.  

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
jobs.title: Java Software Developer

jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Our company is growing! We're looking for an awesome full-stack senior developer to work on PayrollPanda - Malaysia's fastest growing cloud Payroll app. It's an exciting time to join a proven group of entrepreneurs and developers. Get a share in a start-up and awesome benefits.

REQUIREMENTS

  1. At least 5 years of commercial development experience or you're some kind of genius coder straight out of university.
  2. Extensive experience with web development technologies including Javascript frameworks (preferably Backbone), NodeJS, MongoDB,
  3. Agile (Kanban) software development

BENEFITS

  1. REMOTE working - literally work anywhere in the world but our only requirement is that you work at least 6 daily hours within Malaysia working times, 9am to 6pm and have fast Internet access. If you live further west of Eastern Europe or West of Australia it probably won't be suitable for you.
  2. Work only 35 working hours. Many of us have burnt out before and we want to prevent it happening again to any of our team.
  3. Competitive salary, bonuses and EQUITY. Work with us not for us!

To apply: Send your resume to recruitment@launchpadstartups.com with Senior Web Developer (Remote) in the headline.
jobs.title: Senior Web Developer (Remote)

jobs.content:
As Splash Damage’s Senior UI Programmer, you will use your passion for games and your outstanding programming skills to create memorable user interfaces for our current and future games.


Capable of great autonomy and reporting to the Lead UI Programmer, you will work with Splash Damage’s UI and Gameplay teams to plan, build, and maintain the front-end and in-game user interfaces for our games. You will apply your expertise in UI middleware as well as your programming skills to create user-friendly interface code and assets with a focus on performance.


As a senior member of the programming team, you will also help define and champion development methodologies, contribute to technology roadmaps for your field of expertise, and participate in staff development by sharing your knowledge.
jobs.title: Senior UI Programmer

jobs.content:
If you're looking to get your claws in to next gen AAA development then your hunt is over


It's a real exciting time for us here at Splash Damage, we are about to engage in a very well known and highly popular AAA title with next gen technology and we're looking to recruit multiple disciplines to fill our ranks.


As a Splash Damage Core Tech Programmer, you will be responsible for implementing and refining the core engine systems for our cross platform games. Reporting to the Lead Core Tech Programmer, you will work with Splash Damage’s Programming Team on building and maintaining core engine features that encompasses rendering, animation and low level system programming. With a constant focus on scalability, performance and memory usage, you will apply your expertise in data structures and algorithms for modern, multi-core architectures to build state-of-the-art technology for a variety of platforms including PC, mobiles and current & next-generation of consoles.
jobs.title: Core Tech Programmer

jobs.content:
As a Senior PHP Developer in Sam Media, you get a chance to work in what is probably one of the best development teams you've ever been part of.


We don't make statements like this lightly!


Over the years (it takes time to build up a crack team!), feedback from our developers and sysadmins started to indicate that the quality of the people they work with was the main reason for them to join and, more importantly, to stay in our company.


Other feedback we often receive is that people really like our location (Kuala Lumpur) because it is ideal to explore and experience the South East Asia and the Pacific regions.


Of course it also doesn't hurt that we offer a very competitive package which includes quarterly and yearly performance bonuses, medical insurance, tax relief assistance, interest free loans and relocation assistance to name but a few.


Why this ad?


Our business has seen significant growth over the last 10 years and the amount of data we generate has been growing even harder.


To deal with all this, we have three scrum teams taking on an ever growing product backlog, packed to the rafters with projects that are beyond cool (and admittedly, also a few on the other side of the bell curve!)


Besides that, our in-house incubator, which we set up a little over a year ago, is also starting to produce some very interesting and promising results that require more and more IT resources.


To support all this, we are looking to expand our development team with one or more top-notch developers who have the ability to consistently perform on the highest level.
jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer

jobs.content:
Inside.com is a network of email newsletters. We publish high quality roundups that curate, summarize, and analyze all of the most important news in many different verticals and industries. Some examples are cybersecurity, electric vehicles, virtual and augmented reality, artificial intelligence, drones, and more.

Over the past 10 months, we doubled our entire subscriber-base. Then we doubled it again. Then we doubled it a third time. And weâre just getting started. We also track net promoter scores and all of our newsletters score between 66 and 89 â which is right on par with world-renowned products like the iPhone and the Tesla Model S.

Our editorial team is masterful when it comes to creating a âpresidential briefingâ style update in any of these areas, but we also want to bring in voices of industry leaders to level up the content of the newsletters. This program is loosely modeled off the LinkedIn Influencer program, which you can read more about here.

Weâre looking for someone to help create and grow this influencer program. The role consists of a few things:

  • Developing lists of the most influential people in all of our current and upcoming verticals
  • Identifying the best ways to contact and build relationships with these people
  • Applying a Lean Startup methodology to your outreach efforts
  • Building and maintaining relationships with our network of influencers
  • Identifying key topics, events, and issues for influencers to offer input on
  • Communicating actively with our editorial team to get this influencer content into our newsletters

Here are some key requirements:

  • Hustle. You need to be able to track down busy, influential people and get them to talk to you. This requires creative communication, research, persistence, and hustle.
  • Persistence. We mentioned this above, but it bears reiteration. You might need to email someone 6 times before you catch their attention. We need someone willing to push hard.
  • Communication. This is a growth position, not an editorial position, but we are an editorial-driven company and everybody needs to be able to write and communicate well.
  • Curiosity. To excel in this role, you need to be able to build a deep understanding of each of the verticals we publish in. That means knowing the events, companies, products, and most importantly, people, in each of these verticals and having your finger to the pulse of any changes or developments.

This is a contract position for 30-40 hours per week, and pay is $20/hr.

To apply: Fill out this form to apply: https://insidedailybrief.typeform.com/to/F8sxNP
jobs.title: Community and content development manager

jobs.content:
You will be buying and selling parcels of land on our behalf. Extensive training will be given. Excellent opportunity with potentially high commissions, including residuals.

We are looking for people who believe they can be very successful and are ready to make it happen. We are only hiring a few people and then this opportunity will be closed.
  
Duties include:

  • Creating & implementing systems for discovering, doing due diligence, and marketing parcels of land.
  • Maintaining and improving those systems
  • Responding to buyer and seller inquiries
  • Talking to prospective buyers on phone and closing the sale 
  • Completing due diligence procedures on prospective parcels 
  • Managing the advertising efforts to promote the buying and selling of parcels
  • Friendly and confident telephone skills
  • Entrepreneurial mindset
  • Responsive and communicative - we place a great value on your ability to communicate with us.

This is a telecommuting job. We are looking for a hard worker who possesses exceptional organizational skills as well as the ability to communicate well with buyers. You will need project management skills and the ability to use time wisely in order to get a lot done each day.

You will be given training and procedures to follow in order to successfully do the job.

Hourly pay plus commission.

References will be asked for.

To be considered for this position please complete the following assessments on Wonscore. Thank you for completing this assessment as it helps us to make sure we are both a good fit. We are putting a lot of effort into hiring an exceptional candidate as we are offering extensive training and you can expect to make great money.

Applicants will only be considered upon completion of this quick test.

The link for completing Wonscore is (copy and paste into browser) https://hiring.wonderlic.com/openings/570822d60c1edc0100cc5f85/apply

To apply: Send a resume to helpingyousucceedllc@gmail.com and complete the Wonscore assessment as detailed in the job listing.
jobs.title: Buying and selling land (hourly+comm) project management, sales

jobs.content:
Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world through the power of software!


We are looking for front-end wizard's to help Synchrony's development team. Synchrony is the engine behind Confluence's co-editing feature. As a Front-End Developer, you’ll be directly impacting the customer experience through the implementation of new features and functionalities into our products. 


You’ll typically work as part of a fast moving and product-focused team delivering features with focus on user experience. You’ll never be bored and you'll always be challenged (And you are probably the type that likes it this way).


Atlassian is able to provide relocation assistance and sponsorship to work in Sydney for this role.



More about you:


 On your first day, we'll expect you to have:



  • Specialization in Javascript, HTML5, CSS, and jQuery

  • Experience with JS Frameworks i.e ReactJS

  • Deep understanding of front-end architecture and data-driven development

  • Ability to work with designers to develop dynamic user experiences

  • Interest in Agile methodology and open-source technology



More about our team  


We are always growing, learning, and adapting, in and out of the office. You’ll be joining a team that is highly engaged and direct. We help each other to constantly improve our work and help each other reach our potential. We’re dedicated to being agile, which means we’re constantly learning about our users’ experience and iterating as much as necessary to improve it. We also know all too well the importance of validating assumptions about users and use various types of testing to ensure we're right (or discover where we're wrong). It’s all about improving our user’s experience—no matter who or where it is.


Some Developer roles at Atlassian require international travel 1-4 times per year. Your recruiter will discuss whether this is a requirement for during your initial conversation with us.  


To learn more about working with the Engineering Team at Atlassian, check out our Engineering Team page!


Atlassian. Powered by You.


We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
jobs.title: Senior Javascript Developer

jobs.content:
This position can be in-office in NYC orremote work-from-home. Remote U.S. candidates are encouraged to apply.
AdThrive.com helps bloggers make more moneywith the ads on their site. This means helping them figure out which networksto use, how to set them, and then actually doing that for them. People who havea passion for something (cooking, decorating, parenting) get to write abouttheir passion and be paid to live their dream. We help moms leave theirfull-time jobs and stay home with their kids. We help struggling families paytheir bills and find hope. We support the people who are creating the internet!
 

As a Support & Customer Success Manager,youâre passionate about helping people. It shapes your worldview. Perhapsyouâre already active in helping people online through the WordPress.com orWordPress.org forums, or another venue like StackOverflow. The thought ofhelping families earn enough money for one parent to stay home or to covertheir mortgage gives you goosebumps.

Day in the Life
  • Crafting thoughtful, personal responses to client questions in our support system (Zendesk)
  • Troubleshooting and fixing problems on client websites (mostly WordPress)
  • Analyzing ad layouts and earnings
  • Making recommendations for improvements in ad layouts
  • Onboarding new clients by installing ads on their sites
  • Being an active member of a distributed team via tools like Slack and Google Hangouts

Youâll do well if you have:
  • Patience,grace, and a sense of humor
  • Excellentwriting and communication skills
  • Workingknowledge of WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
  • Aknack for taking technical language and making it understandable
  • Apassion for solving tough problems and proposing elegant solutions
  • Adesire to make everything you touch better

Qualifications
  • 2+years of backend WordPress experience using the following languages: PHP, HTML,CSS, and JavaScript
  • Experienceediting custom WordPress themes and plugins
  • Experiencewith common plugins such as W3 Total Cache and WooCommerce
  • Strongunderstanding of Google Analytics
  • StrongWritten Communication (web-based copy, preferred)
  • Mustsuccessfully complete appropriate FireSeeds Selection Process
  • Commitmentto clientâs Mission Statement
 
There is limitless opportunity here for theperson who makes themselves valuable. We're new and growing fast, so strongleaders and strong performers will have teams placed under them and increasingresponsibility.
 

A competitive base salary will be offered. Inaddition, we offer health/dental/vision benefits, 401k, life insurance,paid/vacation/sick/personal time, and many perks.
 

To apply: Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter with salary requirements to hr@cafemedia.com. The subject line of your email should read âWordPress Support & Customer Success Managerâ.We regret that we are unable to respond to each resume. Only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. CafeMedia is an equal opportunity employer.
jobs.title: WordPress Support & Customer Success Manager

As an Android developer at Dropsource, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of Android plugins on the Dropsource Platform.  Your primary responsibility will be creating and maintaining reusable Android components for users to use while building their app on Dropsource.


Responsibilities



  1. Enforce and guide Android best practices within Dropsource

  2. Develop Android plugins on the Dropsource Platform

  3. Debug and fix issues in user-built Dropsource apps

  4. Stay up to date with the Android ecosystem


Note this is a Contract position that we anticipate lasting at least 6 months, but with the option to renew and continue beyond that.


We estimate the work load to be between 20-30hrs per week.


Salary expectations for this position are somewhere between $40-$70 USD per hour, depending on experience level and skill.  


Please send us your current resume and please be sure to highlight completed work on Android apps, share a GitHub account, etc. Be sure to show off your past and current Android work!

jobs.content: John Hancock Digital is hiring an UX Researcher & Designer in San Francisco
jobs.title: UX Researcher & Designer

jobs.content:
about imgur:

Imgur was founded in 2009 as a simple image hosting platform and over the past seven years has evolved into the world’s largest image sharing community. We have grown from having 46,000 page views per month in February 2009 to over seven billion page views per month in February 2016 (with 900 billion images viewed in 2015 alone). We are now a top-15 visited site in the United States and our opportunity for future growth is massive. As we continue to expand internally and externally, we are looking to add a talented backend engineer to our smart, fun, and quirky culture to help us achieve our goals for growth and scalability.

imgur is positivity at scale.

Our vision is to lift the world’s spirits for a few moments every day. We accomplish this by surfacing the world’s most entertaining content. With every submission having the potential to go viral, our highly-engaged community is integrally important to our product and we want to ensure we continually delight and surprise our users.

about you:

You are a senior+-level software engineer who thrives on building highly-scalable backend solutions. You enjoy working with a small and Agile team that is tasked with developing core features and functions while also focusing on stability and performance issues. You are comfortable building things from scratch and working in the core engineering team. You will be responsible from prototyping to owning the whole product lifecycle. Most importantly - you’re excited about working on a product that our highly-engaged community loves and deploying code to our 175M monthly active users.

responsibilities:

  • Help us evolve our platform to its next incarnation
  • Write systems in PHP5, Golang, and/or node.js (previous knowledge not necessary, but willingness to learn is)
  • Work with and become an expert in datastores such as MySQL, DynamoDB, HBase, etc.
  • Be part of a team that wants to work on all aspects of the mobile web technology.
  • Own the Tests, CI tools, Chef recipes, StatsD monitoring, logging, and alerting for your software.

what you bring to the table:

  • BS (or higher) in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
  • 6+ years of professional experience with backend technologies
  • Critical thinkers who present logical arguments to defend their solutions
  • Experience in PHP, Go, and/or Node.js is helpful but experience in Java or C/C++ is of course welcome
  • The ability to comfortably program in a Unix environment and knowledge of Unix commands
  • A passion for beautiful, pragmatic code paired with a strong sense of product design
  • Experience with distributed systems a huge plus!

benefits:

  • Competitive salary, fully covered medical/dental/vision
  • 401k matching
  • 25 days of PTO per year
  • Gym stipend
  • Passion fund - $500 a year towards your favorite passion or something you’ve always wanted to try
  • Commuter/parking benefits
  • Opportunity to work on the world’s largest image sharing community!

Above all: As we grow, so will you. Interested? Click apply and let’s begin the journey together. Note: if you don't meet these requirements we are still open to hearing from you.
jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer

jobs.content:
BackOffice Associates, LLC is a worldwide leader in information governance and data migration solutions, focusing on helping customers manage one of their most critical assets – data. Our company’s range of products, built on a revolutionary platform, address the needs of business users seeking to unlock the value of their data assets. BackOffice Associates’ products and services enable organizations to accelerate growth, gain actionable visibility and reduce risks. Founded in 1996, BackOffice Associates has an unparalleled record of success in the most complex data environments across a variety of industries. Customers include many Fortune 1000 companies including Eli Lilly, Kraft and Dow Chemical. BackOffice Associates is a global corporation headquartered in Massachusetts with additional offices in the U.S., Australia, Europe and Asia. We are looking for energetic, self-directed, committed and goal- oriented individuals with the desire to join a world-class organization.

Position Summary

The Software Developer is responsible for helping, design, develop, and maintain BackOffice’s products. We use a myriad of technologies and have both on-prem Enterprise and cloud native software.

As a Software Developer on our team, you will be joining a group of developers working to grow the information governance product space, building out applications on Amazon Web Services platform. Our base development stack consists of backend API’s implemented via Lambda, running against DynamoDB. In front of that exists our AngularJS application that employs Foundation for Apps as a responsive front-end framework. This is our stack today, and we are continuously evaluating options for improvement.

A successful candidate will be joining the team with members across North America, and as such, the ability to work remotely and with remote colleagues is of the utmost importance. The candidate will work closely with developers, product owners, DevOps staff, and many other colleagues. This role’s responsibility will be developing software products not just through slinging code, but developing prototypes, reaching consensus, and keeping the user flow in mind.

This position is looking for someone close to full stack development, a DevOps + Quality driven mindset, and itching to grow, learn, and expand while developing cutting-edge, market-leading applications. You will have opportunities to explore the broader scope of cloud based application development, database design and deployment in the Amazon Web Services environment. We are expanding our AWS and cloud footprint every day, and are always on the lookout for improving not just what we do, but how we do it.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Experience in software engineering, DevOps, and cloud environments
  • Believes in continuous delivery and full integration of the lifecycle: Dev, Ops, Quality
  • Embraces a “remote-first” model even if you are at an office
  • Is agile not Agile™, no ties to a prescribed process here, we keep it lean and adapt continuously
  • Help us innovate and continue our mission of building a great team building great products

Qualifications:

  • BS/MS in Comp Sci/Math/EE or related discipline or equivalent experience
  • .NET with SQL Server or Java with some RDBMS
  • Functional and Object Oriented experience, a plus
  • Understanding of development principles for intuitive, useful user interfaces
  • Jenkins and git/GitHub experience, a plus; some VCS experience required
  • Ability to work as part of a highly distributed team
  • Great communication skills via Slack and Google Hangouts is a must

Technology That We Currently Use

  • AWS, Lambda,, Dynamo, Git, GitHub, Gulp, NodeJS, Python, JVM (Java, Scala), CloudFormation, ElasticSearch, Linux, Jenkins, AngularJS, CSS (SCSS), .NET (C#), Foundation for Apps, SQL Server, Artifactory, Windows Server

jobs.content:
BackOffice Associates, LLC is a worldwide leader in information governance and data migration solutions, focusing on helping customers manage one of their most critical assets â data. Our companyâs range of products, built on a revolutionary platform, address the needs of business users seeking to unlock the value of their data assets. BackOffice Associatesâ products and services enable organizations to accelerate growth, gain actionable visibility and reduce risks. Founded in 1996, BackOffice Associates has an unparalleled record of success in the most complex data environments across a variety of industries. Customers include many Fortune 1000 companies including Eli Lilly, Kraft and Dow Chemical. BackOffice Associates is a global corporation headquartered in Massachusetts with additional offices in the U.S., Australia, Europe and Asia. We are looking for energetic, self-directed, committed and goal- oriented individuals with the desire to join a world-class organization.

__Position Summary__

The Cloud Operations â Production Operations Engineer will be responsible for supporting highly reliable, high performing and secure operations for n-tier SaaS applications, comprising both UI and data integration components and for provisioning and administering the R&D AWS environment. The person in this position will work closely with the Cloud Development team maintaining a âDevOpsâ culture. This position reports through R&D IT leadership, but will be a key contributor to Cloud Development and Product Support teams.

__Primary Responsibilities:__

* Uphold established SaaS security and performance standards to ensure compliance with Service Level Agreements as specified in customer contracts
* Assist in implementation and maintenance of a highly secure and high performing cloud based infrastructure, including the following:
 * Create and manage cloud tenants
 * Apply new builds to cloud environments
 * Monitor system health and establish appropriate alerting thresholds and response procedures
* Provision, administer and maintain cloud hosted (currently AWS) systems for the R&D group
* Build Subject Matter Expertise in cloud security, privacy and information management
* Provide hands on testing, tuning and technical support
* On a rotating basis, provide after hours, on-call incident support
* Continuously improve operations processes, including incident, problem, change management and disaster recovery processes

__Qualifications:__

* Bachelorâs Degree in relevant field
* At least 1 year of experience working with a high volume customer facing SaaS application or in a DevOps environment
* Understanding of / experience with at least 4 of the following disciplines:
 * SaaS Application architecture
 * Serverless (Lambda, API Gateway) AWS technologies
 * Build/deployment/delivery processes
 * System provisioning, automation and configuration management tools
 * AWS EC2 or similar instance provision and administration
 * Familiarity with cloud monitoring principles and tools
 * Security, performance and data privacy for a multitier cloud based application
* Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing
* Strong team player capable of providing support across the organization
* Willing/able to provide after hours, on-call and escalation, including system outages and incident response
 
BackOffice Associates, LLC offers a generous benefits package that includes medical, 401k, long term disability, life insurance and a paid time off program.
jobs.title: Cloud Operations Production Operations Engineer

jobs.content:
We're looking for a full-time full stack developer to help build and maintain our social media management tool, Edgar. Edgar launched in mid-2014 and has thousands of happy, beautiful, paying customers that will use the features you build every day. Weâre growing ~20% month on month. (No pressure, right?)
Youâll be working on big, exciting projects like optimizing our queuing system, building out React components, adding support for social media platform-specific features like native video, and getting our onboarding juuuust right so that every user has a mind-blowing experience from their very first login.

Youâll be joining a small team of talented full-stack developers, and working alongside dedicated UX designers, QA and Customer Experience pros.

Our stack is Rails 4, Ruby 2.2, Heroku, Postgres, S3, Sidekiq + Redis with Webpack, React and Redux on the front-end. Itâs great stack to work with everyday, and we take our time to write solid code and proper tests to make sure it stays that way.

Our Dev Process

We do a fair amount of pair programming and a lot of code reviews, we love solid tests and CI, and we deploy several times a week. Basically? Weâre constantly improving our process so we can create an ideal developer environment - low overheads, high transparency. Estimates were inaccurate and irrelevant, so we dropped âem. Artificial deadlines werenât doing it for us, so we switched from scrum to pure kanban and never looked back. When something isnât working, weâre not afraid to throw it out and try something new - so if you have exciting ideas about the dev process and how to make your own job even better, youâll fit right in. (Weâre open-minded like that.)
Youâll have final responsibility for features you build, from inception all the way through to deployment, so your teammates know exactly who to shower with praise.

Requirements

  • You have experience creating software products that solve real user challenges
  • Youâve got real professional history with React, and Redux â Webpack & ES6 are big plusses
  • Live anywhere in the USA or Canada (need to be able to provide documentation of eligibility to work in the USA)
  • You love Rails and React
  • You know how to communicate effectively and work as part of a team with lots of different backgrounds and roles
  • Passionate about improving the development process and recognize the value of an awesome company culture
  • Not a jerk

About Us

Weâre a small team of about 25 people, all working remotely across the US & Canada. We do a lot of collaborating and meme-swapping on Slack, along with virtual team meetings and super-futuristic video calls. We also do a twice-annual meetup week where we work together on cool projects all day and generally make fools of ourselves all night. Weâre proudly bootstrapped and profitable, which means we get to turn down VC money a lot and keep doing things the way we like. Weâre pretty serious about building and maintaining an awesome, positive company culture, so, you know, no jerks.

We'll probably get along if youâre someone who wants to be creative, have a pretty-serious-but-not-inhuman amount of responsibility, and work with people who make going to work not suck. (And be one of those people yourself. We like those people.)

You can find out more at http://meetedgar.com/careers/ and by watching this video (we paid a lot for this thing): https://youtu.be/XvU3P43b0rQ

Perks & Benefits

  • Work from home (or wherever thereâs strong wifi)
  • 4 weeks paid vacation (Shazam! And yes, everyone actually uses all 4 weeks)
  • Monthly cleaning service for your home - not that we don't have total faith in you
  • Paid home Internet service
  • Coworking space/coffee shop working expenses
  • Health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your fam
  • 401(k) plan with employer match
  • Up to two months family leave for new parents (including adoption)
  • An extra paid day off per quarter so you can volunteer in your community (awww)
  • New Mac laptop (#blessed)
  • Books, conferences, and other educational resources to help you be even more amazing at what you do!
  • TSA pre-check to make getting to retreats and conferences a breeze

Check âem out in even more detail here (you know youâre curious):
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1txOs5h-ZjbOqMW-GxmJcKnCClKK3yVqOWO0hhHBAbT0/edit

Want to know more about our company culture? We've got a video for that, too: https://youtu.be/nFMEp6D7M74

To apply: https://docs.google.com/a/meetedgar.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf7MiLnszPFWFBEfeYRnachhnB0zM9XnWBb_6vekx8_r-EyCQ/viewform
jobs.title: Experienced Full Stack Developer (Rails/React)

jobs.content:
Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The SitecoreÂ® Experience Platformâ¢ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, and automates communications, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time. More than 4,600 customersâincluding American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L'OrÃ©alâtrust Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.

__Key responsibilities:__

* Collaborates with and coaches subject matter experts to determine course objectives, outlines, and appropriate assessments
* Designs and develops technical Instructor-Led modules, slides, Student and Instructor Manuals, and evaluations according to industry standards
* Works with eLearning Manager to develop technical eLearning courses
* Manages the course development lifecycle at the project level
* Demonstrates continuous commitment to learning more about Sitecoreâs products
* Strives to learn as much about our students and our studentsâ needs as possible
* Provides technical enablement and support to the internal Sitecore training community
* Passionate about contributing to an agile, fast-paced team and growing company

__Required Experience:__

* Bachelorâs degree minimum, preferably in Computer Science or a related discipline
* 3+ years of experience implementing content management systems (preferably Sitecore)
* 2+ years developing in a .NET environment with C#, MVC and JSON based APIs
* Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and front-end development frameworks (Bootstrap, jQuery and React)
* Experience managing a development project end-to-end
* Strong technical writing and verbal communication skills
* Experience delivering technical training, in either a formal or informal environment
* Experience developing attractive, professional, brand-compliant course materials
* Experience developing student labs, exercises, demos and sandboxes
* Basic network administration knowledge
* Experience working with databases and data modeling
* Ability to identify architecturally significant requirements

__Preferred Experience:__

* Implementation experience with ASP.NET Core
* Formal Instructional Design Education and Experience designing and developing ILT and WBT for Software/Hardware Developers
* Strong knowledge of Graphic/Web Design Principles and the ability to create custom images/icons, web and print layouts and e-learning templates

___This position will be either remote, based out of a Sitecore office, or some combination.___

_Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and is an affirmative action employer.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected basis._

jobs.content:
Do you want to work on projects thatâre viewed over 100 million times every day?

We are on a mission to help businesses grow. With our tools, weâre changing the way businesses do marketing, lead generation, and conversion rate optimization online.

No, weâre not a VC-backed startup. We are a profitable bootstrapped company that is growing exponentially.
Weâre looking for amazing people to join our rapidly growing team. We are only looking to fill full-time positions (no part-time, no contractors please).

As a Technical Support Specialist, youâre responsible for guiding people to the fullest use of our products. You will build relationships based on trust which result in happy, passionate, and loyal customers through listening to their needs.

## REQUIRED SKILLS:

- Excellent writing and communication skills.
- Patience, grace, and a sense of humor.
- Working knowledge of WordPress, HTML, and CSS.
- Working knowledge of PHP and JavaScript is a bonus, but not required.
- Ability to take technical lingo and make it understandable.
- Experience working with email marketing service providers (ex. MailChimp and AWeber) or CRMâs (ex. Salesforce).
- Exceptional troubleshooting abilities.
- Must be comfortable with customer-facing roles including support and documentation.

### To love this role, hereâs the type of person you are:

- Youâre passionate about solving problems and helping people.
- Youâre incredibly positive and enjoy making another personâs day.
- Youâre an excellent communicator who makes sure nothing slips through the cracks.
- Youâre a self-starter who loves taking initiative and seeing things through to completion.
- You have the curiosity and desire to learn and grow your skills.
- You take pride in the quality and craftsmanship of your work rather than just doing it to get it done.

## WHAT WE OFFER:
Working for a fast-growing bootstrapped company is a rare opportunity, one we consider a lifestyle choice rather than a job choice. Our positions are challenging, but also come with amazing advantages and fulfillment to those who earn them. Hereâs what we offer.

- Competitive Salary.
- Health Insurance benefits for full-time U.S. employees.
- Flexible Schedule â Work from your home. Weâre spread out all over the world â United States, UK, Czech Republic, Greece, Pakistan, and more.
- We encourage employees to take the time they need for vacation, to stay healthy, and to spend time with friends and family.
- Open maternity/paternity leave. If youâve been with us for 12 months, your leave is fully paid.
- We happily provide or reimburse software youâll need as well as books or courses that promote continued learning.
- We give you the opportunity to solve challenging and meaningful problems that makes a difference.
- Custom Branded laptop at your five year anniversary.
- We cover all costs of company travel (including our annual all-company retreat and mini-team meetups).
- Ability to work with some of the best people in the business through frequent, if not daily, interactions.
- And in case you were wondering: no politics, no b.s., and no jerks.

jobs.content:
Product Manager, Product Designer, Feature Inventor. Newton wants to talk to you!

Newton develops cloud-based, software-as-a-service applicant tracking software for small and medium-sized businesses.

We are looking for a feature inventor! What does that mean? This role will reports to our Head of Products (Steve Hazelton). He is going to ask you to spec, product manage and build a new feature.

What is cool about this job:
This is a job for an inventor. You are perfect for this job if you like software and like building great things that people love. This is not a great job for someone who needs a lot of hand-holding and structure. 

Who will you work with:
You will report directly to our Head of Products. You will work with our design team (currently 1 person, growing) and our engineering team (about 25 people, going to 40 soon).

What you might not like:
We are not sentimental about features: if we don’t need them, we don’t ship them. You very well might design something that will never get implemented. Such is life.

You are a great fit for this role if:

  • If you have taken business workflows / concepts and turned them into software, then you are perfect for this job.

  • If you are good at making complicated things much simpler, then you are perfect for this job.
jobs.title: Product Manager, Product Designer, Feature Inventor.

jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

You're an experienced Front-End Developer and have a strong desire to push boundaries via development. You will help in the creation of innovative products that heavily use latest JavaScript trends and software development best practices. As a Javascript Guru at Sanbrex Digital, you’ll be joining a versatile team of people who are passionate about development and its ability to shape one’s viewpoint of the world. You will get the opportunity to create unique experiences for disruptive projects in financial and entertainment industries.

REQUIREMENTS

The Bare Necessities:

  • Comfortable with building responsive web applications and coding compelling interactions
  • Ability to create marvellous web experiences using UI design
  • At least 3-4 years working in a front-end development or in an in-house software development position
  • Experienced in MEANSTACK Development (Mongo DB, Express, Angular JS, Node JS)
  • Experienced in Javascript Libraries such as Ionic/Cordova, Electron, React Native, Meteor
  • Proven experience in Web and Hybrid Mobile Applications Development
  • Familiarity Front-End languages like (CSS, ActionScript, CoffeeScript, DHTML, XML-Based Languages, XSL, VB Script, Silverlight)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English) - better listening skills!
  • Self-Motivator and past experience in working with remote distributive teams

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Shopify (.Liquid), BigCommerce and Woo-Commerce Platforms
  • Experience with Go, Sass, WebSockets, Casper JS or GitHub

BENEFITS

  • Flexible Hours
  • Tech Allowance
  • Corporate Retreats
  • Work from anywhere in the world
  • Small and focused team that gives a ton of technical freedom
  • Working on a product that no one else has built before, we're waiting for you to leave your mark!

ABOUT SANBREX DIGITAL

Sanbrex Digital is disrupting the way software is built, designed, developed and delivered. We are always two steps ahead of the mobile and web applications revolution; with every new transformation, we have a developer ready to tackle it. The Sanbrex team takes the client’s business and creates a 180 degree flip through ideating, designing, developing and marketing. We design using modern JavaScript frameworks (including Angular 2, React and Node), a development process that is not only driven for User-Experience, but also conveys an intriguing user experience, with less effort than its out-dated counterpart. Our UX/UI experts focus on creating a memorable experience for your customers/clients, compelling each to give your business a double-take. And to perfectly tie the whole project together, our creative geniuses visually entice your audience by making them say WOW. Our goal is to create product platforms that not only puts our client at the forefront in their domain, but keeps them ahead of the game, allowing them to grasp each opportunity that comes their way with confidence!

We are always two steps ahead of the mobile and web applications revolution; with every new transformation, we have a developer ready to tackle it. The Sanbrex team takes the client’s business and creates a 180 degree flip through ideating, designing, developing and marketing. We design using modern JavaScript frameworks (including Angular 2, React and Node), a development process that is not only driven for User-Experience, but also conveys an intriguing user experience, with less effort than its out-dated counterpart. Our UX/UI experts focus on creating a memorable experience for your customers/clients, compelling each to give your business a double-take. And to perfectly tie the whole project together, our creative geniuses visually entice your audience by making them say WOW. Our goal is to create product platforms that not only puts our client at the forefront in their domain, but keeps them ahead of the game, allowing them to grasp each opportunity that comes their way with confidence!

jobs.content:
audibene is an award winning health tech start-up which has grown massively over the last years and is now present in 10 countries and employs over 500 people. Our team is working towards building cutting edge technology that will reshape the hearing care industry and improve the quality of life of many people across the globe. audibene has its headquarters in Berlin, Germany with offices in Miami, Toronto, Kuala Lumpur, Bern, Seoul etc. Join us as we are working towards revolutionizing the hearing aid industry!


 We are looking for a  Senior Java Developer(m/f) to join our experienced cross functional team based in Berlin


About the role:


 We have an experienced and international engineering team and using modern cloud computing technologies that run on AWS. As a Java Engineer you will design, develop, maintain web services of our global cloud IoT platform, building Spring based REST API’s used by internal and external clients. As we are currently building up our teams for a new ambitious project, you will be able to support in shaping and designing the service landscape and contribute to setting the foundation of our platform.


Your key responsibilities:



  • Work closely with developers and other colleagues in a cross functional team (e.g. Product owners, Release engineers and operations) to develop cutting edge software solutions for modern hearing

  • You play a key role in architecting scalable APIs and services supporting applications for our global customers, both B2B and B2C

  • Design, develop and support all phases of the software development life cycle

  • Work creatively and effectively to meet implementation schedules defined by the team and adhere to development goals and principles
jobs.title: Senior Java Developer

jobs.content:
We are looking for someone to help build out the proof of concept for an exciting new website.

This is a directory listing type website so the first stage will be to create the website and basic admin features - create/edit listings individually and upload in bulk as well as other admin section features.  This stage will also include creation of a basic mobile app to view the information. 

The second stage will involve doing some intelligent scraping of information from the web.

The third stage will involve intelligently surfacing results to users.

So this role will suit someone who likes to work individually without granular specifications.  You must also be able to work across the full stack and any UI flair would be a huge advantage. 

You will be the only technical team member on this project and be able to apply a wide range of your technical expertise to this project.

The choice of technologies will be yours but I am partial to Node, React, Python, Go etc.

Initially this is a 3 month project.  I am open for between 20-40 hours per week work.

Skills & Experience:
* At least 3 years in a full stack role
* Excellent English communication skills
* Advance working knowledge of at least two programming languages
* Experience using with one database eg Mysql
* Experience working across the full stack
* Experience creating responsive sites
* Experience creating APIs
* Strong product sense
* UI sensibility
* Experience with AWS

I don't mind where in the world you work from as long as you make yourself available for the occasional Skype meeting at a Sydney friendly time.

You will mainly be working with the founder of 89n - an entrepreneur with a strong technical bent and deep online product experience.

To apply: jobs@89n.com
