jobs.content:
Make a Dent in the Universe by Solving the Number One Problem Faced by Medical Researchers

Helloâweâre Trialfacts, a remote company, and without us, a lot of medical research would not be possible. Weâre searching for an experienced, part-time online advertising team lead to manage and ensure the performance of our online advertising campaigns, while innovating and improving our advertising processes. If youâre looking for a position where you can set your own hours, take holidays as you see fit, work remotely from home or while traveling, and help medical research succeed, then please read on. 

Our clientsâmedical research organizations, are working hard to continue to develop treatments, increase our understanding, eradicate sickness and improve quality of life.

Our companyâTrialfacts, removes the biggest hurdle and frustration to conducting their research, by recruiting the patients they require for their clinical trials, and often times saving the day when they come to us to find the patients they need, or else have their research invalidated. 

Weâre looking for someone who can:

AdvertiseâYouâll need to create, manage and optimize our Facebook advertising campaigns and funnels. This includes complete ownership of the landing pages and multi-page forms we use to collect patient data.

OptimizeâYouâll be managing our campaigns from end to end, and expected to continuously run experiments and evaluate new strategies, processes and technologies to continuously improve performance and CPA. Youâll be expected to contribute to ongoing process and systems improvement, to support efficient campaign setup, efficient client onboarding and CPA improvement.

LearnâIn addition to developing an in-depth understanding of clinical trials generally, youâll also on an ongoing basis need to be able to rapidly develop a thorough understanding of each of our clientâs clinical trials, their concerns, and then use that knowledge to create advertising collateral. If youâre intimidated by medical jargon then you need not apply.

LeadâWeâre looking for someone who will provide leadership in the operations team, and is open to playing a growing leadership role within our small but fast-growing business.

CollaborateâWeâre looking for someone who is not afraid of picking up the phone, calling a client, brainstorming and working towards a solution. Part of this role is to help onboard our new clients, provide updates, as well as solve any client campaign issues that come up.

Whatâs in it for you:

AutonomyâWe donât have set working hours. We donât have a holiday policy (you can take your holidays whenever you want). We donât micromanage or babysit.

Youâll be accountable to the rest of the team purely on your results, and not on the number of hours spent working. Our team is remote (we communicate via Slack and Google Hangouts). We set our own hours based on what works for us and our clients. As long as you have a decent internet connection and can overlap with our clientsâ working hours in the United States and Australia for a phone call, you can work from wherever you choose.

InnovationâWeâre the first and only company in our industry to guarantee our results. Weâve launched innovative patient recruitment strategies (e.g., our phone screening appointment system, researcher interviews) that provide predictability and certainty in a volatile industry, and weâre constantly improving our service.

We apply the same innovative approach to our patient advertising and recruitment process, and our client communication. Weâre currently focused on streamlining and automating client onboarding, education and gathering feedback from our clients, and we're always interested in the latest and greatest software tools and improvements that technology provides.

ImpactâTrialfacts plays an extremely important role in contributing to medical research and driving humanity forward. Our clientsâresearchers working at universities, pharmaceutical companies, biotech companies, natural medicine companies, hospitals and medical practicesâwork hard to develop treatments that cure diseases and improve quality of life.

We are the only company that solves clinical trial recruitment problems in a predictable and reliable wayâour consistent, results-driven process makes us the only recruitment company that provides a money-back guarantee.

OpportunityâWeâre a rapidly growing company, 100% year on year via organic growth through repeat business and referrals. We offer an attractive part-time salary, and the possibility to move into a full-time position and/or leadership role in the business. The future looks optimistic as we continue to improve and expand on our core service.

View the full position description at http://signup.trialfacts.com/advertising-team-lead.

To apply: Complete the job application at https://trialfacts.wufoo.com/forms/m1nk6usf19rh6d2/.
jobs.title: Online Advertising Team Lead (Part-Time)

jobs.content:
JOIN TESERA AND SELL WITH US

We require a uniquely talented and self motivated Account Executive to join our team at Tesera!  Each day you will connect with leads, prospects and clients to create and convert opportunities to sales, as we strive to become the  preferred consulting team for creating data driven applications and integrations in the cloud.

You will support a dynamic team of developers, designers and data scientists while having more time to pursue your passions.  We think we can help make your job easy by running an Agile product management process that our clients love, by working on a modern application stack based on Amazon Web Services (which just opened a Canadian Region), by providing  clients with differentiating User Experiences built on modern web-technology, and by adding value to application investments through expert integration and middleware.  

You will work remotely, have flexible work hours and help us create meaningful and profitable projects. We pride ourselves in learning new technologies and applying that learning to improve the products we create for ourselves and our clients.

Does this sound like the job for you?

WHERE WE NEED YOUR HELP

Our professional services business has largely been made up of recurring clients and referrals.  Weâve never been excellent at managing our sales pipeline, directing our marketing resources, and developing new prospects.  We are motivated to change this and we require your expertise to build and take our professional services to a larger scale.    

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Business to business account development, generating revenue and meeting sales quotas.
  • Managing sales cycles including developing and optimizing a sales pipeline, maintaining pursuit strategies focused on key decision makers, negotiating key deal terms and closing contractual agreements.
  • Developing and qualifying leads to drive additional sales opportunities through cold-calling, networking, and other contact methods (priority).
  • Guide prospects through demos of our approach and products over video call and in person.
  • Direct the team to provide the support materials you require to be successful.

Who are we looking for

  • 2+ years of experience in full-cycle solutions sales.
  • An understanding of selling approaches and methodologies, including value selling, target account selling, solutions selling and strategic selling.
  • Proven track record of exceeding high-volume sales targets for software solutions and services.
  • Experience selling multiple product/service lines.
  • Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles.
  • Skilled and eloquent in writing.
  • Fanatical  about video conference / phone selling.
  • Knowledge of internet applications, data applications, and consulting services.
  • Prior experience at Internet, Consulting or SaaS companies (preferred).
  • Working knowledge of CRM and email automation tools (preferred).

WHAT WE DO:

Tesera is an emerging technology company focusing on three business lines.  Our primary business lines are as follows:

Professional Services has always been a focus for Tesera.  We help our clients implement projects in areas such as open data, data management through visualization and analysis, data science, commercial product development and geospatial solutions.  In the past year our Professional Services teams have completed a variety of projects including building the SaaS platform for an award winning energy services asset management startup, building a set of citizen science mobile monitoring apps, building a new way to share environmental monitoring data, building a sophisticated automated data quality control pipeline for the forest sector, creating a portal for biodiversity monitoring data, and delivering a series of applications to support the Fort McMurray wildfire recovery.  Helping us build and expand this core service area will be your primary responsibility.  

Our second business line is in the adaption to climate change space.  Tesera has worked with a key industry associations to build a risk assessment tool that will support and assist municipalities in discovering asset vulnerabilities.  Tesera is commercializing this product which employs a spatial machine learning approach.  We break the landscape down into thousands of spatial indicators which can then be modeled to determine their influence on event outcomes such as infrastructure failures.  We have a lot of work to do here to bring this to a commercial product offering and we are very excited about doing it.  

High Resolution Inventory Service  (HRIS) is our third business area.  HRIS enables our clients who manage landscapes to have a higher level of resolution and accuracy that theyâve ever had before.  HRIS combines LiDAR, colour infrared imagery, climate indices, terrain indices and ground plot data via machine learning processes to predict attributes about the landscape.  The types of information that can be generated from HRIS are far-ranging from types and quality of timber resources to locations of streams, potential wildlife habitat and amount of carbon sequestration.  The HRIS solution, creates attributes across an  entire landscape creating an inventory that has more useful attributes and is at a more detailed resolution than other approaches available today.  

OUR PURPOSE & VALUES:

âWe disrupt conventional thinking to expand what is possible.

We ignite change in the future we share.â

Accountability:  We hold ourselves, and each other accountable for all we do.
Communication:  We communicate openly and honestly. We listen.  Each is heard and considered.  We share feedback and express gratitude.
Community:  We contribute and lead within communities that empower and inspire us.
Design and Innovation:  We craft elegant solutions using beautiful ideas and innovation.
Fiscal:  We are responsible for our fiscal health and vitality.     
Fun:  We are the spark that triggers awesome.
Health, Fitness and Balance:   Space-Time is ours to define.  We bend work to balance our lives.
Personal Development:   We are driven to learn.  We push each other to expand our horizons.
Relationships:   We build trusting relationships.
Sustainability:  We act in relentless pursuit of a sustainable future.

To apply: We want to hear about how you can help us. Please describe what about Tesera interests you and how you think you can help pursue our purpose and support our values. Please send along the following to Bruce MacArthur, President and CEO at bruce.macarthur@tesera.comA RÃ©sumÃ© - what have you done?A Cover Letter - how can you help Tesera? How does Teseraâs purpose align with you?
jobs.title: Account Executive (Sales)

jobs.content:
Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our Systems Engineering team provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be run anywhere, on anything.


We are currently looking for a Senior QA Automation Engineer to join our QA team to help maintain and evolve our automated test efforts. 


The Senior QA Automation Engineer performs software quality assurance tasks to ensure that developed products and services meet design specifications, are scalable and reliable and meet total quality management criteria and standards. Communicates with product & operations organization regarding test results and works with engineering team as well as with cross-functional teams to interpret feedback into product changes. Documents and reports on software performance issues. Communicates with developers, project managers and other development staff regarding software performance issues and testing processes. Develops test automation scripts and executes both manual and automated testing protocols.


Responsibilities:



  • Review, maintain and evolve current automated tests and test framework.

  • Develop and maintain automation test framework and test cases for functional, performance and regression test execution.

  • Lead development of automation test scripts.

  • Validate and sign off on complex test plans.

  • Execute automated test cases and perform manual test confirmation to validate test results.

  • Contribute to the creation of QA documentation, documents system and framework architectures.

  • Participate in the development of broad technical solutions that meet specifications and that impact future developments.

  • Assist engineering team with the isolation of difficult bugs and root cause analysis.

  • Participate in release activities with DevOps, validate and approve release requirements to confirm successful delivery into production.
jobs.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer

jobs.content:
Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our Systems Engineering team provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be run anywhere, on anything.


We are currently looking for a Software QA Engineer to join our QA team to assist with manual and automated web application testing. 


The Senior QA Engineer performs test planning, test development, manual and automated test execution in support of project release goals and requirements, as well as collaborating with other QA/Development team members to ensure comprehensive test coverage and improve overall product quality.  


Responsibilities: 



  • Define and maintain test plans and test specifications for functional, regression, and performance testing; manual execution of test cases, manual validation of automation failures; reporting product failures.

  • Conduct review and sign-off for test plans and use cases.

  • Take ownership of certain product module QA efforts.

  • Work closely with engineering teams to analyze and resolve product defects.

jobs.content:
Do you thrive on high-quality code?
Hi! We are TidTilForsikring (TimeForInsurance); a Danish startup looking to change the way, people look at insurances. Most people think it's quite a boring (and complex) subject, and a lot of people actually end up having the wrong insurance coverage.

Our goal is to change this. We have developed our first prototype, but now we're looking for more ressources to finish up the product for release.

We want to achieve this goal, by building a tool which uses 'questions' to analyse the situation, that our users are in, and using their answers to generate an insurance package that'll fit perfectly into their lives.

The first prototype has already been built, and is working really well. But to take the prototype to the next level and getting ready for release, we need an extra pair of hands.

TTF was founded in november 2015, and we've spent the past year analyzing the Danish insurance market, to ensure we have the data needed, to build our tool.

About us
We are a currently a small team all located in Denmark.

Jens Christian is the CEO of the company. He's been working for a number of large Danish insurance companies for the past many years and he's the main driving force behind TTF. He's the one analyzing the insurance policies and terms to make sure we have the correct data grounds, while he's also getting our contracts with the insurance companies.

Lasse is our online marketing specialist, and he's previously worked as an OM consultant at one of the largest Danish web bureaus. He's also been an integral part of the business development part, and is in charge of both marketing and on-site optimization.

Lars is the technical lead. He manages the development team consisting of two freelancers, while also participating in the actual development and architecture of the platform.

Other than the three people mentioned above, we have another investor who also has extensive knowledge of the insurance market in Denmark, and acts as an advisor as well as an investor.

What are we looking for?
We are looking for a full-time remote backend developer who takes pride in high-quality, maintainable and pretty code.

Your main tasks will be to further develop the algorithms used to generate the insurance and coverage suggestions. 

You will be a part of the team consisting of Lars and two freelance programmers (a frontender and a backender).

The skill-set of the ideal candidate
The requirements for this position are:

  • PHP (or C#), ninja-level
  • Experience working SOLID
  • REST-experience
  • Git-experience

As a bonus, but not a requirement, it would be a plus if you to have some experience with:

  • Gitflow
  • Microservices

To apply: To apply for the job, you will need to complete a simple assignment and attach it along with your application. The assignment can be found here: http://tidtilforsikring.dk/jobs/assignment.pdf , and should be doable within a reasonable timeframe. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Lars, on lars@tidtilforsikring.dk. The assignment (or link to GitHub/BitBucket) and your application should be sent to lars@tidtilforsikring.dk. Please note that any applications that does not contain a finished assignment, will not be taken into consideration.
jobs.title: Full-Time C# or PHP Backend Developer

jobs.content:
Fishisfast provides people and business around the world with a virtual US address, and allows them the easily buy from US ecommerce.

What separates us from our competitors is our focus on creating a uniquely powerful customer experience. Our service is so powerful and simple that a single use will usually convince a competitor's user to switch permanently. 

Our service has been a long time in the making, and we can serve customer needs like no other in the industry. Now we're ready to expand our service to new markets around the world. So, we are looking for partners to help with international business development.

Because of the nature of our industry, every market has a potentially different set of challenges, opportunities and use cases for a service like ours. Our business development leads will work closely with us to identify these challenges and opportunities and help discover where the things we can do intersect with the needs of a local market.

We will offer an initial 3-month contract during which we lay the groundwork and assess the potential of the region in question, with the option of extending to 6 months where we see promise, and finally becoming a permanent position when the region shows itself to be a viable addition to our supported markets.

We are currently most interested in candidates with a strong research background and deep knowledge of the following areas of the world:

* Russia / Eastern Europe
* South Korea
* Brazil
* India
* Australia and New Zealand
* Spanish-speaking Latin America
* China / Chinese-speaking world
* Japan
* Middle East
* Others (will consider candidates from anywhere)

Our ideal candidates:
* Are able to independently make decisions and implement ideas
* Think strategically
* Take the time to have an informed opinion on key issues
* Are willing to fight to see the right direction taken
* Have experience with an international focus
* Are great written communicators
* Can lead and inspire a diverse team

The successful candidate for this position will:
* Live or have lived in target markets for an extended time (cannot stress this enough)
* Speak the language of the target markets at an advanced business level (native is great, too!)
* Understand the long term opportunities and challenges of our industry
* Have a good understanding of online marketing tools and concepts
* Be highly organized, focused and able to condense large amounts of information down to the most relevant points

At Fishisfast, our team works remotely. The successful candidate will join our remote team and will need to become very familiar with the software we use to plan work and collaborate over long distances (mainly Slack, Basecamp, Asana, Skype, and Google Apps).

To apply: Send a resume and some information about yourself to resume@fishisfast.com
jobs.title: International Business Development for Shipping Service

jobs.content:
Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a front end developer. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that lives in Central or Eastern European countries.

Your main responsibility will be to contribute to the front end systems that our customers are using.

You should have a sense for:
  • Clear and concise JavaScript code
  • HTML and CSS with extensions such as Sass and Less
  • Test Driven Development (TDD)
  • Identifying and optimizing front-end related performance issues
  • Working with agile methodology, such as Scrum
  • Common tools, such as Git
  • Working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should:
  • Have a good sense for graphics and UX
  • Have experience with modern JS frameworks (e.g. Angular, React)
  • Have experience with HTML&CSS frameworks like Twitter Bootstrap
  • Have at least three years of programming background
  • Have an interest in high software quality

Additionally, you:
  • Seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • Inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • Are a passionate developer, proud of the quality of your work
  • Are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • Are able to communicate well in spoken and written English
  • Are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland or Norway for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • Live within the CEE-area (for example Poland, Ukraine, western Russia etc.) - time zones between UTC and UTC+4

Bonus points for:
  • An interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions
  • A university degree in technology, science or other relevant areas

We offer:
  • An opportunity for you to work with, and create, cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence
  • Work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, and ElasticSearch
  • No technical debt
  • Stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • A great and experienced remote team
  • A permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice - range â¬2000 - â¬3000)

To apply: Please send your application together with CV and relevant links (open source contributions, Github/Stack Overflow accounts, public projects, code samples etc.) to Real Audience AB. Please also state clearly in which country you reside and will work from.Email address for applications: aXJlYWxseXdhbnR0b3dvcmt3aXRoeW91@realaudience.se
jobs.title: Front-End Developer with an interest in UX/UI (mid-Level/senior)

jobs.content:
Help us revolutionize E-commerce by building real-time 3D customization tools with a world class team of creative, smart and passionate people in the heart of Berlin!


mycs is changing the way we buy things online. Our vision is to revolutionize E-commerce. All our products are sold using photorealistic, real-time 3D customization tools. In the past, we have built Massivkonzept, the leading online shop for customized furniture. mycs builds on this experience and is currently building a team in Berlin, focusing on building cutting edge technology and improving the E-commerce customer experience.


We are looking for a enthusiastic


Senior JavaScript Developers (AngularJS/Node.js) (m/f)


As one of our Senior JavaScript Developer (m/f) you will play a major role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


YOUR TASKS



  • You design and implement efficient and reusable software and web-applications for our Ecommerce platform with its demanding real-time 3D customization tools

  • You work closely with our international, highly skilled and professional development team in an agile development environment

  • You identify and address performance issues

  • You train yourself continuously to ensure that your skills are up to date


OUR OFFER


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, Kanban, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


For more details: https://de.mycs.com/career

jobs.content:
"Welcome the world in one line of code."


This is the tagline for WOVN.io and it defines our thinking. Simple solutions with global ambitions.


Product


WOVN.io is a website localization service (creating Chinese, Spanish, Dutch etc versions of your website). Our goal is to create the simplest and quickest solution for website localization, without compromising on features. Minimalism is of the utmost importance to us. This means providing as simple an experience as possible for our users without sacrificing quality.


Having recently finished our third round of fundraising we are at a unique and exciting point in our company's history. We are approaching a point of explosive user growth which will require creative engineering solutions to sustain and fuel. To prepare for this, we need passionate, skilled engineers who are ready to take the leap with us into the next chapter!


Team


We are a small and nimble team of about 15 people and contrary to traditional Japanese workplaces, we enjoy a relaxed work environment. Developers choose their own hours, and we don't get in the way of anyone doing their best work. Each developer has a visible impact on WOVN.io and we're creating an environment that gives everyone the opportunity to improve their skills and gain valuable experience. While some of us speak Japanese, this is not a requirement. That being said, from working together many of us have seen great improvements in our Japanese -- and English.


About 60% of our company is made up of developers and roughly half  of us are foreigners living in Japan. Diversity is important to us because our target market is not Japan, but the world. This is why we are focusing on developing solutions for global users.


Technology Stack



  • Ruby on Rails

  • MongoDB

  • Redis

  • Vue.js

  • vanilla javascript


Environment



  • Flexible hours and vacation time

  • Your choice of PC, monitor, keyboard and other work essentials

  • Free language lessons (any language) for all employees
jobs.title: Cultivate your skills on a global team in Tokyo

jobs.content:
Our owl apparently failed to find you, this leaves us with few ways to contact you. Hopefully, we’ve pointed the tractor beam in the right direction. This is the job you are looking for…


A little about us:


We have MagicWords™ (No, really, we do). Our MagicWords™ technology turns every message into a portal to related information. But one does not simply find the relevant words, for that, you need an AI, an AI so advanced, knowing how to administer the Turing test is considered a plus for a role at IDT Messaging.


About you:


We’re looking for a JavaScript developer who has a high initiative stat and can add at least +5 intellect to our team, and the force strong in you must be.


You will work on our MagicWords™ app, in-chat apps, as well as our web-chat, not to mention some truly groundbreaking things we are building in our dungeon. The code must flow.


You:



  • Have an eye for UI and UX for both mobile and web universes.

  • Are at least a Journeyman JavaScript developer/wizard with experience in Stylus or SCSS, Flex-boxes, etc..

  • Are maybe even a full-stack developer?

  • Are capable of growing your own potatoes on Mars.

  • Do not sparkle.

  • Know where your towel is at all times.

  • Have passed the Kobayashi Maru and Voight-Kampff tests.

  • Must know the airspeed velocity of an unladen swallow.

  • Must not be a red-shirt, we’d prefer you come back from lunch in one piece.


What we can provide:



  • Elevenses.

  • Ample gold.

  • A work environment that could, at a push, be considered awesome (at very least, great).

  • Exhilarating chat sessions with Kabouter the AI bot.

  • Answer to the question of life, the universe, and everything.


If you close this ad, nothing will change, if you click the apply button, you stay in wonderland and see how deep the rabbit hole goes.


Please send us your CV and tell us how many of the sci-fi & fantasy references you caught  (and a little about yourself and why you’re applying) in the form below! We promise HAL will behave.


Apply soon, winter is coming!


P.S. We’re not all geeks, just the people writing this ad. Geekiness is about passion and that wedo all have. We want to change the world with our services and if that sounds like something you’d like to do, get in touch.


Our Messaging app is available in an app-store near you, with group conversations, media sharing, cloud storage, and messaging micro-services. Just search for Presto Messaging!

Naturalmotion is looking for a remarkable Technical Director to join its unique, hugely ambitious, and elite Dawn of Titans development team.

Joining at an influential and pivotal time in the game’s development and the team’s evolution, you will be responsible for representing technology at a studio and group level. 

You will be responsible for solving strategic and tactical technical challenges unique to online mobile games, including the sophisticated client-server interactions necessary with always-connected devices; de-risking cross-platform development with broad device performance deltas; guiding product path feature planning; spear-heading R&D on new devices; and ensuring the effective operation of technology in our studio.
jobs.title: Technical Director - 2017's Biggest Mobile Strategy Game

jobs.content:
The NaturalMotion London team have created something truly unique with the Dawn of Titans project and over three years have established one of the most talented teams in the games industry. Our game will bring a console-quality experience to mobile, featuring ground-breaking graphics, an unparalleled collaborative multiplayer environment and an adventure that will retain players for many years to come. In this bold move to position ourselves as a world leader in AAA mobile game development, server infrastructure with undisruptive seamless gameplay becomes the plinth to our success.


We are on the hunt for a world class senior server engineer with expert PHP or Go development skills to join our specialist server team as we approach the launch of a genre disrupting mobile title.

Our small but elite team of server engineers hold over seventy years of coding experience across multiple technical industries, offering high performance from day one and allowing you to reach new levels of coding excellence, always pushing the boundaries of server technology.

What challenges await you?



  • Developing high-performance game logic in a distributed fashion exposed to millions of users.

  • Write robust code that runs on AWS.

  • Maintaining the current code base through its lifecycle over many short development iterations and collaborating with your awesome team to ensure superior quality of code at every step of the journey.

  • Working with our client side games development teams to develop robust extensible systems.

  • Managing the intelligent storage of a huge amount of player and game data.

  • Plan for growth from the infrastructure point of view and solution components accordingly.

  • Improve our games solutions architecture, processes and code base.

  • Operate a live game

  • Keeping the fun - we believe that a team that has fun whilst coding is an essential part of making a fun and engaging experience for our audience.
jobs.title: Senior Server Engineer - 2017's Biggest Mobile Strategy Game

jobs.content:
We're looking for an all round seasoned developer with critical performance experience with multithreading, parallel programming and mass data processing. We create amazing AI, Machine learning products with no countries or language barriers. Cvedia is a free, cloud-based service simplifying image dataset classifications. We give our clients direct access to various public data sources such as ImageNet, COCO, etc, and directly export their filters and augmentations to their local server in the format of their favourite machine learning framework, including Torch, Caffe, TensorFlow, Theano and Deeplearning4J.

Please notice:

  • Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.
  • We will not reply to 3rd party software and HR agencies
  • Please state on the mail subject the job position you are applying for!
Required Qualifications:

PHP 7

Node.js 6+ parallel, multithreaded

C++, node 7 nan library is a plus

Postgres 9.6

Elasticsearch 5, Lucene and/or SOLR

Linux knowledge is a must

Ability to work using existing code and upgrading it

Teamwork

Excellent knowledge of English, speaking & writing

Experience in high-traffic, production environment

Preferred, but not mandatory:

Scripting with perl/shell scripts

RMQ

Memcache, Redis

libVips, libJpeg

OpenCV

Data mining

Neural networks functionality understanding

How should you apply for this job?

Only applications written in English are going to be processed!

Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.

WE will not reply to 3rd party software agencies

Please state on the mail subject the job position you are applying for!

Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.

Application process:

Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.

We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.

1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!

What we offer:

Job location is in Cyberspace.

Communication with the all team members is done through Skype

Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.

Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer

Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)  

If you are interested in working with us, please send your complete CV incl. your last jobs and a list of visible references of web projects (link to github account or zip with non-minified code samples) .

Please send to jobs@cvedia.com

To apply: Send a resume to jobs@cvedia.com

jobs.content:
Codeplay is looking for an engineer to work on development tools, such as performance profilers. This is a C++ development role working on tools to help software developers deliver high-performance graphics or machine vision software on smartphones, virtual reality and (in the near future) self-driving cars.At Codeplay, we produce the software development tools to lower power consumption and increase performance via open standards. To help developers further, we need to be able to improve the ability to analyse how the software is running across a whole System-on-Chip. The successful candidate will be part of a team working on performance analysis tools across several areas, including open-source projects, customer projects, academic collaborations and research.


This role will involve a lot of new platforms, techniques and technologies as part of a team. The relevant candidate will show enthusiasm for working with others to produce tools that help developers work better.


The position will be based at our Head Office in central Edinburgh.


What We Offer



  • Work on exciting brand-new technologies and standards with well-recognized customers

  • A friendly and relaxed working environment where colleagues support each other

  • Knowledge sharing : our staff frequently give company-wide presentations on new software and technology trends, personal projects and other relevant subjects

  • Great career prospects within a growing company

  • Positions are available at various levels, from entry-level Software Engineer to Senior Principal Software Engineer, depending on your skills and experience

  • We develop our employees and provide training in skills such as project and people management, networking and delivering effective presentations

  • Frequent opportunities to attend conferences and developer meetings, represent the company, and become a recognized expert

  • We encourage engineers to progress quickly in their roles, for example to become team leads (for which training in people management and project management is provided)

  • Codeplay has been recognized as an excellent employer and awarded the Silver Level of the Investors in People accreditation

  • Opportunities to get involved with industrial standardisation initiatives such as The Khronos Group and HSA Foundation, and various European research programmes

  • Working on early-stage technology offers opportunities to contribute/shape new hardware/software and standards

  • Flexible working hours, stock options and pension scheme


Salary range (depending on experience) £27,000 to £53,000


See more at: https://www.codeplay.com/company/careers/view.html?id=39#sthash.erV5foYv.dpuf

jobs.content:
Headquarters: Las Vegas, NV, USA
URL: https://brickftp.com/

Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have over 1,900 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each team member like family.  We have 9 full time staff now (plus 3 part time) and we're looking to grow our family by adding a full time designer to our team.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in design, coding, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.

“Most startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.”  
— Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working. That's why we consistently pay above-market rates for talent and are generous with raises and bonuses.

Even though Holacracy is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.  We will take responsibility for ensuring that you quickly learn how to be productive at Action Verb.  We expect that you'll be more productive here than you've been anywhere else.

We believe that building great products requires great infrastructure.  We have Continuous Integration, a full staging environment, and great READMEs across our system.  We built our own application deployment system.  We self-manage our server stack on Amazon EC2 and custom hardware.

We believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our application frontends are built in React.js and Ruby on Rails.  Our eventual goal is to move everything to React.js on the frontend for our large applications, so we are really looking for folks with React experience.

However, as new frameworks come out, we are looking for someone who will stay on top of the latest trends in Javascript development and push us in the right direction.

We believe that the best designers know how to code.  We’re looking for someone who can bring the following things to the table:

  • Experience with web application design, marketing website design, and offline (print) design
  • Comprehensive understanding of UI/UX principles
  • Solid web front-end development skills in HTML, CSS, and Javascript.  Even though we have a great team to help you integrate your designs with our applications, in order to be a great application designer, we expect that you can implement enough Javascript to make your designs come to life (even in a basic way).
  • Ability to prioritize and make decisions without needing to be micromanaged
  • History designing actual SaaS or desktop applications that have seen production usage with real customers.
  • Truly interested in giving our customers a great experience and able to communicate directly with customers and prospects

We believe that open-source only works if companies give back.  If you work on any open-source projects during the course of your work at Action Verb, you are encouraged to submit your improvements as a pull request back to the upstream project.  And if you build something from scratch while working here that’s generic and not related to our core products, we want you to release that on GitHub too.  We’ll also pay your travel costs to any conference where you can get a speaking gig.

We believe that our products will never be finished.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience.  We constantly reach out to our customers to learn about new ways that we can help them get their job done.

Tell us about what you believe.  Please use the link below to send in your application now.  We only read cover letters in our first screening round, so make sure yours counts.  Specifically, we'd like you to address the following topics:

  • What is your level of experience with Holacracy?  Had you heard about it prior to this posting?  Do you have any questions about it?
  • What is your level of experience with a remote team?
  • What would be your ideal focus areas and roles within the company?  (Please understand that our current needs are mostly on the design side, but we always prefer folks with broad areas of interest.)

Important Notes:

  • Since this is a design-focused posting, please also provide portfolio links to things you designed.  Ideally this portfolio will include web applications, marketing websites, and physical print design.
  • Compensation requirements for designers also tend to be all over the map.  Please include your requested salary in the application so we can better understand your application from the start.
  • While we are accepting applications from non-USA applicants, USA-based applicants are strongly preferred for this position.
  • We hope to hear from you (and SEE what you've done)!

To apply: Apply here: http://actionverb.jazz.co/apply/S0OYVR/HolacracyPowered-BrickFTP-Seeks-FullTime-Designer-For-Our-Web-Applications-Reactjs-Marketing-Websites-And-Corporate-Identity Don't use the LinkedIn or Indeed buttons to apply. Make sure you include a great cover letter and a link to a design portfolio that ideally includes both web application and marketing website work. Print work in the portfolio is a bonus too!
jobs.title: Holacracy-Powered BrickFTP Seeks Full-Time Designer For Our Web Applications (React.js), Marketing Websites and Corporate Identity

jobs.content:
Do you absolutely love sales and get excited about the idea of scoring your next commission?

Enjoy learning about and working with software-as-a-service?

Do you speak Japanese (and ideally live in Japan)?

 
If so, we have an awesome, full-time career opportunity at a fun, laid-back American tech company.

Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have over 1,900 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each team member like family.  We have 9 full time staff now (plus 3 part time) and we're looking to grow our family by adding a full time Japanese-speaking Inside Sales and Customer Service/Support professional to our team.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in design, coding, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.

âMost startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.â  
â Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working.

Even though Holacracy is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.  We will take responsibility for ensuring that you quickly learn how to be productive at Action Verb.  We expect that you'll be more productive here than you've been anywhere else.

 

About The Position

Your job will be to handle all Japanese-language sales and customer support requests, as well as any English-language sales or support requests that occur during Japan's normal business hours (aka during our night time in the USA.)

Although this is a sales position, it is not one of those hard-selling, cold-calling types of stressful sales jobs.

You'll be calling and emailing warm leads who have responded to online advertising and would like to be walked through our software products before deciding to buy. Your job is simply to help them understand our software, how it can benefit them, and why they should use our software instead of our competitors.

Basically, you'll be the "face" of our business to all our prospects.

You'll patiently deal with users who don't fully understand our products.  However, most of our customers are highly technical CTOs or IT director-types, so we hope that your time will be spent mostly with high-level customers who understand our products.

You'll have the support of our 6 staff engineers and 5 other sales staff in case the sales calls get too technical.

BrickFTP is an easy product to sell.  Our customers are businesses and the price point is just $49 per month, so this is not a high-pressure sales situation.  Also remember that these are warm leads who opted-in asking for a phone call.

You will also be responsible for front-line customer support in your language/market.  Any issue you can resolve yourself, you'll resolve, and anything else you'll work with our English-speaking support engineers to resolve.  You may have to get on conference calls to translate for our customers if necessary.
 

Here are the details of the Pay.

The base pay is $600-800 per week full time depending on experience, but the exciting part of our compensation structure is a commission of 10% of the annual value of any package that you sell.  The average commission is about $100 and you should be selling several packages per week.  Our salespeople do considerable commissions in addition to their base earnings.

What skills are we looking for?

We are looking for you to have:

  • Perfect phone demeanor and ability to communicate effectively via the phone.
  • Perfect grammar and professional tone via email.
  • Basic understanding of the technical aspects of hosting.
  • Fluency in English and Japanese.
  • Located in Japan ideally or in a similar time zone.
  • Previous experience doing telephone-based inside sales, ideally in a software or technology related business.
  • Ability to wake up early or stay up late to have some overlap with USA hours 2 days a week.  Ability to work weekends is a huge plus.

What makes this opportunity unique?

A really awesome team.  The team includes a strong technical founder and 5 other top technical engineers and operations folks.  We also have a USA-based salesperson and 4 other regional salespeople to help with your sales/support efforts.  We'll have your back and do everything in our power to make your job as easy as possible.

Work from home.  Thereâs nothing we hate more than commuting.  So, we donât have an office and would definitely like to avoid having one for as long as possible.  If you have a family at home, move between locations, or even live abroad, this is a great opportunity to do all your work from home and stop wasting all that time on commuting.   Itâs like getting 2 free hours added back to your day.

Choose your own hours. As long as youâre available to take calls and return calls during the business hours of your market, we're flexible with exactly when you work during the day.  Work 2 hours, then run and take the kids to lunch, come back and work another 3 hours.  We work highly variable hours so weâll be able to sync up no matter when you work.  We do have full team meetings on Tuesdays and Wednesdays at 4pm Eastern Time, and you should ideally be able to make those.

Stability.  Action Verb is bootstrapped, profitable, adequately capitalized, and debt-free.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience and believe that our products will never be âfinished.â

To apply: Apply here: http://actionverb.jazz.co/apply/omoTV3/HolacracyPowered-BrickFTP-Seeks-FullTime-Japanese-Speaking-JapanAsia-Location-Required-Inside-Sales-Customer-Support-Representative(Do not use the LinkedIn or Indeed buttons on that page to apply. We want a non-copy-and-paste submission.)
jobs.title: Holacracy-Powered BrickFTP Seeks Full-Time Japanese Speaking (Japan/Asia timezone) Inside Sales & Customer Support Representative

jobs.content:
HERE is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. Built on 30 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 58 countries. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com or https://company.here.com/here/



HERE, is seeking a talented Sr. Software Engineer to develop feature recognition software which transforms rich vehicle data into next generation content for the Here platform.  In this role the successful candidate will work in a small team with algorithm experts to develop, test, and maintain computer vision and machine learning software applications.  This is an opportunity to work with a talented team of Computer Vision and 3D specialists in delivering solutions to help with HERE's mapping and location intelligence.



Key Responsibilities:


Software development of computer vision and machine learning applications from algorithm prototypes and specifications


Software architecture, design, review, and test


Software refactoring and algorithm re-structuring to improve performance, reuse, and maintainability


Investigation and root cause analysis of software defects


Maintenance of software code repository


Test and deployment of software releases
jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer

jobs.content:
The Institute for Advanced Application (www.geisingeriaa.org) is a national laboratory for healthcare transformation within the Geisinger Health System. IAA is a physician-led think tank, analytic, evaluation, and software development group that seeks to deliver greater value through clinical care model redesign, patient-and-family engagement, and health information technology. The IAA provides a nontraditional environment where bold, out-of-the-box thinking can flourish and where pioneering researchers can explore, define and disseminate new models of healthcare. The IAA is looking for application developers that want to make a difference in healthcare by utilizing their specific talent in order to deliver quality solutions our patients and staff use every day. Talents with UI/UX, back-end programming, database programming, maintenance, architecting, etc can all be utilized and gained from joining the IAA team! Specifically, the IAA team is looking for a Senior Web Application Developer.



JOB SUMMARY:



Reviews, analyzes, modifies, creates, debugs, designs, and tests web applications using modern development methodologies and tools. Provides key insight in design and application architecture discussions. Must be detail orientated, able to do advanced problem solving, understand complex systems and perform thorough problem analysis. Required to maintain continuing education on the ever changing development tool sets. Is a key player on a multidisciplinary team and will engage in all aspects of the application development life-cycle as needed for each project to be successful. Works directly with the business to establish project scope and milestones and ensure the project is meeting the business needs. Is expected to be a self-starter, work with minimal supervision, and coach, and lead the work of others.



Typically reports to a project leader, manager, or director.



MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • *Understands assigned tasks and ask for clarification when necessary.

  • *Works with other technical staff to complete assignments.

  • *Implements code and documents all system changes based on assignments and time lines.

  • *Develops and follows department coding and user interface guidelines.

  • *Provides code review, testing, debugging, technical documentation, general testing instructions, go-live planning, assistance in go-live moves, and post-live support.

  • *Communicates any and all progress, roadblocks, issues to the team and management in a timely manner.

  • *Provides training and documentation to team members on new development assignments.

  • *Trains and mentors staff members.

  • *Performs technical interviews of potential team members.

  • Performs other duties as required or assigned.


    • *Denotes essential functions



    COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:



    Demonstrates strong knowledge of OOP and service oriented architectures.



    Demonstrates strong knowledge in the Microsoft Technology Stack.



    Demonstrates attention to detail and the ability to problem solve through problem analysis.



    Demonstrates strong familiarity with relational database and web development concepts



    Demonstrates the ability to develop effort estimates for tasks within projects.



    Demonstrates the ability to break a project down into manageable and estimate-able tasks.



    Demonstrates the ability to learn independently. Must be able to handle on-call situations and be available 24 hours a day while serving on-call.



    Demonstrates excellent documentation and communication skills.


    Demonstrates the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
jobs.title: Senior Web Application Developer

jobs.content:
About us
Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest growing printing company. We invest heavily in training to make our people successful and want an outstanding training manager to continually improve the effectiveness of our training programs. Our team is 100% remote and we use Lessonly to manage our training content. 

Job description
Develops & maintains training programs primarily to support our customer service, manufacturing & proofing teams. 

Work performed
1. Works with management & employees to identify training needs.
2. Collaborates with subject matter experts to develop training courses.
3. Updates training courses as needed when processes change. 
4. Evaluates training and works to continually enhance effectiveness. 
5. Creates training simulations using Adobe Captivate. 
6. Discusses training effectiveness with employees to identify improvements. 
7. Maintains company knowledge base.

The ideal candidate will be...
1. Willing to travel to work on-site in the factory. 
2. Interested in developing technical training for manufacturing & proofing. 
3. Able to quickly learn & synthesize new topics. 
4. Highly experienced developing corporate training. 

Compensation
1. Salary: $60k - $90k
2. Signing bonus: $10k
3. Health & dental insurance
4. 4 weeks paid vacation
5. Flexible work hours

To apply: Apply online: http://bit.ly/2hp6itX
jobs.title: Training Manager

jobs.content:
In an agile team of operation engineers, you will take part in setting standards to guide and support customers in their use of high performance data warehouse clusters. As an expert in systems administration, integration and automation, you will be their partner from the initial setup to maintaining the operational performance of their cluster systems.


Your role at EXASOL



  • Installation and administration of EXASOL data warehouse clusters

  • Efficient monitoring, change and incident management of internal and external customer systems

  • Investigation and solution of issues in tandem with our product support and the development team.

  • Automation and improvement of the deployment, configuration and reporting processes

  • Translation of customer needs and expectations into technical requirements and solutions

  • Managing and organizing projects and trainings
jobs.title: Operations Engineer

jobs.content:
This isn't some nifty iPhone app that people are going to download once and never use again. We're building the backbone to retail operations. That's over 17 million people in North America alone who could have a less crappy job because we exist. Our software solves a real problem, and the people we're selling to love us for it.

We also believe strongly in personal growth, challenges, and open communication. You will have a strong voice in the company and help influence its direction.. as well as your own. You get to help build a team of people that you love to work with, just as we would hire you if you're someone that we would love to work with.

--

Retailers use archaic, old systems that don't work (think fax machines and voicemails). We're replacing the core operational processes with a modern platform that our customers love. The simplest way to think about it is a task list for every store, managed by headquarters. Help us transform a $4.4 trillion industry and improve the way millions of people work. Major retailers are using Zipline every day, but there is so much more to do!

âI think I just shed a tear. This is great!â â One of our Fortune 100 customers

You will start out being responsible for the core infrastructure and servers. But, you aren't limited to one area of the product. There are a million other things that go into making a full-featured, modern SaaS app. The role will grow and change along with our customer's needs and your interests. Plenty of room to learn, grow, and make an impact.

Our tech stack is PostgreSQL, Ruby, and React.js. Deep understanding of Ruby / Rails is a must so that we can move quickly. However, we are always on the lookout for better ways to get the job done. You will be central to those conversations and influence the direction that we take.

You will help define our culture through hiring decisions, process design, and your personality. You don't need to have experience with management. But, a desire to help your co-workers grow makes a world of difference.

âTerrific founders with technical and domain expertise, totally focused on customer success. Their progress in the first year is amazing.â - One of our investors

Ideally, you are:

- able to distill complex problems into simple, elegant solutions 
- in a senior or leadership position on a large application 
- a developer who cares about the people who use your product 
- a good writer and can back up your opinions with data 
- an even better listener; always looking to expand your knowledge 
- driven to get things done and willing to put in the work 
- experienced with working remotely or managing a remote team 
- interested in the journey of growing a company

To apply: Send an email to careers@retailzipline.com. We have a predisposition for good writers, so a cover letter will go a long way. If you want a head start or if you'd rather talk in code, completing a hiring exercise works for us as well: https://github.com/jhubert/hiring-exercises/tree/master/grouping

jobs.content:
Do you often visit caniuse.com and wish the web were ready? We're looking for a Senior Frontend Developer who's passionate about designing and building offline-first mobile-first user interfaces for every screen.

You believe the web platform is underutilized and that designing a web experience nowadays is more about how it works than how it looks.

You love Little Big Details, perhaps you enjoy designing micro-interactions more than anything else.


Responsibilities



  • Design and build new user interfaces, often from the ground up

  • Deep involvement in product planning with all stakeholders

  • Measure, diagnose and improve product performance

  • Mentor developers and designers to grow a better UI sense
jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer

jobs.content:
Wordfence is responsible for securing over 1 Million active WordPress websites. We are the most popular security product for WordPress publishers by a significant margin. We also help our customers recover from a hacked site.


We are looking for security analysts to join our forensics team. You will assist our customers to investigate how their site was hacked and to repair their site and remove all traces of the intrusion. In addition to this you will also collect evidence from intrusions that will help improve our product. You will need to determine how the intrusion occurred and then collect all IOC’s (indicators of compromise) and share this data with our product team in a structured way.


General requirements:


You must be highly technical and be comfortable with a wide range of open source tools.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


You must work well in a team.


You must be nimble, be able to come up with creative solutions to challenging problems and must have a mature approach to problem solving.


Attention to detail.


Note: Applicants who can work weekends will be given priority consideration.


We are a small, fast moving and fast growing company with a loyal customer base who love our products and services. We have the highest star rating for any WordPress plugin in history and we pride ourselves on providing an excellent product with great customer service that helps secure small and large production websites.


If you're passionate about information security and would like to help secure the web, this is your dream job. We have a friendly, highly capable team with a sense of humor who move fast. We take our team's family time seriously and don't ask you to work long hours if we can avoid it (we almost always can). Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction ­so you can live practically anywhere in the World as long as you have an Internet connection. Wordfence is high growth, but we are not a startup. The company is still controlled by the founders, we are profitable and have been for several years. So you will enjoy the rush of high growth but you won't have to risk working for a company that is controlled by venture capitalists or may not be here tomorrow.
jobs.title: Security Analyst Â­ Forensics Remediation

jobs.content:
The Carina team is looking for a full stack developer to help us build the next platform for Managed Containers at Rackspace. We need a leader to help drive decisions and implement significant portions of the API, control plane and underlying data models for our managed container offerings. Working effectively as a remote employee in a collaborative environment, especially on open-source software, is an absolute must-have skill.

Ideal candidates should have experience with contemporary web frameworks like Python with Flask or Django or Node with Express or Restify. Candidates should also be comfortable with CI/CD pipelines, integrated testing and have a passion for delivering quality products. Experience with modern data stores, including but not limited to Redis, Mongo, MySQL/PostgreSQL/etc, Cassandra, or others is required. Candidates must be able to articulate strengths and weaknesses of different datastores, and be able to express how to define and design schemas in accordance with business objectives.

We also expect candidates to have experience leveraging tools like Ansible, Chef, Puppet, for configuration management and provisioning automation. We make heavy use and need our candidates to be forward-thinking with how we automate our platforms.
jobs.title: Senior Software Developer

jobs.content:
Earn above market rates for successful online PR work, from anywhere in the world, with AMV.

WHO WE ARE:

American Marketing Ventures is looking for experienced PR professionals, guest posters, and blogger influencers with established relationships at well-known publications.

Often referred to as âUber for publicity,â AMV contracts hundreds of publicists who work to fulfill the large demand of online media placements perpetuated by our product Publicity.ai.

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW:

AMVâs publicist network (PubNetâ¢) provides the freedom to work anywhere in world and the flexibility to work when youâd like. Whether you want to work part-time or full-time, AMVâs PubNetâ¢ can provide a work life balance unlike anything seen in the online PR industry.

As long as you are able to put your relationships and PR/research skills to work to weave compelling pitches that fit our clients into the tapestry of stories that get published on authoritative sitesâ¦ and as long as the mention of those clients come with at least a live backlink, no matter if itâs a full feature or just an off-hand reference in a relevant tangentâ¦ then we have the ability to allow you to earn far above market rates for PR work, working from anywhere in the world, on your own time. If you can put up numbers in online PR, then this is your dream job. Period.

We are seeking PR professionals who can (consistently) earn placements within the following publications below. Payouts for coverage in each publication are determined algorithmically through our proprietary analysis of publicity value. jobs.content:
We are The PPC Guys, a virtual agency specializing in pay per click marketing. We are a ~10 person remote team with a strong list of stable, long-term clients. 

Are you a driven, details-obsessed, digital marketing pro? Have you ever lost track of time because you were deep diving analytics data? Do you know how to read SEM sales data and use that knowledge to boost profits for a company? If so, we may have the position for you.

We are seeking a full-time Paid Search Manager who is ready to join a company with strong potential for advancement due to rapid growth. This role helps manage and optimize client accounts on Google AdWords, Bing Ads and Facebook Ads. This is a work from anywhere position, so you will be allowed to work wherever you work best!

Responsibilities:
  • Set-up PPC campaigns across Google Adwords (primary), Bing Ads and Facebook Ads
  • Maintain and optimize existing client PPC advertising accounts. A typical PPC manager will have 6-8 accounts total and will work alongside a project manager from our team
  • Make meaningful, well thought out recommendations to clients that will translate to increased sales for your assigned accounts
  • Proactively come up with ideas to improve accounts, improve client ROI and meet strict CPA goals
  • Work directly with clients by phone, Skype and email to build client relationships (must be able to speak knowledgeably and confidently about PPC strategies and technical PPC tactics)
  • Strong initiative and time management with the ability to manage multiple PPC accounts simultaneously
  • Take the lead on the Paid Ad topics of client calls to cover past results and to suggest improvements
  • A commitment to continued learning in the industry to stay on top of new PPC trends and releases to keep accounts on the cutting edge of PPC; training sessions are an important part of the company culture

Requirements:
  • Must have managed at least 3 Google AdWords client accounts simultaneously for 6+ months; preferably mature accounts with substantial ad spend
  • A keen knowledge of effective SEM media buying strategies which are contingent upon achieving a target CPA
  • Successful conversion-based media buying with Facebook and/or through Googleâs Search/Display network
  • Keyword research and the ability to quickly identify keyword themes (strong understanding of the English language to identify potential high converting keywords and keyword themes)
  • Strong understanding of mobile advertising, including call-only ads (click to call)
  • Google Remarketing/Retargeting with experience setting up and optimizing user audiences
  • Strong skill level in data analysis, strong ability to make educated decisions based on data
  • Intermediate-Advanced knowledge of AdWords Editor
  • Comfort using Microsoft Excel to analyze pay per click advertising data

Bonus for any of the following:
  • Experience in Google Shopping / Bing Shopping set-up and optimization (including product feed set-up and customization)
  • Google Analytics data analysis and customization experience
  • Experience training other account managers or interns
  • Landing Page development/editing experience (Unbounce.com)
  • Graphic design skills (for landing pages and banner ads)
  • Coding experience (enough to place code, make basic edits and check that existing code is placed correctly)
  • If you are Google AdWords certified in any area, send a link to your certification when you apply

Whatâs In It For You?
  • Competitive compensation (dependent on your experience and monthly time commitment)
  • Creative performance incentives
  • Work alongside a team of talented internet marketers, most of whom have been with us for 3+ years
  • Freedom to work when, where, and how you work best
  • You wonât be micro-managed here
  • Work (in your sweats, if you like) from anywhere
  • Gain experience across multiple industries and sectors through our varied client base

This is a 100% remote position; our team is located in 2 countries (USA and Canada) and 3 time zones. 

To apply: Please email careers@theppcguys.com with your cover letter and resume.Please also include a list of 2 Google AdWords features that you are most excited about for in the coming months.
jobs.title: Google AdWords (SEM) Account Manager

Are you a software developer with JavaEE experience? Are you interested in sharing your knowledge with other developers, virtual mentoring, building your personal brand, and earning extra income in the process? Want to partner with one of the fastest growing education companies in the world?


Pluralsight, the leader in online technology training for software developers, is currently looking for individuals to develop and teach online technical courses to subscribers around the world.  We are specifically looking for developers with relevant JavaEE knowledge, passion, and experience.  


As a Pluralsight Author, you'll collaborate with our curriculum and editorial teams to select and develop your own technical course. We'll work together to ensure your course is presented and marketed in the best way possible. Our author positions are freelance/part-time, enabling a very flexible work environment.


Join a community of recognized expert instructors that inspire, teach, and transform lives everyday by helping learners acquire skills that provide career opportunities and advancement.

jobs.content:
What We Do


The team at MapLarge builds cutting edge products for data analytics and visualization to make us safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The Maplarge API provides real time geospatial analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly visualize and publish for data discovery and model testing on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.



Who We Need


Cultural Fit - While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, there are three key traits we require of every team member that really define our team.



  1.  Fun to Work With - Life is short and work should be fun.  

  2.  Extremely Smart - We work on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can both architect and code these systems at the same time while working with a highly intelligent peer group.  

  3. Passionate Engineers - We need people who really love programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in what you do.
