jobs.content:
IT Director

InVision is the world's leading product design platform, powering the future of digital product design through our deep understanding of the dynamics of collaboration. We provide two million people with the power to prototype, review, refine, manage and user test web and mobile products. InVision drives the product design process at leading Fortune 100 companies, including at Disney, IBM, Walmart, Apple, Verizon and General Motors. Backed by Accel, ICONIQ Capital, FirstMark Capital, Tiger Global and others. InVision is a distributed team with over 200 employees around the world.

Mission: This position will play a critical role in establishing InVisionâs internal strategy and policies for the seamless provisioning of equipment and software to more than 200 remote employees worldwide so they can do their jobs effectively and securely. Day-to-day will include management of vendor relationships and logistics, as well hands-on support in a Mac environment. To start, this will be an individual position, but there are numerous opportunities to expand within our rapidly growing organization.

Additional Responsibilities:
  • Provision equipment, software, and services for new hires
  • Ensure that employees receive first-line support when issues arise with hardware/software
  • Pragmatic security prevention to mitigate loss of confidential information and equipment while being mindful of employee productivity
  • Manage vendor relationships, applications, and license renewals
  • Optimize budget and spend for equipment and software

Competencies:
  • Creative operational thinker with good judgment on policy creation
  • Pragmatic with a customer-service mindset
  • Ability to support 200+ remote employees in a fast-paced, startup environment
  • Ability to foster and manage strong vendor relationships
  • Not afraid to roll up sleeves and be hands-on

Background:
  • Experience with procurement of equipment, including managing vendor relationships
  • Experience managing internal helpdesk or third-party vendors for desktop support
  • Ideally experience providing remote support to managed desktops
  • Experience managing seats in corporate accounts (Atlassian, Google Apps, etc.)
  • Support of Mac environments strongly preferred

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs more than 200 team members working remotely in 14 countries around the world. In the United States we have teams including hubs in New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. Among other benefits, we have a flexible vacation policy, unlimited Starbucks cards for each employee, and unlimited books related to your profession.

To apply: Please apply directly online at: https://invision.workable.com/jobs/338901
jobs.title: IT Director

Requisition 35991

About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs (www.zaplabs.com) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogys world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogys leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogys other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

Title: Junior, Front-End Engineer

At ZapLabs, youll join a highly efficient development team with experience in all aspects of web application development - including building the most trafficked real estate brokerage website in the country.  On top of that, were rapidly expanding our mobile presence, on several platforms, with great success.  Thats only half the equation, though, because these powerful consumer applications connect directly to Zap - our industry-leading CRM in the Real Estate sector.  All in all, we are a talented development team working on a dynamic array of products.

What you will do:

You will be co-responsible for continuing the development of our web applications managing packages and tasks, automation, testing, and writing modular and reusable components, which seamlessly integrate into our core apps.

What we are looking for:

You are a talented Front-end Engineer with some experience and demonstrated ability to turn mockups into visually stunning, intuitive, and standards-compliant HTML mobile views.  You are passionate about taking your skills to the next level and excited about delving deeper into HTML5 and other new web technologies.  You have experience, or a whole lot of interest, in mobile web development. You can work independently but thrive in a collaborative, team-oriented environment and have a passion for writing efficient, maintainable, and reusable code.  You have an unwavering commitment to quality, intuitive web interface development, have excellent technical abilities, and a high motivation to work / push for bleeding edge technologies keeping in mind that the final product needs to be stable.

Skills you should have:

-    Expert level HTML5 and CSS3 skills

-    Good knowledge of Javascript

-    Knowledge of AngularJS

-    Some experience with REST APIs and endpoints

-    Some experience with DevTools (multiple browsers and virtual devices)

-    Understanding of Grunt, its tasks, and processes

-    Knowledge of package handling (Bower and NPM)

-    Knowledge of CSS preprocessors (SASS preferred)

-    Some understanding of BEM, Atomic CSS, OOCSS, SMACSS or any other CSS methodology

-    Some knowledge of object-oriented JavaScript

-    Excellent analytical/troubleshooting skills

-    Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Nice to haves:

-    Familiarity with Java/JSP

-    Working knowledge of Unix, and thorough understanding of OSX, iOS and Android

-    Phonegap / Corvoda experience and its frameworks (Ionic, Steroids, etc..) is a must

-    Experience developing mobile web apps, knowledge of idiosyncrasies of OS fragmentation and issues, i.e., scrolling, fixed positioning, etc

-    Front-end templating and MVC

-    A thorough understanding of cross-browser/cross-platform Web Development

Minimum qualifications

-    BS degree in Computer Science related technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications

-    Development experience in JavaScript, Python.

-    Experience with HTML, CSS, and AJAX.

-    Web application development experience

-    Some experience developing user-facing software.

-    Development experience designing object-oriented JavaScript.

-    Knowledge of web libraries and frameworks such as ReactJS, Redux AngularJS, Polymer, and Closure.

As a Senior Java Engineer (Back End) you are responsible for designing and building high performance and scalable solutions that meet the needs of millions of ZapLabs customers. You are a talented, creative, and motivated Senior Java Engineer who loves developing powerful, stable, and intuitive apps.  You enjoy challenging projects involving big data sets are interested in taking your mastery of SQL and Java to a new level.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment, are cool under pressure, and embrace agile development methodologies.  You have strong analytical skills, an unwavering commitment to quality, a collaborative work ethic, and excellent technical skills.

  • Ability to learn new technologies and evaluate multiple technologies to solve a problem
  • Work with product engineers to understand their data pipeline needs and come up with innovative solutions

  • Current experience using Java development, SQL Database systems, and Apache products

About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs (www.zaplabs.com) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogys world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogys leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogys other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

DevOps/Site Reliability Engineer

ZapLabs is looking for a highly motivated DevOps/Site Reliability engineer to help build a modern infrastructure for building, deploying, and monitoring high volume consumer facing web applications along with internal tools and systems.  Youll work on everything from transitioning a good chunk of our infrastructure to AWS, helping us move to a container-based service architecture, and supporting the Big Data infrastructure used by our Data Science team.  You should be passionate engineering and operations (e.g. you read the Netflix and Airbnb engineering blogs with your morning coffee and have a copy of Googles Site Reliability Engineering book on your bedside table) and excel at writing code to automate everything.

Heres what wed expect you to know:

Configuration management tools, preferably Chef.  We have lots of servers and and need to manage them in an automated way.

Basic UNIX/Linux systems administration

How to write good code (data structures, algorithms, etc.)

Be comfortable working in a highly collaborative environment

Solid communication skills

And some other stuff that would give you a leg up:

Continuous integration software, e.g. Jenkins or Bamboo

AWS.  Big part of the plan for the next six months is to move services into AWS.

Resource managers, e.g. Mesos, Kubernetes, Yarn, etc.

Dockerthis is a big part of how were going to be able to scale services and give engineer the tools they need to produce and deploy them.

Distributed messaging systems, e.g. Kafka

Big Data tools, e.g. Spark, Hive, HDFS

1FEE is looking for a WordPress Developer to join its rapidly growing WordPress division! A funded startup since August 2015 and backed by an agency(newmedia) with 20 years of experience, 1FEE.com is bringing the high-end agency experience to small and medium-sized businesses, organizations, and anyone else wanting to make a bigger impact on the web while not breaking the bank. 

WordPress Developers are responsible for ensuring each website is correctly built and delivered to the client. They are responsible for ensuring that all deliverables meet or exceed company baseline standards of performance and quality. WordPress Developers are expected to be problem solvers, with the ability to evaluate several options in order to pick the solution that provides a best fit between clients requirements and the project budget and timeline. WordPress Developers are able to debug and/or modify existing PHP and Javascript. They are highly consultative and help Project Managers and clients make sound decisions on the right path forward. jobs.content: Marymount Manhattan College is hiring a Web Design & Multimedia Specialist in New York
jobs.title: Web Design & Multimedia Specialist

jobs.content:
WayBetter Senior Front End Developer


WayBetter has an exciting opportunity for a passionate, creative Senior Front End Developer to help us tear down our existing monolithic stack and completely rebuild it from the ground up with a modern, mobile-first, service-oriented architecture. This is your chance to build mobile and web apps with modern technology in a greenfield environment.


The WayBetter Way


At WayBetter, our mission is to make getting healthier fun.


Our life-changing games inspire people everywhere to live healthier every day. Our players support and motivate each other while financial incentives hold everyone accountable. Our formula has already helped more than 400,000 people reach their health goals and earn more than $25 Million – it’s based on science and it really works. We’ve created a proven motivational system and we’re excited to change the way people lose weight, stay active, exercise, sleep, quit smoking, and adopt healthier habits. We want your help!


What we're looking for


As our Senior Front End Developer, you’ll be working with a small, growing team of experienced engineers.  You will be responsible for developing the web client and web tier of our products, including the WebView components for mobile apps.  You will also have ample opportunity to aid in the design of our back-end services.  You’ll play a key role in identifying and investigating new technologies, prototyping and testing, and rapid iteration releases.  


Required Qualifications



  • Expertise with JavaScript, React and Node.js in production environments

  • Strong knowledge of HTML5 and web fundamentals (CSS, HTTP,  cookies, security, performance, etc.)

  • Strong relational database knowledge (MySQL, Postgres)

  • Experience with automated testing (writing unit tests)

  • Familiarity with AWS


Preferred Qualifications



  • Experience developing iOS and/or Android apps a major plus

  • Experience with React Native a major plus

  • Experience with micro-service architecture

  • Familiarity with NoSQL

  • Design/UX skills

  • Knowledge of code deployment best practices

  • Experience with Docker

  • Experience with websockets


Compensation and Benefits



  • Generous health care coverage.

  • 401(K)

  • Untracked, flexible vacation policy

  • Paid parental leave

  • Training opportunities

  • Meaningful equity participation

  • A healthy, collaborative, and fun work environment

  • A life outside work


WayBetter? Yes!


We care a lot about our company's culture and apply to our workplace the same principles that successfully power our games: fun, social support, and accountability. We also live by our belief that a healthy work-life balance is vital when it comes to sustainable, long-term success.


We know that when you join a startup you’re investing in that company. Unlike investors who risk other people’s money, you’re investing something more precious: your time. You can feel good about investing in WayBetter. We’ve been around for over five years and have raised over $5 million from successful entrepreneurs with deep pockets (including several billionaires). We were cashflow positive for the first five months of 2016 ... becoming self-funding means we control our own destiny. The bottom line is that we’re building the kind of company we want to work for, one with enduring value, inspiring co-workers, and happy customers.


Want to apply? Please send your portfolio (website, GitHub, app links), resume, and a note that tells us something about you that we can't pick up from your portfolio/resume.
jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer

jobs.content: Phreesia is a leader in healthcare IT, working with our customers to revolutionize their point of service using our innovative platform. To retain our position as market leaders we are continuing to invest heavily in our product and plan to increase our Product team by nearly 50%. jobs.title: Architect

jobs.content:
Can you make a great contribution to the development of our high traffic websites, thanks to your knowledge of Go in a high performance environment?! Do you want to work within a fun, and innovative scrum team and dynamic working environment? Then we are looking for you!


BookerZzz is in the process of completely overhauling their tech stack and we’ve chosen Go as our primary implementation language. We are creating a scalable service architecture to further grow our business. Your role would be to bring in your experience with Go, expand our knowlede on (we’ve been using Go for almost 2 years now), and help bring our products to the next level!


Due to our (inter)national growth, we are looking for an enthusiastic, ambitious and experienced:


Go Developer


What will you focus on?


Together with your colleagues of the Development Team (Golang / PHP), you are responsible for the development of the various and international websites like HotelSpecial.at and Bungalowspecials.


Whether you optimize the commercial frontend, build a new search engine, improve our A/B testing capabilities or implement a new microservice.


Your main task is to (further) develop and maintain the websites and other applications. Progressive techniques and technologies offer you a helping hand. Your activities are varied and challenging whereby you get a lot of responsibility and independency to carry out the projects.


Within the IT department we work with 4 Scrum teams, coached by our own dedicated Scrum Master, three of them are Golang based.



  • Designing, building and maintaining web applications which are serving lots of users every day;

  • Writing new services in Golang;

  • Improving reliability and performance of core components;

  • Develop API endpoints for new features;

  • Shipping new production systems quickly and iteratively;

  • Writing unit tests for all of your code;

  • Actively participate in our Scrum teams.

jobs.content:
We are looking for a full-stack developer to join our core development team. You should be at home working in an agile development environment with a focus on producing quality code via code review and automated testing .

You should be an all rounder, happy to tweak CSS in the front end, get dirty with dev ops, and hack on the backend if necessary. Preferably you are familiar with AWS or you are a very fast learner.

We are completely open to remote opportunities but if you are able to work in one of our offices in Lexington, KY or Lisbon, PT that is a big bonus.

jobs.content:
Read for a new challenge? Up for building a service with top-notch technology and contributing to the migration to a highly scalable microservice-based platform? Then join our team at the foodpanda headquarter in Berlin!

We have built one of the world’s leading online food delivery services in the last four years and are looking now for a forward-thinking, experienced PHP Developer who is eager to create high quality applications.

At foodpanda we are working with PHP5/7, MySQL and Symfony 3.0 on AWS with Docker.

Sounds interesting to you? Well let´s talk then!


Your role



  • Develop innovative application and services in PHP on an enterprise level

  • Design and implement software architecture with focus on high scalability

  • Help clean up and refactor our legacy code base and move it to a modern architecture centered around components, containers and microservices

  • Collaborate within cross-functional and international agile teams

  • Stay up-to-date with current industry trends and promote them within the company
